Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : This letter is a formal Complaint under FEDERAL FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ), 15 USC Sec.

1681-1681y, imposes responsibilities on all persons who furnish information to consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ). These responsibilities are found in Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. Sec 1681s-2, that the Credit Reporting Agency could be reporting Unauthorized and Fraudulent Credit Inquiries by these Original Creditors on my credit report and is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 604 ( a ) ,604 ( b ), 604 ( c ), 609, and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( 8 ) and Fair Credit Billing Act, and Title 15 U.S.C. section 1681b ( a ), 1681b ( b ), 1681b ( c ), All data on My Credit Report must be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY, or By Law can not be on My Credit Report. PERIOD, per Sec 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ).

I recently reviewed my credit report and found unauthorized inquiries.

I contacted the below creditors, and they have NO proof I initiated such inquiries, nor written authorization and have failed to provide any permissible purpose. Since, they do not have my authorization, written nor verbal, I ask that you DELETE these authorized inquiries from my credit report immediately as there is no evidence of any authorization, nor any permissible purpose.

Inquiries are not a matter of record when I never gave these companies access to My credit file!!

According to Section 604 of Fair Credit Reporting Act Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 15 U.S. Code 1681b In general. Subject to subsection ( e ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other.

( F ) otherwise has a legitimate business need for the information i ) in connection with a business transaction that is initiated by the consumer.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, Paragraph ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting shall- ( i ) promptly delete.

The following inquiries are unauthorized.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint AgainsXXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Experian for Violations of 15 USC 1666b, 15 USC 1691, 15 USC 1692c, 12 CFR 1002, and Other Consumer Protection Laws Dear Sir/Madam, I am submitting a formal complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and Experian for multiple violations of federal laws, including 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ), 15 USC 1691 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act ), 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), 12 CFR 1002 ( Regulation B ), and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 ). These violations have caused significant harm to my financial status, disenfranchised me from fair credit opportunities, and infringed on my right to privacy.

Violations of 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ) The credit reporting agencies have failed to provide timely corrections or deletions of disputed information, including negative and outdated entries, closed accounts, and inaccurate addresses. Despite my attempts to resolve these matters, they continue to report incorrect information without following proper procedures under this statute.

Violations of 15 USC 1691 and 12 CFR 1002 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act and Regulation B ) XXXX, XXXX, and Experian have unlawfully shared my personal and financial information with banks, loan companies, and other institutions without my explicit written consent. These actions violate my rights under the ECOA and Regulation B, further restricting my access to credit and loans.

Violations of 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ) These agencies have continued to share inaccurate information with third parties after I explicitly requested they cease such activity. This violates 15 USC 1692c, which governs the conduct of information sharing without the consumers consent, leading to ongoing financial hardship and privacy breaches. 

Violations of 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) XXXX, XXXX, and Experian have failed to comply with key provisions of the FCRA : 1681b They lacked permissible purposes to access or distribute my credit report and provided negative information without my authorization.

1681e They did not follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported, resulting in negative entries that I have previously disputed.

1681c The agencies failed to remove outdated and inaccurate information, including closed accounts and former addresses.

1681n & 1681o These agencies willfully and negligently failed to comply with the FCRA, resulting in ongoing financial harm to me.

Violations of 15 USC 6801 ( XXXX XXXX ) The agencies violated the XXXX XXXX by failing to protect my nonpublic personal information, sharing it with third parties without my explicit consent, and not providing me with the necessary protections outlined under 6801. 

Violations of 15 USC 45 ( FTC Act ) Their actions constitute unfair and deceptive practices under the FTC Act ( 15 USC 45 ). The continued unauthorized dissemination of my negative and inaccurate information to third parties violates this statute.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/2024 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation of Credit Accounts- Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed on my credit report. These accounts have violated my federally protected consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and have infringed upon my right to privacy and confidentiality as outlined under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ). 
The accounts in question are as follows : 1. Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00} while XXXX and Equifax report {$3100.00}. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Varies significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Payment Status Discrepancy : XXXX shows " Unknown, '' whereas the others show " Chargeoff. '' Late Payments : Equifax reports late payments not shown by other bureaus. 


2. Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$700.00}. 
Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. 
Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Account Rating Discrepancy : Equifax shows the account as derogatory, while the other bureaus report it as paid. Late Payments : Equifax reports significantly more late payments than the other bureaus. 

3. Account Name : XXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$2600.00} and {$2100.00}, respectively. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Account Rating Discrepancy : Equifax shows the account as derogatory, while the other bureaus report it as paid. Late Payments : XXXX reports late payments, whereas XXXX and Equifax report none. 



4. Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$3400.00}. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Both XXXX and Equifax report incorrect future dates. Dispute Status Discrepancy : Equifax does not reflect the resolved dispute, unlike XXXX and XXXX. Late Payments : XXXX and Equifax report late payments, whereas XXXX reports none. 
According to 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602 ( a ), I have the right to privacy, which has been compromised by the reporting of these accounts. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681b states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish any account information without my explicit written instructions, which were not provided for the accounts listed above.

Additionally, as per 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes, that predates the report by more than seven years. This stipulation has been ignored in the reporting of these accounts, causing significant harm to my credit profile.

Moreover, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) mandates that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Despite notifying the concerned parties of the inaccuracies in these accounts, the erroneous information continues to be reported, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ).

Given these violations, I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to : 1. Reinvestigate the accounts listed above in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
2. Ensure that any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information is corrected or deleted.

3. Provide me with a copy of the updated credit report reflecting these corrections. 
Please be advised that failure to comply with the FCRA could result in further legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/2024 I received a notification from XXXX stating my credit rating had change. Upon reviewing my XXXX credit report, they had added a collection to my report. 

The notification stated : - I.C. SYSTEM, INC has flagged your account as Collections on XX/XX/2024. 
- Source : XXXX - XXXX : I.C. SYSTEM, INC - Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX - Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX - Activity : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Collections ) - Balance Date : XX/XX/2024 - Balance : {$830.00} The collection was reported by : I C System Inc on behalf of XXXX XXXX for the amount of {$830.00}.

It is a collection that does not belong in my credit report.

Immediately, I filed a dispute to have this collection removed from my credit report to no avail. 

XXXX refuses to remove this false collection from the credit report they publish. 
XXXX, has stopped allowing me the ability to dispute this collection. Unless, I provide documentation for them to consider. 

There is no documentation to provide because this liability is not mine. 

I spoke to XXXX representatives at one point by telephone call to address my dispute, but, we either got disconnected during the phone call or the representative hung up ( I do not know which ). 

During the phone call I asked for XXXX to remove this collection from my credit report and/or to speak to someone in authority to do so. My request was not successful by phone either.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington, DC XXXX Regarding TransUnion 's Reporting Practices Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of information reported by TransUnion regarding my credit history. According to TransUnion, they claim to update information on a daily basis. However, I do not believe this is true in my case. 

I spoke with XXXX Saturday morning regarding an account that I paid off with there company on XX/XX/year>. They have confirmed they sent the updated account information to TransUnion ; however, I have not seen any updates reflected in my credit report. 

This lack of timely and accurate reporting is concerning and affects my creditworthiness. I would appreciate your assistance in investigating this matter further and ensuring that credit reporting agencies adhere to fair practices. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely CFPB If you have any other questions or need further assistance, let me know I see having proper documentation doesn't do any good. Also TransUnion is always behind by 30 days

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it May Concern : I am writing to let you know about an identity theft case that affected my credit report. Upon reviewing my credit report, I discovered fraudulent information that does not belong to me. This identity theft has caused significant harm to my financial credibility and has put me in a difficult situation. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I would like to ask you to block the fraudulent information from my credit report. Section 605B of the FCRA states that credit bureaus are required to block the reporting of fraudulent information resulting from identity theft upon receiving a proper request from the victim. I am also attaching a copy of the Identity Theft Report filed with the Federal Trade Commission as supporting documentation. Please investigate this matter promptly and block the fraudulent information from my credit report to prevent further damage to my credit history. Please provide me with a written confirmation once this has been completed. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your quick help in resolving this issue. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you need any more information. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Also, you are in violation of laws : 15 US Code 1666 ( b ) ; 15 US code 1637 ( a ) ; 15 US Code 1681 ( c ) 2 ; 15 US Code 1681 ( s ) 2. Please delete/block the accounts attached to my FTC report ASAP.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

The list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumers rights to Privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Public record information inaccurate
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Request for Re-investigation and Removal of Incorrect Bankruptcy Listing on Credit Report I am writing to follow up on my previous complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of a bankruptcy on my credit report by [ TRANSUNION ). Despite being verified, the bankruptcy entry remains a clear and direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I urge a thorough re-investigation and immediate removal of this incorrect entry. 
US BANKRUPTCY COURT Account Number : XXXX XXXX. Persistent Inaccuracy Despite Verification : The bankruptcy entry on my credit report is inaccurate. Despite my previous complaint and the so-called verification process, this error persists. This not only causes substantial harm to my financial status but also undermines my rights under the FCRA. 

2. Re-Evaluation of Privacy Rights Under FCRA : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 4 ), I am entitled to privacy and accuracy in my credit reporting. Re-reporting and verifying flawed information without thorough investigation contravene this statutory protection.

3. Questionable Permissible Purpose : According to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies must have a verifiable permissible purpose to disclose my credit information. The maintenance and dissemination of inaccurate bankruptcy information do not meet this requirement and imply a serious oversight in due diligence.

4. Inadequate Re-investigation Process : The current verification does not align with the requirements of 15 U.S. Code S 1681 ( a ), which mandates a comprehensive and meaningful re-investigation of disputed information. The inadequate and superficial verification process has perpetuated this critical error on my credit report.

The persistence of this erroneous bankruptcy entry on my credit report despite prior verification is unacceptable and a clear violation of FCRA. I trust that the CFPB will prioritize this follow-up complaint, enforce compliance with FCRA regulations , and guarantee a swift and fair resolution. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX EQUIFAX Account Type : Credit Card I am writing to you under my rights according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information on my credit report related to the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g., XXXX XXXX  XXXX ], which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  '' XXXX : XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX bXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  '' Equifax : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  '' additionally noting that the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' Furthermore, according to the XXXX report, the account was closed due to inactivity, which is a significant discrepancy compared to the other bureaus that do not mention inactivity as the reason for closure. This inconsistency between the credit bureaus impacts my right to have my information reported accurately and fairly as stipulated by the FCRA under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit bureaus maintain maximum accuracy in the information reported.

Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information regarding credit obligations and payment history, which is not being reflected in this case due to inconsistencies between the different credit bureaus.

I request that, in accordance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and promptly remove the inaccurate information and the charge-off from my credit report, as the discrepancies and errors demonstrate the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and the inaccurate information. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : [ XXXX ] Account Number : [ XXXX ] Date of Charge-Off : [ XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score.

Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ).

Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
XXXX an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX I am filing a complaint regarding incorrect personal information being reported on my credit report. The inaccurate details are affecting my ability to obtain credit and are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c, which requires that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and up-to-date information. 

Despite my previous attempts to correct this, the errors persist, causing ongoing harm to my creditworthiness. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to ensure that the credit reporting agencies correct the inaccurate information on my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to buy impact windows for my apartment. 
Loan was paid every month, no late payments, some extra payments and loan was paid off full by XX/XX/XXXX. At that time the account was reported without issues to the credit bureaus. 
XX/XX/XXXX, 2 months after the account was full paid off, the loan reappeared to TransUnion credit bureau as a new loan and my credit score went down XXXX XXXX. I contacted XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and the loan was : paid off, XXXX XXXX no payments due. I asked them to closed my account and report it closed and in good standing to the Credit Bureaus. The problem was solved ( I believed ) and my credit score went up again. 
Yesterday, XX/XX/XXXX, a year after, the same account reappeared in my TransUnion credit report ( account opened in XXXX and reactivated some how in XXXX, never closed ) and my credit score went down again XXXX XXXX 
I went online to the portal XXXX XXXX XXXX and y account is active, XXXX balance, no payment due. They never closed my account and they are reporting the account like a fresh account to the credit bureau 1 year later. 
This is an ongoing problem for more than a year without proper solution. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is somehow misreporting to the credit bureaus again and again, they should be more responsible.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear debt collector : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) Account # XXXX I have reviewed my Credit Report and found out that you are reporting a debt that I believe is incorrect. I do not recognize the original creditor, the date opened and or the amount of the debt. You can contact me in writing, and provide me with the following information. 

Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but this is a formal notice that your claim is disputed and FULL VALIDATION is requested, under the Fair Debt Collections Practice Act ( FCDPA ) made under 15USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA and section 609 ( a ) ( f ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act ( FCRA ), this is NOT a request for ver ification or proof of my mailing address. Under this federal law I have the right to request a full validation of any debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party responsible for paying this alleged debt and irrefutable proof that there is a contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 

I am asking for this information because I have some questions about the accuracy of this debt. Because of these questions, please consider the debt to be disputed at this time. If you decide to stop the reporting of this debt, and/or forward or return it to another company, please indicate to them that it is disputed, also report to the three credit bureaus that the debt is disputed. 

I respectfully request that your office provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you for this debt. 

Per FCRA regulation, please provide the following information within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for full validation : Name and Address of Alleged Creditor : Name on File of Alleged Debtor : Alleged Account # : Address on File for Alleged Debtor : Amount of alleged debt : The date that this alleged debt became payable : Location and/or venue where the alleged debt was created : Date of original charge off or delinquency : Was this debt assigned to the debt collector or purchased? : Amount paid if the debt was purchased : The agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor : Agreement showing the alleged monthly payments schedule : Address where the alleged account monthly payment was being mailed : Account number or debit card number that was used to make payment ( if any payment was made ) : This request is for complete evidence, proof in the form of document ( s ) showing my signature, a copy of my ID showing my picture, and or showing the date of birth, etc. I made this request following the FDCPA and is made in absolute accordance with Federal Law.

If you fail to provide any of the information or documentation I asked for within the legally required time ( 30 days ), please explain why. If you do not provide it at all and do not adequately explain why I will understand that you are unable to validate or document your claims.

Please also supply the following information below : Details about your authority to collect this debt.

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, explain why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

Why you think I owe the debt, and to whom I owe it, including : The full and legal name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, and the full account number used by that creditor.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from.

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, you can provide a copy of the written agreement with my legible signature and all other pertinent information that created my original requirement to pay. ( Do not just send me a bill, a bill is not sufficient proof that this account was created by me ) If you are asking that I pay a debt that belongs to someone else or someone else was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay.

The amount and age of the debt, specifically : A copy of the last original billing statement sent to me by the original creditor showing my full name and address.

State the amount of the debt when you obtained it when that was, and the detailed amount owed, including late and attorney fees if any.

If there have been any additional interest, fees, or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees, or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law.

If there have been any payments or other increases and/or reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them. 
If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 


Thank you in advance for your response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite my efforts to resolve these issues directly with the credit reporting agencies, the incorrect information persists, and I am seeking your assistance in rectifying these errors.

I have identified the following inaccuracies on my credit report : Incorrect Name ( s ) : Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX, Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX Incorrect Address ( es ) : Address ID # XXXX Incorrect Phone Number ( s ) : ( XXXX ) XXXX - XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Incorrect Employers : XXXX XXXX Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 et seq. ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information they report is accurate and up-to-date. Specifically : FCRA Section 1681i : This section mandates that consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information, and the credit reporting agency must investigate and correct or delete the information if it is found to be inaccurate.

FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : This section requires that credit reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, I received notification from XXXX XXXX entailing that several accounts in my credit report had been removed and renewed without rhyme or reason. This took place within a window period of XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/year>. 

This illegal process inevitably caused my XXXX XXXX XXXX to drop XXXX points causing me financial distress. 

This illegal process of removing a account has a direct effect on the credit report due to its direct effect on the algorithm of age, credit utilization, inquiries etc The account which was removed and reopened as stated on XXXX XXXX were : 1. CURRENT INQUIRIES : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX The XXXX XXXX  report states that the CURRENT account was removed and instantly reopened. 

It still reports as being a closed on XXXX XXXX. While CURRENT has reassured me that such account was never closed from their end. 

However, XXXX XXXX nor TRANSUNION reported the positive balance of the CURRENT credit card payment which would have increased my XXXX XXXX rather reduce its points. 

The XXXX XXXX  report also states that the aforementioned CREDIT INQUIRIES were removed then replaced as new credit inquiries. 

However, when reviewing the accounts mentioned above, all the dates highlight the original date these items was placed on my credit report. This clearly demonstrates that there a manufacturing error deliberately aimed to harm my score. 

These activities listed above has direct effects on the point system of consumers credit reports. I have been directly effected from this causing me to halt my purchase of a vehicle because of the dramatic decline in my score which now sits a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Which ultimately, is a XXXX XXXX per XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
o Whom It May Concern : This letter is being sent to you in response to you reporting the aforementioned account on my credit profile with the credit reporting agencies. 
The following accounts are : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  This is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed. 
Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you claim that I owe you. I am requesting proof that : I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt ; the date of the alleged medical service ; the name of the patient ; and proof that there is some contractual obligation which is binding me to pay this debt. 
Please attach copies of : Any agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt, or proof of acquisition by purchase or assignment, and authorization under subtitle D of the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. APPLICATION OF SECURITY PROVISIONS AND PENALTIES TO BUSINESS ASSOCIATES OF COVERED ENTITIES ; and SEC. 13407 ( 1 ) BREACH OF SECURITY.

The term breach of security means, with respect to unsecured PHR identifiable health information of an individual in a personal health record, acquisition of such information without the authorization of the individual.

Please note that enforcement of penalties against you is covered under the penalty rules of the Omnibus Final Rule effective XX/XX/XXXX interpreting and implementing various provisions of the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act of 2009 ( HITECH Act ) as issued XX/XX/XXXX and the penalty rules of the FCRA and FACTA including FACT Act changes final rules effective XX/XX/XXXX. 
Please also attach copies of any agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor, and, as this is a medical account, a copy of any HIPAA authorization.

Please also be advised that this letter is not only a formal dispute, but a request that you cease and desist any and all collection activities, including reporting of, or verifying of this account on my credit reports.

They have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions. 

I require compliance with the terms and conditions of this letter within ten ( 10 ) calendar days, or a complete withdrawal, in writing, of any claim.

In the event of noncompliance, I reserve the right to file charges and/or complaints with the OCR on your HIPAA violations and appropriate County, State & Federal authorities, the CFPB, XXXX  and State Bar associations for violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and Federal and State statutes on illegal collection activities on any account that may be time-barred as well as violation of XXXX  medical privacy rules .

I also hereby reserve my right to take private civil action against you to recover damages.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX I am filing a complaint regarding incorrect personal information being reported on my credit report. Despite my previous attempts to correct this, the errors persist, causing ongoing harm to my creditworthiness. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to ensure that the credit reporting agencies correct the inaccurate information on my credit report.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e (b)Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.
15 U.S. Code 1681i (5)Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information(A)In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph (1) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or cannot be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli)promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and(ii)promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e (b)Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.
15 U.S. Code 1681i (5)Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information(A)In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph (1) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or cannot be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli)promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and(ii)promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.
 
Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : This letter is a formal Complaint under FEDERAL FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ), 15 USC Sec.

1681-1681y, imposes responsibilities on all persons who furnish information to consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ). These responsibilities are found in Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. Sec 1681s-2, that the Credit Reporting Agency could be reporting Unauthorized and Fraudulent Credit Inquiries by these Original Creditors on my credit report and is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 604 ( a ) ,604 ( b ), 604 ( c ), 609, and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( 8 ) and Fair Credit Billing Act, and Title 15 U.S.C. section 1681b ( a ), 1681b ( b ), 1681b ( c ), All data on My Credit Report must be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY, or By Law can not be on My Credit Report. PERIOD, per Sec 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ).

I recently reviewed my credit report and found unauthorized inquiries.

I contacted the below creditors, and they have NO proof I initiated such inquiries, nor written authorization and have failed to provide any permissible purpose. Since, they do not have my authorization, written nor verbal, I ask that you DELETE these authorized inquiries from my credit report immediately as there is no evidence of any authorization, nor any permissible purpose.

Inquiries are not a matter of record when I never gave these companies access to My credit file!!

According to Section 604 of Fair Credit Reporting Act Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 15 U.S. Code 1681b In general. Subject to subsection ( e ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other.

( F ) otherwise has a legitimate business need for the information i ) in connection with a business transaction that is initiated by the consumer.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, Paragraph ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting shall- ( i ) promptly delete. 

The following inquiries are unauthorized.

Consumer complaint narrative: Around XX/XX/XXXX, my XXXX XXXX  was compromised, leading to unauthorized access to my personal information. Since then, the fraudster has made multiple attempts to apply for credit cards and loans using my details, including my date of birth, Social Security number, and addresses. I recently reviewed my credit report and found numerous unauthorized inquiries from various banking institutions in XXXX and XXXX. Additionally, I have had fraudulent charges on my credit card, and the fraudster has applied for subscriptions that I did not obtain. The merchant is now attempting to collect through a collection agency. I did not apply for these credit cards, loans, or subscriptions, nor did I authorize these institutions or merchants to access my credit report or personal information.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to report multiple fraudulent activities and unauthorized accounts impacting my credit profile. The following issues require investigation and immediate resolution : 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : I did not authorize the opening of this account or any of the charges associated with it. I have no knowledge of this account and request that it be removed from my credit report as a fraudulent account. 

2. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ** : I did not authorize the opening of this credit card account or the transactions made under this account. I am disputing this account and any associated charges, requesting its removal from my credit report as fraudulent. 

3. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : A charge-off for this mobile phone bill appears on my credit report. I did not authorize or initiate this account and dispute the legitimacy of this charge. I request its removal as a fraudulent entry. 

These accounts are clear violations of my consumer rights under the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **, 15 U.S.C. 1681, which entitles me to accurate and fair credit reporting. Under this law, I request that the credit reporting agencies conduct a thorough investigation and delete the aforementioned fraudulent accounts from my credit profile. Additionally, under the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) **, I demand that no further collections or attempts to recover these alleged debts take place, as they are invalid.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I entered into a repayment plan with XXXX XXXX as part of an agreement to bring the amount due to XXXX. 

The payments were done monthly as a agreed via my XXXX Account. 

In total the agreement was 48 monthly payments. 

XXXX payments later, or XXXX months before the account was to be paid full, I received notice that my account was now in collections. 

I contacted XXXX XXXX and indicated that I was just XXXX months away from paying the account off in full, and they agreed by phone to continue accepting the payments and then to report it as such-and in good standing. 

I noticed on my credit report that it has been listed as settle for less than paid in full, last month. I contacted XXXX XXXX to inform them the account was paid in full as agreed and the representative told me she would update the account accordingly. 

I also filed a dispute with the XXXX credit bureaus regarding the incorrect reporting by XXXX XXXX. 

Now on my credit report is has been updated to a charge off. When I paid as agreed. Have proof of payments via my XXXX statements, and an email from XXXX XXXX indicating successful receipt of payments. 

It's unfortunate and disappointing how XXXX XXXX went about doing business. Even more so, to lead clients on regarding payment plans and credit reporting when done as agreed to then give the harshest report when it was repaid as agreed. 

It is not worth the effort to negotiate a full repayment with XXXX XXXX if as agreed it is identified as a charge off. It's best to not repay, let it go to collections and then offer to settle at pennies on the dollar-for the impact a full repayment plan listed as charge off can impact your credit report.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently reviewed my credit profile and noticed inaccuracies and false accusations and fraudulent accounts. I am formally requesting that these be investigated properly with immediacy. This is my second time asking these XXXX XXXX XXXX to remove these collections : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account number : XXXX this account has been paid in full and was paid to agree for it to be removed immediately. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account number : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account number XXXX this account has been paid off and was supposed to be removed immediately as agreed to pay for delete. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Both of these charge offs have already been paid off in full by me as well as when the original creditor sold my information and filed tax without sending me a copy of the 1099 which is required by law. This agency is in violation of 15 USC 1692g. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was not notified. As the original creditor, only I can validate this debt. I do not validate this debt. The reporting of these account ( s ) is/are violations of 15 USC 1681 , and the Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ] : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was never notified as the original creditor, only I can validate this paid debt. Therefore, the following accounts must be deleted from my reports immediately. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) the following accounts, they have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions. I am not liable for this collection they have not provided me with the original contract as I have requested several times. 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( i ) states transactions and experiences between the consumer and the person making the report are not included in the " consumer report ''. By Law, the IRS defines a charge off accounts as cancelled debt that you have to pay taxes on meaning the charge off accounts are now earned income for me the consumer. Collections & Charge offs accounts over {$600.00} reporting to my consumer report is tax fraud. By Law companies are supposed to send me the consumer a copy of the 1099 from the accounts that has been charged off written as loss. The collection is now income by IRS law states that income can not be reported as debt. Please remove this account from my report this is against the law and is considered tax fraud. The account information listed directly above is inaccurate, and I dispute the validity of each. As per the FCRA you must delete all entries to my credit file that can not be proven to be accurate. Likewise, you must provide me with your Method of Verification. You are a partial owner of the eOscar system, which has proven to be unreliable for the intended purpose of my dispute and does not constitute the legally required independent investigation that you must conduct. For clarity, the sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of 1970 which are referenced within this letter are : Section 604, Section 609, Section 611, and Section 623. I will assume that by the very nature of your business, I do not need to provide definitions of what is covered under each of these sections individually. The Information as Shown Below Must Be Investigated Immediately. Failure to Provide Adequate Details, Method Of Verification, Accuracy Of All Dates, Amounts, and other pertinent information will result in the immediate filing of formal complaints with the CFPB and the FTC. I reserve my right to sue you civilly in the court system, which will result in my seeking the maximum allowable penalty for each item. Should I require assistance, it will be sought through an attorney, dependent on your response to this letter. Thank you very much for your cooperation. My ID has been attached as well for verification purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a child support account on my consumer report. The account in question, identified by the account number XXXX, XXXX is being reported with discrepancies across XXXX, Experian, and XXXX, as shown in the attached documentation. Due to these inconsistencies, I believe this account should be removed from my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and relevant case law. This account is also listed 3 times with the the same account number this can not be correct and each consumer agency knows listing this account this way is lower my score on purpose. This account should not be listed three times.

The FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) mandates that furnishers of information provide only accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. In this case, the child support account is being reported differently across multiple agencies. The inconsistent reporting violates the accuracy requirement of the FCRA. Specifically, the account shows different balances, statuses, and payment histories, which create confusion and result in an inaccurate representation of my financial obligations. 

Moreover, under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the court ruled that inaccurate or incomplete credit reporting violates a consumers rights under the FCRA. Since this account is not being reported accurately and consistently, it is imperative that this inaccurate entry be removed to avoid further damage to my credit profile.

I respectfully request that you : 1. Investigate the reported inaccuracies in the child support account.

2. Remove the inaccurate entry from my credit report.

3. Provide written confirmation once the deletion has been completed.

Please consider this a formal dispute under the FCRA, and I expect a full investigation and correction to be completed within 30 days, as required by law. I have enclosed a copy of my credit report with the disputed information highlighted for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution.

XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  To whom it may concern, I have recently pulled my credit report and noticed that there is a collection listing from your agency. 
I have never been notified of this collection action or that I owed the debt. 
This letter is to inform you that I have the right to request a validation of the debt and your ability to collect this money from me. I ask that you indeed the party who is contractually bound to pay off this debt or stop collection activity and remove it all together. 

Please attach copies of the following documents : *Agreement that you have authority to collect alleged Debt *Agreement that bears signature of the alleged debtor with promises to pay the original creditor. 
*Complete payment history on this account, to prove the amount you wish to collect is correct. 

I hope your legal staff will agree that noncompliance with this request will result in serious legal trouble for your company. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I was served with a civil action from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in regard to a debt I owe Citibank. I responded in a prompt and timely manner on XX/XX/year>. I attempted to send a letter to them on XX/XX/year> as well. That letter was returned to me as saying the address was not valid, yet it was listed on all of the legal paperwork as their office in the state of Georgia, where I reside. I kept calling the courthouse because I received nothing in regard to the hearing. I finally was able to get in touch with XXXX XXXX to which they told me I missed my court hearing which was scheduled for XXXX XXXX, and if I was not informed, it was the fault of the courts. I went down to the courthouse and the clerk informed me that they didn't file anything, there was no court hearing set and they had no additional information to give me. I called back XXXX XXXX while I was at the clerk 's office and the representative woman on the phone was very evasive, and wouldn't give me any information as to the supposed court hearing. After multiple attempts, she confirmed that I missed this supposed court hearing. The court clerk, upon hearing that confirmed that there was no court date ever established, and no documents were ever subsequently filed. I asked if they wanted to speak with the clerk as I was at the courthouse and they said they were unable to do so. They say all of these calls are recorded so there will be a record of each of these interactions. I will be reporting their office to the XXXX  XXXX XXXX as well as the Georgia Attorney Generals Consumer Protection Division.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX for Violations of 15 USC 1666b, 15 USC 1691, 15 USC 1692c, 12 CFR 1002, and Other Consumer Protection Laws Dear Sir/Madam, I am submitting a formal complaint against XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX for multiple violations of federal laws, including 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ), 15 USC 1691 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act ), 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), 12 CFR 1002 ( Regulation B ), and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 ). These violations have caused significant harm to my financial status, disenfranchised me from fair credit opportunities, and infringed on my right to privacy.

Violations of 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ) The credit reporting agencies have failed to provide timely corrections or deletions of disputed information, including negative and outdated entries, closed accounts, and inaccurate addresses. Despite my attempts to resolve these matters, they continue to report incorrect information without following proper procedures under this statute. 

Violations of 15 USC 1691 and 12 CFR 1002 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act and Regulation B ) XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX have unlawfully shared my personal and financial information with banks, loan companies, and other institutions without my explicit written consent. These actions violate my rights under the ECOA and Regulation B, further restricting my access to credit and loans. 

Violations of 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ) These agencies have continued to share inaccurate information with third parties after I explicitly requested they cease such activity. This violates 15 USC 1692c, which governs the conduct of information sharing without the consumers consent, leading to ongoing financial hardship and privacy breaches. 

Violations of 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX have failed to comply with key provisions of the FCRA : 1681b They lacked permissible purposes to access or distribute my credit report and provided negative information without my authorization.

1681e They did not follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported, resulting in negative entries that I have previously disputed.

1681c The agencies failed to remove outdated and inaccurate information, including closed accounts and former addresses.

1681n & 1681o These agencies willfully and negligently failed to comply with the FCRA, resulting in ongoing financial harm to me. 
Violations of 15 USC 6801 ( XXXX XXXX ) The agencies violated the XXXX XXXX by failing to protect my nonpublic personal information, sharing it with third parties without my explicit consent, and not providing me with the necessary protections outlined under 6801.

Violations of 15 USC 45 ( FTC Act ) Their actions constitute unfair and deceptive practices under the FTC Act ( 15 USC 45 ). The continued unauthorized dissemination of my negative and inaccurate information to third parties violates this statute.

Sub-issue: Frequent or repeated messages
Consumer complaint narrative:
Genesis Credit Management LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, WA XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Removal of Collection Account from Credit Report Dear Genesis Credit Management LLC, I am writing to formally demand the immediate removal of the collection account referenced below from my credit report. This letter serves as a follow-up to a complaint I filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) on XXXX XXXX XXXX  regarding your continued reporting of this debt in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). The CFPB complaint number is XXXX 

XXXXAccount Information XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX - Amount : {$6100.00} As stated in my previous communication, under section 805 ( c ) of the FDCPA, once a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that they refuse to pay a debt or wish for the debt collector to cease communication, the debt collector must immediately cease all communication, including reporting the debt to credit reporting agencies. The only permissible exceptions to this rule are : XXXX. Advising the consumer that the debt collectors efforts are being terminated ; 2. Notifying the consumer that the debt collector or creditor may invoke specific remedies ordinarily invoked by such debt collectors or creditors ; 3. Where applicable, notifying the consumer that the debt collector or creditor intends to invoke a specific remedy. 

To date, I have not received any such notifications. Despite my prior request and the complaint filed with the CFPB, Genesis Credit Management LLC continues to report this account to credit reporting agencies, which is a clear violation of the FDCPA. 

I demand that you immediately remove this account from all credit reporting agencies and cease any further communication regarding this debt. Failure to comply will result in further legal action, including, but not limited to, escalating my complaint with the CFPB and seeking damages for continued violations of my rights under the FDCPA. 

I expect written confirmation of the account 's removal from my credit report within 15 days. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I applied for the XXXX repayment plan. Due to the terms of the plan, once I was on the plan I should not have accrued interest on my student loans. At this time, my student loan balance was {$190000.00}. 
Due to negligence on the part of EdFinancial, they did not process my application for the XXXX plan. It took months of back-and-forth communication ( during which it seemed that XXXX intentionally delayed communication ) before I finally got placed on the XXXX plan on XX/XX/XXXX. In this time, {$7100.00} of interest had accrued on my loans, bringing my balance to {$200000.00}. Had they processed my application in a timely manner, I would not have accrued any interest. 
After further back-and-forth communication, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX acknowledged wrongdoing and told me that any interest accrued after XX/XX/XXXX would be removed. I was told this on XX/XX/XXXX and have documentation. As of today ( XX/XX/XXXX ), despite further attempts at communication and being told that the interest would be adjusted, the unjustly accrued interest is still present on my account. 
I feel I am being taken advantage of, and that XXXX in intentionally negligent in handling my application and adjusting the accrued interest because it is in their financial interest to do so.

Consumer complaint narrative: I XXXX XXXX am reaching out to the CFPB for help pertaining to FCRA violation ( s ) from the credit reporting agency Experian. I have notified Experian of all these violation ( s ) and issues which I will attach in the following documentation. They have deliberately even after being notified continue to keep reporting misleading, false & inaccurate information on my consumer credit report. This is pertaining to XXXX  XXXX XXXX under account # XXXX for report # XXXX that was generated from the dispute result ( s ) on XXXX XXXX XXXX. Not only is this documentation attached they are reporting 30 day late, 60 day late and a chargeoff remark for a XXXX  XXXX XXXX secured card that was paid in full and this account was never late. Additionally, there is a no data for this period remark for XX/XX/XXXX yet they have posted under balance histories a balance on this credit card yet how is this possible with no data this is severly misleading. To make matters worse for XX/XX/XXXX there was a balance under balance histories of {$3300.00} as being stated on this card yet there was a scheduled payment for {$140.00} and there is no payment ( XXXX ) said being made on this account from XX/XX/XXXX so how did the balance drop {$3000.00} all of a sudden in XXXX of XXXX  if there is no data for this period. Not only is this consumer reporting agency reporting inaccurate information they are reporting an account as charged off, late for 2 months & no data available with a balance history section and payment history section that does not reflect the status of the account or the right information pertaining to this XXXX  XXXX XXXX account that was never late and paid on time. Additionally, this account is a secured credit card meaning type of credit card that requires a one-time, refundable security deposit from the cardholder. So not only was this my money not only did I not get my security deposit back this account is reporting delinquent when it was never delinquent as I am the original creditor and my money was what allowed this account to exist. The way that it was reporting before the dispute and after the dispute is still affecting my credit for the worse and if the account is paid and closed under status how is this account charged-off XXXX and if the account is closed why is there no closed remark under payment history if status of the account says paid and closed. To make matters worse it says {$3300.00} was written off but there was no written off balance if the account was paid and closed XXXX  There is a multitde of issues with this account reporting and if this account isn't furnished properly with the payment history, balance histories, and status I will look to file a lawsuit in federal court aganist Experian for their violation of my consumer right ( s ). They did not notify me of how this information was verified upon request or that an investigation was underway and/or when it closed.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear debt collector : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) Account # XXXX I have reviewed my Credit Report and found out that you are reporting a debt that I believe is incorrect. I do not recognize the original creditor, the date opened and or the amount of the debt. You can contact me in writing, and provide me with the following information. 

Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but this is a formal notice that your claim is disputed and FULL VALIDATION is requested, under the Fair Debt Collections Practice Act ( FCDPA ) made under 15USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA and section 609 ( a ) ( f ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act ( FCRA ), this is NOT a request for ver ification or proof of my mailing address. Under this federal law I have the right to request a full validation of any debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party responsible for paying this alleged debt and irrefutable proof that there is a contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 

I am asking for this information because I have some questions about the accuracy of this debt. Because of these questions, please consider the debt to be disputed at this time. If you decide to stop the reporting of this debt, and/or forward or return it to another company, please indicate to them that it is disputed, also report to the three credit bureaus that the debt is disputed.

I respectfully request that your office provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you for this debt.

Per FCRA regulation, please provide the following information within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for full validation : Name and Address of Alleged Creditor : Name on File of Alleged Debtor : Alleged Account # : Address on File for Alleged Debtor : Amount of alleged debt : The date that this alleged debt became payable : Location and/or venue where the alleged debt was created : Date of original charge off or delinquency : Was this debt assigned to the debt collector or purchased? : Amount paid if the debt was purchased : The agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor : Agreement showing the alleged monthly payments schedule : Address where the alleged account monthly payment was being mailed : Account number or debit card number that was used to make payment ( if any payment was made ) : This request is for complete evidence, proof in the form of document ( XXXX ) showing my signature, a copy of my ID showing my picture, and or showing the date of birth, etc. I made this request following the FDCPA and is made in absolute accordance with Federal Law.

If you fail to provide any of the information or documentation I asked for within the legally required time ( 30 days ), please explain why. If you do not provide it at all and do not adequately explain why I will understand that you are unable to validate or document your claims.

Please also supply the following information below : Details about your authority to collect this debt.

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, explain why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

Why you think I owe the debt, and to whom I owe it, including : The full and legal name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, and the full account number used by that creditor.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from.

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, you can provide a copy of the written agreement with my legible signature and all other pertinent information that created my original requirement to pay. ( Do not just send me a bill, a bill is not sufficient proof that this account was created by me ) If you are asking that I pay a debt that belongs to someone else or someone else was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The amount and age of the debt, specifically : A copy of the last original billing statement sent to me by the original creditor showing my full name and address. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it when that was, and the detailed amount owed, including late and attorney fees if any. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees, or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees, or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other increases and/or reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them. 
If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 


Thank you in advance for your response.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 168b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act has violated my rights. 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions. Moreover, these accounts violate debt collections, and abusive and unfair practices per section 1692f ( 1 ) adding additional amounts. 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. ) Privacy Act considerations. A delinquent debt may not be reported under this section unless a notice issued pursuant to the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. 552a ( e ) ( 4 ), authorizes the disclosure of information about the debtor to a credit bureau. The Privacy Act of 1974 is a federal law that governs our collection and use of records we maintain on you in a system of records. A system of records is any grouping of information about an individual under the control of a Federal agency from which information is retrievable by personal identifiers, such as name, social security number, or other identifying number or symbol. Under the Privacy Act, Federal agencies may not disclose information without consent unless certain exceptions apply to the disclosure. The Privacy Act provides protections to individuals in three primary ways. It provides individuals with : the right to request their records, subject to Privacy Act exemptions ; the right to request a change to their records that are not accurate, relevant, timely or complete ; and the right to be protected against unwarranted invasion of their privacy resulting from the collection, maintenance, use, and disclosure of their personal information. ( b ) CONDITIONS OF DISCLOSURE.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communica- tion to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record 15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) Notice requirements Opt out ( 1 ) In generalA financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; 5 U.S. Code 552a - Records maintained on individuals ( i ) make any correction of any portion thereof which the individual believes is not accurate, relevant, timely, or complete ; or n ) Mailing Lists. An individuals name and address may not be sold or rented by an agency unless such action is specifically authorized by law. 16 CFR 313.3 ( 1 ) Nonaffiliated third party means any person except : ( ii ) A person employed jointly by you and any company that is not your affiliate ( but nonaffiliated third partyincludes the other company that jointly employs the person ). ( 2 ) Nonaffiliated third party includes any company that is an affiliate by virtue of your or your affiliate 's direct or indirect ownership or control of the company in conducting merchant banking or investment banking activities of the type 16 cfr 313.3 states ( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party, if you make such a disclosure other than as authorized by 313.14 and 313.15. 1 ) You do not disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party, 15 U.S. Code 1601- Congressional findings and declaration of purpose It is the purpose of this subchapter to assure a meaningful disclosure of credit terms so that the consumer will be able to compare more readily the various credit terms available to him and avoid the uninformed use of credit, and to protect the consumer against inaccurate and unfair credit billing and credit card practices. 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( u ) Reseller.The term reseller means a consumer reporting agency that ( 1 ) assembles and merges information contained in the database of another consumer reporting agency or multiple consumer reporting agencies concerning any consumer for purposes of furnishing such information to any third party, to the extent of such activities ; and ( 2 ) does not maintain a database of the assembled or merged information from which new consumer reports are produced. debit card ( 3 ) Debit card.
