Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian Subject : Notice of Dispute for Failure to Investigate and Breach of Performance FINAL NOTICE I am writing to formally notify Experian of several violations of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) in connection with a dispute I previously filed and the failure of your company to properly address and investigate the matter. 

On or about XX/XX/year>, I sent Experian an Affidavit of Truth, outlining my demands concerning the inaccurate information present in my credit report. Not only did Experian fail to meet the demands of this Affidavit, but I did not receive a proper response to the dispute within the required timeframe. This lack of response constitutes a **breach of performance** on your part, as well as a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 

**FCRA Violations : ** 1. **Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : ** Experian has failed to conduct a reasonable investigation as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ). Despite the submission of my Affidavit of Truth, you have not properly investigated or responded to my dispute.

2. **Failure to Provide Verification Information : ** Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ) ( iii ), Experian is required to provide the name and contact information of the person or entity that allegedly verified the disputed information. I have not received any such information, which further demonstrates a failure to comply with the FCRA.

3. **Reporting of Inaccurate Information : ** The data in question, provided by a third-party data furnisher, continues to be reported inaccurately, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). This data furnisher is a third party, and third-party information is by definition " hearsay '' unless verified by proper sources.

The " data furnisher '' is an **interloper**, a party not authorized to be involved in my personal credit matters. As defined, an interloper is someone who becomes involved in a place or situation where they are neither wanted nor belong. The data furnisher has no lawful standing to report any information on my credit report, as there is no contract or agreement with my signature authorizing such reporting. Furthermore, there is **no court order** permitting this information to be included in my report, and I have not authorized any release of my personal information in writing. 

In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit addressed key issues related to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The case dealt with the responsibility of a data furnisher ( XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) to correct inaccurate credit information after being notified of a dispute by a credit reporting agency ( CRA ).

Experians failure to comply with these obligations under the FCRA is unacceptable. I demand that the inaccurate information in question be immediately extracted from my credit report. I also request that you provide the name and contact details of the person who allegedly verified the disputed information. 

Failure to respond and act in accordance with your obligations under the FCRA will leave me no choice but to pursue all available legal remedies to enforce my rights. 

This notice is supported by recent legal actions against Experian, such as the class action lawsuit settled for {$22.00} XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX, U.S. District Court for the Central District of California ) , where Experian was found to have violated FCRA by continuing to report inaccurate information despite consumer disputes. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a response within the legally mandated timeframe.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I noted an unauthorized charge on my business account while reconciling my business checking account in XXXX, XXXX. An unauthorized charge in the amount of {$43.00} payable to " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ( said charge being made with a debit card ) appeared on my online banking statement. I phoned my financial institution to get the details but they could not tell me much - other than what was already provided on my statement. They said they would look into and respond. I received correspondence from my financial institution dated XX/XX/XXXX wherein they refused to reimburse my account for the {$43.00} and stating that if I had any further information or documentation to send it to them and they would review. 

Based on that letter, I contacted the company - XXXX - and they could not tell me much either since a debit card was used to make the purchase vs. a credit card. However, what I did discover was that the charge was made in person, at a XXXX  store located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Minnesota XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a letter to my financial institution ( via fax to their main bank as per their correspondence ) that stated as follows : " I am in receipt of your correspondence dated XX/XX/XXXX ( copy attached ), regarding the recent transaction charged to XXXX XXXX, XXXX business checking account ending in XXXX in the amount of {$43.00} made to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX as per the line item in my online banking account. 

In response to that correspondence and in further support of my claim, I would show the following : ( 1 ) This charge was purportedly made with a debit card ending in XXXX. I do not now, nor have I ever been in possession of said debit card. 
( 2 ) Further to this, to receive XXXX-specific discounts, I always use my XXXX credit card ending in XXXX to make all purchases at XXXX. To support this, attached is a XXXX of all of my activity at XXXX since XXXX of XXXX. 
( 3 ) The debit card in question ending in XXXX is not now nor has ever been associated with my target account as confirmed in the e-chat I had with a XXXX agent on XX/XX/XXXX ( see transcript attached, emphasis added ). 
( 4 ) According to the same e-chat I had with a Target agent on XX/XX/XXXX, this charge was made at the XXXX  store located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Minnesota XXXX ( see transcript attached, emphasis added ). I was not in XXXX XXXX, Minnesota on the date the charge was made, nor have I ever been to XXXX XXXX, Minnesota ( nor any other part of Minnesota ) in my entire life. In furtherance of this, I am employed by the XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, XXXX  and was working on the day in question ( see timecard attached ). 

Regarding the debit card ending in XXXX ( if such a card exists ), please cancel it immediately so as not to be used by anyone attempting to commit additional fraud. In addition, please cancel the debit card associated with my personal account ending in XXXX  and associated with my personal checking account ending in XXXX, effectively immediately ( I have surrendered the debit card associated with my personal account to a representative at the Regions branch located on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX of even date herewith ). '' Finally, I asked my financial institution to refund the {$43.00} to my business account and advised that if they did not, I would contact the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. As of the date of this official complaint, I have not heard anything from the bank regarding this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau : Experian Account Type : Credit Card I am writing to you under my rights according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information on my credit report related to the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g., XXXX XXXX XXXX ], which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) : XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$2700.00} Current balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' Experian : Highest reported balance : XXXX XXXXCurrent balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$2600.00} Current balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' additionally noting that the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' Furthermore, according to the Experian report, the account was closed due to inactivity, which is a significant discrepancy compared to the other bureaus that do not mention inactivity as the reason for closure. This inconsistency between the credit bureaus impacts my right to have my information reported accurately and fairly as stipulated by the FCRA under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit bureaus maintain maximum accuracy in the information reported.

Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information regarding credit obligations and payment history, which is not being reflected in this case due to inconsistencies between the different credit bureaus. 

I request that, in accordance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and promptly remove the inaccurate information and the charge-off from my credit report, as the discrepancies and errors demonstrate the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report high lighting the discrepancies and the inaccurate information. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX Experian Account Type : Credit Card I am writing under my rights granted by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information that appears on my credit report regarding the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ], which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) : XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$4200.00} Current balance owed : {$4100.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' Experian : Highest reported balance : {$0.00} Current balance owed : {$4100.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' It also states that the account was closed due to inactivity. 

XXXX : Highest reported balance XXXX XXXX XXXXCurrent balance owed : XXXX XXXXPayment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' and notes the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' These discrepancies show significant inconsistencies between the credit bureaus, particularly in regard to the high balance amounts and account closure reasons. According to Experian, the account was closed due to inactivity, while XXXX indicates it was reported as a loss by the creditor. Furthermore, XXXX provides different information about the high balance. This inconsistency violates the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), which mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. 

Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information about my credit obligations and payment history, which is currently not being accurately reflected due to these discrepancies between the credit bureaus.

I am requesting that, in compliance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and remove the inaccurate information, including the charge-off, from my credit report. The conflicting data between the bureaus demonstrates the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and inaccurate information for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently looked at my Experian credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. Account name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported that I was late XXXX and XXXX of XXXX  which is inaccurate because I indeed paid those months. As according to the fair credit reporting act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And accord

ing to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are
suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian- Consumer Reporting Agency 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 


XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I would like to forge forward with a righted disputation that I see you currently have on my consumer report, possibly causing violating infringements and injury to my credibility. Eradicate any and all of these following unproven genuine, FCRA compliant, and or applicable standards of reporting of which you are undoubtedly mandated in your reporting obligation ( s ) to obey without default or deficiency of any sort. 

The FCRA 's permissible purpose provisions are thus central to the statute 's protection of consumer privacy. 

In accord with 5 U.S. Code 552a - Records maintained on individuals ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be. 

15 U.S. Code 1681- Congressional findings and statement of purpose ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. 

( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers.

( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.

15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( d ) Consumer Report. 

( 1 ) In general.The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; 12 CFR Part 1022 - Fair Credit Reporting ( Regulation V ) FCRA section 607 ( a ) requires that consumer reporting companies, among other things, must require that prospective users of consumer reports certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. 

Consumers suffer harm when consumer reporting agencies provide consumer reports to persons who are not authorized to receive the information or when recipients of consumer reports obtain or use such reports for purposes other than permissible purposes. These harms include the invasion of my ' privacy, as well as reputational, emotional, physical, and economic harms. 

12 CFR Part 1022 - Fair Credit Reporting ( Regulation V ) permissible purpose provisions to the protection of consumer privacy, the Bureau is issuing this advisory opinion to affirm that consumer reporting agencies may not provide a consumer report pursuant to FCRA section 604 ( a ) under any circumstance not expressly permitted by this section. 

A consumer reporting company may not provide a consumer report under FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) unless it has reason to believe that the user has a permissible purpose with respect to the consumer about whom the report is requested. A user 's request to a consumer reporting company for a report about a consumer does not give the consumer reporting company a reason to believe that the user has a permissible purpose to obtain a consumer report about other consumers. As explained in part I.A, Congress enacted the FCRA in part to address a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with... a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. 

FCRA section 619 imposes criminal liability on any person who knowingly and willfully obtains information on a consumer from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses.

The Privacy Act of 1974, 5 U.S.C. 552a, protects individuals ' personal information from unwarranted invasions of privacy. 

( g ) ( 1 ) Civil Remedies.Whenever any agency ( A ) makes a determination under subsection ( d ) ( 3 ) of this section not to amend an individuals record in accordance with his request, or fails to make such review in conformity with that subsection ; the individual may bring a civil action against the agency, and the district courts of the United States shall have jurisdiction in the matters under the provisions of this subsection. 

( 4 ) In any suit brought under the provisions of subsection ( g ) ( 1 ) ( C ) or ( D ) of this section in which the court determines that the agency acted in a manner which was intentional or willful, the United States shall be liable to the individual in an amount equal to the sum of ( A ) actual damages sustained by the individual as a result of the refusal or failure, but in no case shall a person entitled to recovery receive less than the sum of {$1000.00} The enforcement of the regulations prescribed there under shell be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number:XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off.Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper.

I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX REQUEST TO REMOVE UNAUTHORIZED CREDIT INQUIRY To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the following information in my file. I recently received a copy of my credit report, and I notice there is an unauthorized credit inquiry made by the company listed above. To my knowledge, I have not signed any documents authorizing the company in question to view my credit report. The listed inquiry was without authorization, and for no legitimate business purposes. As such, it is a very serious error in reporting. I never authorized such action, and this constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act 604 as well as a violation of my rights to privacy. I am requesting your credit bureau to initiate an investigation and to determine responsible parties in this unauthorized credit inquiry. As part of your investigation, please send the names, business addresses, and phone numbers of those who made unauthorized credit inquiries so I may contact them directly. In addition, I respectfully request a copy of any documents authorizing credit inquiry, and signed on my behalf, so that I may verify its validity. If you find that I was not the one who authorized this inquiry, I ask that it be removed immediately from my credit file. Please be so kind as to forward me documentation that you have had the unauthorized inquiry removed. If you find that I am in error, then please send me proof of this. Finally, I am requesting an updated copy of my credit report, which should be sent to the address listed above. According to the provisions of 612 ( 15 USC 1681j ), there should be no charge for this report. Your immediate attention to this matter Is appreciated XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXThese discrepancies violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates that consumer reporting agencies, like Experian, maintain accurate and verified information. According to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( e ) ( 6 ), Experian is required to uphold a joint notification system with other consumer reporting agencies to ensure the consistency and accuracy of credit reports. However, the differences between my Experian report and those from other agencies suggest non-compliance with this requirement.

The inaccuracies on my Experian report have significantly harmed my creditworthiness and financial health. Under the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccurate information and request its removal if it can not be substantiated. Should Experian fail to provide documented evidence authorizing the listing of the disputed items, I demand their immediate removal, irrespective of any E-Oscar report.

Furthermore, despite multiple requests, Experian has failed to provide me with my consumer file, distinct from a consumer report, which contains securitized consumer data.

I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action to rectify these violations promptly. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and keep me informed of any developments regarding its resolution.

XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this pre-arbitration demand in continuation of my previous dispute regarding the inaccurate information on my credit report. Despite my initial communication and your acknowledgment of the dispute, the disputed items have not been adequately resolved. Therefore, I am compelled to escalate the matter and request a resolution through arbitration, as provided for in Experians arbitration agreement.

I am aware that under Experians arbitration agreement, Experian is responsible for paying half of the arbitration fee. However, considering the substantial costs associated with the arbitration process, I am providing Experian with an opportunity to avoid these expenses altogether. In addition to the request for a comprehensive investigation and resolution of the disputed items, I propose the following settlement offer : XXXX. Pay me the full arbitration initiation fee : the initiation fee for arbitration ( for the corporation ), as outlined by the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) guidelines, typically exceeds {$4000.00}. To settle this matter expeditiously and avoid the significant costs and time involved in formal arbitration proceedings, I request that Experian pay me the full amount of the arbitration initiation fee. 
I believe that this settlement offer reflects a fair and reasonable resolution, taking into account the costs Experian would otherwise incur during the arbitration process. Accepting this offer would spare both parties the financial burden and extensive time commitment associated with formal arbitration. 
Potential Costs of Arbitration : Should this dispute not be resolved amicably, please be aware of the following potential costs associated with arbitration : Arbitration Filing Fees : [ {$4000.00} ] Legal Fees : [ {$10000.00} ] Administrative Costs : [ XXXX ] Time and Effort Compensation : Possible claim amount of {$5000.00} for time spent addressing the dispute. 

Total Potential Costs : [ {$20000.00} ] The initiation of arbitration can incur significant costs, which I am fully aware of. However, to avoid the expense and inconvenience of arbitration for both parties, I am prepared to settle this matter with the following one-time offer : Settlement Amount : [ {$4000.00} ] Removal of the following Inaccurate accounts from My Credit Report Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX {$1200.00} Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX {$980.00} Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX {$5500.00} Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Furthermore, it is important to note that should Experian decline this settlement offer XXXX I will pursue the arbitration process as provided for in Experians arbitration agreement. In that event, I will seek appropriate remedies, including but not limited to compensatory damages for financial hardship, emotional distress, and any other damages resulting from the inaccuracies on my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services
Sub-issue: Problem canceling credit monitoring or identify theft protection service
Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the Polaris letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently reviewed my credit profile and noticed inaccuracies and false accusations and fraudulent accounts. I am formally requesting that these be investigated properly with immediacy. This is my second time asking these credit agencies XXXX to remove these collections : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account number : XXXX this account has been paid in full and was paid to agree for it to be removed immediately. 
WAKEFIELD & ASSOCIATES, Original creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, Account number : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account number XXXX this account has been paid off and was supposed to be removed immediately as agreed to pay for delete. 
XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Both of these charge offs have already been paid off in full by me as well as when the original creditor sold my information and filed tax without sending me a copy of the 1099 which is required by law. This agency is in violation of 15 USC 1692g. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was not notified. As the original creditor, only I can validate this debt. I do not validate this debt. The reporting of these account ( s ) is/are violations of 15 USC 1681 , and the Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ] : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was never notified as the original creditor, only I can validate this paid debt. Therefore, the following accounts must be deleted from my reports immediately. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) the following accounts, they have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions. I am not liable for this collection they have not provided me with the original contract as I have requested several times. 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( i ) states transactions and experiences between the consumer and the person making the report are not included in the " consumer report ''. By Law, the IRS defines a charge off accounts as cancelled debt that you have to pay taxes on meaning the charge off accounts are now earned income for me the consumer. Collections & Charge offs accounts over {$600.00} reporting to my consumer report is tax fraud. By Law companies are supposed to send me the consumer a copy of the 1099 from the accounts that has been charged off written as loss. The collection is now income by IRS law states that income can not be reported as debt. Please remove this account from my report this is against the law and is considered tax fraud. The account information listed directly above is inaccurate, and I dispute the validity of each. As per the FCRA you must delete all entries to my credit file that can not be proven to be accurate. Likewise, you must provide me with your Method of Verification. You are a partial owner of the XXXX system, which has proven to be unreliable for the intended purpose of my dispute and does not constitute the legally required independent investigation that you must conduct. For clarity, the sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of 1970 which are referenced within this letter are : Section 604, Section 609, Section 611, and Section 623. I will assume that by the very nature of your business, I do not need to provide definitions of what is covered under each of these sections individually. The Information as Shown Below Must Be Investigated Immediately. Failure to Provide Adequate Details, Method Of Verification, Accuracy Of All Dates, Amounts, and other pertinent information will result in the immediate filing of formal complaints with the CFPB and the FTC. I reserve my right to sue you civilly in the court system, which will result in my seeking the maximum allowable penalty for each item. Should I require assistance, it will be sought through an attorney, dependent on your response to this letter. Thank you very much for your cooperation. My ID has been attached as well for verification purposes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting of Car Loans Not Belonging to Me Dear Experian, I am writing to dispute two inaccurate entries on my credit report that do not belong to me. These two accounts are negatively affecting my credit and are erroneous. Below are the details of the accounts I am disputing : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX. Dispute of Ownership of Accounts : I am not associated with these loans and have never held an account with XXXXXXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX XXXX. I did not apply for, open, or authorize any loans or credit transactions with these entities. Therefore, the reporting of these accounts on my credit file is inaccurate and a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

XXXX. Request for Verification and Immediate Removal : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I am requesting a thorough investigation and verification of these accounts. Please provide documentation that shows that I am responsible for these accounts. If no such documentation exists, I request the immediate deletion of these accounts from my credit report. 

XXXX. Identity Verification : Enclosed you will find a copy of my government-issued ID, proof of address, and a copy of my Social Security card to confirm my identity and ensure this dispute is properly processed. 

As you are required by law, I expect that you will complete your investigation and respond within the 30-day time frame prescribed by the FCRA. Should you fail to remove these erroneous accounts, I will be forced to escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and explore further legal options.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving confirmation of the removal of these inaccuracies from my credit report.

Per 15 USC1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA allows consumers to recover up to {$1000.00} 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports I am challenging any hard inquires or unauthorized accounts without a permissible purpose. 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments Also I noticed some incorrect personal information being reported on my credit which I am demanding to be correct immediately! Please be advised that failure to comply with the FCRA and Metro 2 standards will result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies for noncompliance. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a response within the time frame prescribed by the FCRA ( 30 days ). You can contact me via the information listed above if further details are required. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am writing to formally request the removal of several unauthorized accounts and inquiries from my credit report. These accounts and inquiries are not associated with me, and I did not authorize their inclusion on my report. The presence of these inaccuracies is the result of a data breach that has adversely affected my credit standing, leading to a significant drop in my XXXX score.

It is imperative that my credit report accurately reflects my financial history and activities. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Consumer Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  To : Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TX XXXX Subject : Urgent Request for Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Information from Credit Report Dear Experian, I am writing to request your immediate intervention to block and remove fraudulent information from my credit report, as mandated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This fraudulent information, resulting from identity theft, has been substantiated by an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit that I have filed. It is imperative that Experian acts promptly to resolve this matter in accordance with federal law.

Importance of FTC Affidavit and Immediate Action : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : I have provided an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit ( FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX ) to prove that the entries in question are the result of identity theft. This affidavit is a crucial document that validates the fraudulent nature of these accounts and necessitates their immediate removal from my credit report. 

Compliance with FCRA : Under the FCRA, Experian is required to block fraudulent information from my credit report within 4 business days of receiving an identity theft report. Given the seriousness of identity theft, I request that you expedite this process to ensure compliance with the law and protect my creditworthiness.

Legal Requirements and Urgency : FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Requires the blocking of fraudulent information within 4 business days. Please ensure that all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries are removed promptly.

FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Stipulates that disputed information must be deleted if it can not be verified within 30 days. Please investigate and resolve these disputes without delay.

FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) : Ensures that unverifiable information is deleted and does not reappear on the credit report. This is crucial to prevent any further impact on my credit score.

FCRA 616 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681o ) : Provides for civil liability for willful and negligent non-compliance, emphasizing the need for timely and accurate action. 

Fraudulent Entries to be Blocked : Personal Credit Card with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened On : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Account Number : XXXX Personal Credit Card with XXXX XXXX  Opened On : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX These fraudulent accounts have also led to several unauthorized hard inquiries and collections entries on my credit report. 

Supporting Documentation : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX Immediate Block of Fraudulent Entries : Block all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries from my credit report within 4 business days. Given the urgency of this matter, I request that you expedite this process to uphold consumer rights and prevent further harm to my credit. 

Verification Details : If any of these accounts are verified, provide detailed verification information as required under FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) within 30 days, including the contact information for the data furnisher. 

Deletion if Verification Fails : If you are unable to verify the information, delete it from my credit report within 30 days and ensure it does not reappear, as mandated by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ).

Prohibition Against Reappearance : Ensure that these fraudulent entries are permanently removed and do not reappear on my credit report. 

Please send all written confirmation and documentation to my email address : XXXX 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I trust that Experian will act promptly to resolve these issues in compliance with federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

Please remove the following items from my credit report, immediately : Experian*** XXXX XXXX XXXX Open Date opened XX/XX/XXXX {$300.00} XXXX  XXXX open Date opened XX/XX/XXXX {$100.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Open Date opened XX/XX/XXXX {$730.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Open Date opened XX/XX/XXXX {$720.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX Closed StatusAccount charged off. {$180.00} written off Date opened XX/XX/XXXX Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
My initial awareness of unauthorized inquiries on my credit report became known to me as I ran across a headline on my XXXX news feed where another data breach had occured. Taking that event into consideration, I went about checking on my credit to see if there was any errors that was unbeknowst to me during that time. Upon doing so, I had noticed there were several inquiries that I had no knowledge of nor had given each of those financial institutions any permission to pull my credit at any point in my life so far. With this information in hand, I sent out a letter by certified mail to Experian on XX/XX/year> in which I stated that there were erroneous inquiries on my credit report that did not have permissable permission from me to exist on my credit report. Additionally, I requested that those listed inquiries be investigated and removed due to them being unauthorized by me. ( please see attached letter that was sent ). I patiently waited 30 days per FCRA rules for a response and never received one. Recently, on XX/XX/year>, I opened my Experian app to track my credit growth and progress to which point I discovered XXXX new hard inquiries that are titled as follows : " XXXX XXXX, '' " XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX '' and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. '' I do not know who the associated financial institutions are nor do I give authorized permission for them to pull my credit for any purposes. 
I've given Experian more than alloted time per FCRA rules to properly investigate and rectify these errors and yet there hasn't been any resolve rendered. In mention of this, I had in turn send them yet another certified letter on XX/XX/year> ( please see attached ) in which I requested resolution to be executed for failure to comply with FCRA policy to which they are governed by for not responding in 30 days. Experian 's failure to execute their responsibilities of adherence to consumer law and FCRA policies have now created ongoing negative impact on my life and additionally, they have developed civil liability per occurence for how they've carried out this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the Experian credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a personal mobile phone account opened at XXXX XXXX on XXXX, XXXX under the account number ( XXXX ) with a balance of ( {$3200.00} ). This account have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer XXXX credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer XXXX credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Escrow, taxes, or insurance
Consumer complaint narrative: I reached out a few months ago as loan care had not paid my homeowners insurance for the year that they had had my loan. upon reaching out to them they told me that there was no money in my escrow account for the insurance and if I wanted them to pay it, I would need to pay about {$1200.00}. I told them that on my closing paperwork it shows that I am paying homeowners insurance each month to go into an escrow account to be paid by them. For weeks different employees would tell me that I was misinformed and there was nothing they could do. Finally, I talked with an employee who saw my closing paperwork, admitted they were wrong and said they would have it fixed right away. They then paid my homeowners insurance from escrow and I never heard back. It is now two months later, my property taxes have not gone up Since the last time loan care increase my payment {$100.00} to account for the property tax increase. Yet, when I went to pay this month, it shows that I am now paying additionally into an escrow account for my homeowners insurance. This is the exact amount they told me I would have to pay when they all said I was not paying in the first place. Through all this, I never received a check for what would have been left over As the gentleman I got my mortgage through in the first place said I should have been if they werent paying my insurance. As he set my paperwork up and knew That the homeowners insurance was in fact set up to go into an escrow account. Loan care doing this shows that they miss allocated my funds in the first place, Did not disperse them back to me, and has now raised my payments again to cover the mistake they made in the first place. This company is practicing in bad faith, seems to be misallocating funds, and is overall robbing their clients. The below documents show how they have continues to increase my payments now 3 times, with only one increase being due to property tax increase.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring that Equifax honors their commitment and promptly releases the compensation I am owed. Thank you for your kind attention to this matter! My claim Number is : # XXXX  Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Beginning in XX/XX/XXXX, I notified my apartment complex, XXXX XXXX XXXX, that I would be moving out a few days earlier than listed on my lease. I communicated that I noticed that the amount owed for rent listed on my account did not reflect the prorated amount discussed and promised by my apartment. I was told via email to not worry, and they would fix it. I emailed 2 more times about this in XX/XX/XXXX. 

The next series of emails regarded a final request for an accurate amount to be paid to the apartment complex, but I did not hear back from anyone. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a bill for the correct amount after a couple of months of silence and no communication regarding the return of my security deposit. 

I communicated to my apartment that I did not feel this was scrupulous on their part, as I had moved on assuming that they wrote me off due to the lack of communication, along with 3 separate incidents regarding car theft and break ins on site. 

I did not receive any communication from my apartment complex in months to follow, but received my first collections notice in the spring of XXXX. I began contacting XXXX XXXX XXXX and finally received a responsive phonecall from a leasing manager on XX/XX/XXXX. This manager agreed that the money was too late to collect and said she would take care of the balance and contact the collections agency on my behalf. I assumed this is what occurred, until I received yet another collections notice in XX/XX/XXXX. I assumed it was erroneous, but I responded to the email and said the apartment complex already addressed this and I do not owe any money. I also reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX and forwarded the collections email and asked them to follow up. I never received communication back. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, the collections notice is visible on my credit card account, and it is fraudulent based on negligence of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) staff. I am formally disputing the balance as of today, XX/XX/XXXX.
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : [ XXXX ] Account Number : [ XXXX ] Date of Charge-Off : [ XX/XX/2018 It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. 
Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ).

Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
Trequest an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it May Concern : I am writing to let you know about an identity theft case that affected my credit report. Upon reviewing my credit report, I discovered fraudulent information that does not belong to me. This identity theft has caused significant harm to my financial credibility and has put me in a difficult situation. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I would like to ask you to block the fraudulent information from my credit report. Section 605B of the FCRA states that credit bureaus are required to block the reporting of fraudulent information resulting from identity theft upon receiving a proper request from the victim. I am also attaching a copy of the Identity Theft Report filed with the Federal Trade Commission as supporting documentation. Please investigate this matter promptly and block the fraudulent information from my credit report to prevent further damage to my credit history. Please provide me with a written confirmation once this has been completed. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your quick help in resolving this issue. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you need any more information. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX, you are in violation of laws : 15 US Code 1666 ( b ) ; 15 US code 1637 ( a ) ; 15 US Code 1681 ( c ) 2 ; 15 US Code 1681 ( s ) 2. Please delete/block the accounts attached to my FTC report ASAP.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and list of Inquiries. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the Polaris letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX SPRING, TX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Request for Reinvestigation of Credit Accounts- Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the following accounts listed on my credit report. These accounts have violated my federally protected consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and have infringed upon my right to privacy and confidentiality as outlined under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ). 
The accounts in question are as follows : XXXX. Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00} while XXXX and Equifax report {$3100.00}. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Varies significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Payment Status Discrepancy : XXXX shows " Unknown, '' whereas the others show " Chargeoff. '' Late Payments : Equifax reports late payments not shown by other bureaus. 


XXXX. Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$700.00}. 
Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. 
Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Account Rating Discrepancy : Equifax shows the account as derogatory, while the other bureaus report it as paid. Late Payments : Equifax reports significantly more late payments than the other bureaus. 

XXXX. Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$2600.00} and {$2100.00}, respectively. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Equifax reports an incorrect future date. Account Rating Discrepancy : Equifax shows the account as derogatory, while the other bureaus report it as paid. Late Payments : XXXX reports late payments, whereas XXXX and Equifax report none. 



XXXX. Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : # XXXX High Balance Discrepancy : XXXX shows {$0.00}, while XXXX and Equifax report {$3400.00}. Date of Last Activity Discrepancy : Dates vary significantly between bureaus. Date Reported Error : Both XXXX and Equifax report incorrect future dates. Dispute Status Discrepancy : Equifax does not reflect the resolved dispute, unlike XXXX and XXXX. Late Payments : XXXX and Equifax report late payments, whereas XXXX reports none. 
According to 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602 ( a ), I have the right to privacy, which has been compromised by the reporting of these accounts. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681b states that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish any account information without my explicit written instructions, which were not provided for the accounts listed above.

Additionally, as per 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), no consumer reporting agency may include any adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes, that predates the report by more than seven years. This stipulation has been ignored in the reporting of these accounts, causing significant harm to my credit profile.

Moreover, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) mandates that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Despite notifying the concerned parties of the inaccuracies in these accounts, the erroneous information continues to be reported, in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ). 
Given these violations, I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to : XXXX. Reinvestigate the accounts listed above in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
XXXX. Ensure that any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information is corrected or deleted. 
XXXX. Provide me with a copy of the updated credit report reflecting these corrections. 
Please be advised that failure to comply with the FCRA could result in further legal action to protect my rights as a consumer. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I entered into a repayment plan with Capital One as part of an agreement to bring the amount due to XXXX. 

The payments were done monthly as a agreed via my XXXX Account. 

In total the agreement was 48 monthly payments. 

XXXX payments later, or XXXX months before the account was to be paid full, I received notice that my account was now in collections. 

I contacted Capital One and indicated that I was just XXXX months away from paying the account off in full, and they agreed by phone to continue accepting the payments and then to report it as such-and in good standing. 

I noticed on my credit report that it has been listed as settle for less than paid in full, last month. I contacted Capital One to inform them the account was paid in full as agreed and the representative told me she would update the account accordingly. 

I also filed a dispute with the XXXX credit bureaus regarding the incorrect reporting by Capital One. 

Now on my credit report is has been updated to a charge off. When I paid as agreed. Have proof of payments via my XXXX statements, and an email from Capital One indicating successful receipt of payments. 

It's unfortunate and disappointing how Capital One went about doing business. Even more so, to lead clients on regarding payment plans and credit reporting when done as agreed to then give the harshest report when it was repaid as agreed. 

It is not worth the effort to negotiate a full repayment with Capital One if as agreed it is identified as a charge off. It's best to not repay, let it go to collections and then offer to settle at pennies on the dollar-for the impact a full repayment plan listed as charge off can impact your credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have written dispute letters three different times, to each credit bureau, and each time they reply with a new credit report stating that the account with USAA has been Verified as accurate and updated.

Re : Formal Dispute Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602, Section 604, and 15 U.S.C. 1666b This dispute is made under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), specifically Sections 602 and 604, as well as 15 U.S.C. 1666b ( Fair Credit Billing Act - Crediting of Payments ).

Basis for Dispute : 1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 : Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act establishes the need for credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate and fair credit reporting practices. The disputed information on my credit report is inaccurate and does not reflect the actual status of my account. This misinformation is damaging to my credit profile and violates the standards of accuracy required by law.

2. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 : Section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regulates the permissible purposes for which a consumer report can be accessed. If this dispute involves unauthorized credit inquiries, these inquiries were not made with my consent or for a permissible purpose under the FCRA. These inquiries should not have been included on my credit report.

3. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1666b ( Fair Credit Billing Act - Crediting of Payments ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, payments must be credited to an account on the date of receipt. The payment listed on my account was not credited promptly, resulting in [ e.g., a late fee, increased interest, or a negative impact on my credit score ]. This delay is in violation of the Fair Credit Billing Act.

4. PAANL ( Principle of Accuracy and Non-Discrimination in Lending ) : The Principle of Accuracy and Non-Discrimination in Lending emphasizes that all information reported on consumer credit reports must be both accurate and free from bias or discrimination. The inaccurate or mishandled information in question violates these principles, potentially leading to unfair lending practices against me.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number:XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off.Under the FCRA, XXXXredit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : This statute prohibits the furnishing of any information to a consumer reporting agency that is known to be inaccurate or has not been verified. 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy : The statute emphasizes the need for consumer reporting agencies to handle consumer information with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. This has not been upheld in my case.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security XXXX : XXXX Consumer Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX Subject : Urgent Request for Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Information from Credit Report Dear Equifax XXXX I am contacting you to request immediate action to block and remove fraudulent information from my credit report. This information, resulting from identity theft, has been substantiated by an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit that I have filed. It is essential that Equifax complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and addresses this issue urgently. 

Importance of FTC Affidavit and Immediate Action : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : I have submitted an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit ( FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX ) to confirm that the entries in question are fraudulent and a result of identity theft. This affidavit is a critical document that validates the fraudulent nature of these accounts and necessitates their immediate removal from my credit report. 

FCRA Compliance : As per the FCRA, Equifax is required to block fraudulent information from my credit report within 4 business days of receiving an identity theft report. I urge you to expedite this process to comply with the law and safeguard my credit.

Legal Requirements and Urgency : FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Requires blocking of fraudulent information within 4 business days. Please ensure that all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries are removed promptly.

FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Mandates that disputed information must be deleted if it can not be verified within 30 days. Investigate and resolve these disputes promptly.

FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) : Ensures that unverifiable information is deleted and does not reappear on the credit report. This is crucial to prevent further damage to my credit.

FCRA 616 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681o ) : Provides for civil liability for willful and negligent non-compliance, stressing the importance of timely and accurate action. 

Fraudulent Entries to be Blocked : Personal Credit Card with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened On : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Personal Credit Card with XXXX Bank Opened On : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX These fraudulent accounts have also led to several unauthorized hard inquiries and collections entries on my credit report. 

Supporting Documentation : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX XXXX Credit Report : Showing the fraudulent entries, inquiries, and collections Demands for Relief : Immediate Block of Fraudulent Entries : Block all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries from my credit report within 4 business days. Given the urgency, I request that you expedite this process to uphold consumer rights and prevent further harm.

Verification Details : If any of these accounts are verified, provide detailed verification information as required under FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) within 30 days, including the contact information for the data furnisher.

Deletion if Verification Fails : If you are unable to verify the information, delete it from my credit report within 30 days and ensure it does not reappear, as mandated by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ).

Prohibition Against Reappearance : Ensure that these fraudulent entries are permanently removed and do not reappear on my credit report. 

Please send all written confirmation and documentation to my email address : XXXX. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I trust that Equifax will act promptly to resolve these issues in accordance with federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding unauthorized and unrecognizable inquiries made to my credit report by TransUnion. These inquiries were made without my knowledge, consent, or permissible purpose, which is a clear violation of my consumer rights as protected under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ).

Violations of the FCRA Pursuant to the FCRA, unauthorized inquiries violate several provisions : 15 U.S.C. 1681b Permissible purposes of consumer reports. These inquiries were made without my explicit consent, violating the permissible purpose requirement.

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance. This violation of my rights appears to have been willful, given the lack of any valid authorization on my part.

15 U.S.C. 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance. Alternatively, if this inquiry was due to negligence, TransUnion and the entity responsible for the inquiry must still be held accountable.

15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 Identity theft prevention. I am entitled to protections against identity theft, which includes safeguards against unauthorized access to my credit file.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 Responsibilities of furnishers of information. The inquiry should have been thoroughly verified before being reported. TransUnion has failed in this responsibility.

Violation of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Under 15 U.S.C. 6802-6805, I have the right to opt-out of sharing my nonpublic personal information with third parties. The unauthorized inquiry is in direct violation of these provisions, as I did not grant permission for my information to be shared or accessed by any third party.

Privacy Act of 1974 and ECOA Violations In addition to the above violations, the unauthorized inquiry breaches the Privacy Act of 1974 by mishandling my private information, and the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), which requires fair and non-discriminatory access to credit information.

FTC Report Filed I have already reported this issue to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) on [ XX/XX/XXXX ], and my case number is [ XXXX ]. This report further substantiates my claim that my identity may have been compromised, and unauthorized activity has occurred on my credit report.

Request for Immediate Action I request the CFPBs intervention to ensure that TransUnion immediately removes these unauthorized and unrecognizable inquiries from my credit report. Their actions have impacted my creditworthiness, and this issue needs urgent attention.

I trust that the CFPB will thoroughly investigate this matter and take all necessary steps to ensure my rights are upheld. Please keep me informed of your progress regarding this complaint.

Thank you for your attention to this important matter. I look forward to your prompt resolution of this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. 
Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ).

Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
