Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear debt collector : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) Account # XXXX I have reviewed my Credit Report and found out that you are reporting a debt that I believe is incorrect. I do not recognize the original creditor, the date opened and or the amount of the debt. You can contact me in writing, and provide me with the following information. 

Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but this is a formal notice that your claim is disputed and FULL VALIDATION is requested, under the Fair Debt Collections Practice Act ( FCDPA ) made under 15USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA and section 609 ( a ) ( f ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Report Act ( FCRA ), this is NOT a request for ver ification or proof of my mailing address. Under this federal law I have the right to request a full validation of any debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party responsible for paying this alleged debt and irrefutable proof that there is a contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 

I am asking for this information because I have some questions about the accuracy of this debt. Because of these questions, please consider the debt to be disputed at this time. If you decide to stop the reporting of this debt, and/or forward or return it to another company, please indicate to them that it is disputed, also report to the three credit bureaus that the debt is disputed.

I respectfully request that your office provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you for this debt. 

Per FCRA regulation, please provide the following information within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for full validation : Name and Address of Alleged Creditor : Name on File of Alleged Debtor : Alleged Account # : Address on File for Alleged Debtor : Amount of alleged debt : The date that this alleged debt became payable : Location and/or venue where the alleged debt was created : Date of original charge off or delinquency : Was this debt assigned to the debt collector or purchased? : Amount paid if the debt was purchased : The agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor : Agreement showing the alleged monthly payments schedule : Address where the alleged account monthly payment was being mailed : Account number or debit card number that was used to make payment ( if any payment was made ) : This request is for complete evidence, proof in the form of document ( s ) showing my signature, a copy of my ID showing my picture, and or showing the date of birth, etc. I made this request following the FDCPA and is made in absolute accordance with Federal Law.

If you fail to provide any of the information or documentation I asked for within the legally required time ( 30 days ), please explain why. If you do not provide it at all and do not adequately explain why I will understand that you are unable to validate or document your claims. 



Please also supply the following information below : Details about your authority to collect this debt. 
I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, explain why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address, and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

Why you think I owe the debt, and to whom I owe it, including : The full and legal name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, and the full account number used by that creditor. 
If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 
Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, you can provide a copy of the written agreement with my legible signature and all other pertinent information that created my original requirement to pay. ( Do not just send me a bill, a bill is not sufficient proof that this account was created by me ) If you are asking that I pay a debt that belongs to someone else or someone else was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The amount and age of the debt, specifically : A copy of the last original billing statement sent to me by the original creditor showing my full name and address. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it when that was, and the detailed amount owed, including late and attorney fees if any. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees, or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees, or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other increases and/or reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them. 
If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 


Thank you in advance for your response.

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative: My initial awareness of unauthorized inquiries on my credit report became known to me as I ran across a headline on my XXXXXXXX XXXX feed where another data breach had occured. Taking that event into consideration, I went about checking on my credit to see if there was any errors that was unbeknowst to me during that time. Upon doing so, I had noticed there were several inquiries that I had no knowledge of nor had given each of those financial institutions any permission to pull my credit at any point in my life so far. With this information in hand, I sent out a letter by certified mail to Equifax on XX/XX/year> in which I stated that there were erroneous inquiries on my credit report that did not have permissable permission from me to exist on my credit report. Additionally, I requested that those listed inquiries be investigated and removed due to them being unauthorized by me. ( please see attached letter that was sent ). I patiently waited 30 days per FCRA rules for a response and never received one. In the month of XXXX ( last month ), I checked my credit report then to see if during the updating of my credit report phase had occured, had there been any changes/removals of the unauthorized inquiries to which I discovered there nothing had been removed but instead, I discovered 2 new hard inquiries that are listed/titled as " XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX There has been more than 30 days since initiating communication with Equifax via certified mail of my complaints during the month of XXXX and yet those inquiries had not been addressed or answered to per FCRA rules. Due to nothing having changed to the date of this complaint 's writing, I'm consistently being negatively affected by these errors lieu of the credit reporting entries against me. Additionally, theres a repeat of offense in yet another unauthorized credit inquiry being placed on my credit report. This discovery happened on XX/XX/year> as I scrolled through my XXXX account and noticed that a financial institution had put a new hard inquiry titled " XXXXXXXX XXXX  '' on my Equifax credit report. Conclusively, Equifax has failed to execute their responsibilities of adherence to consumer law and FCRA policy to which their governed and are committing civil liability for each violation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Public record information inaccurate
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a child support account on my consumer report. The account in question, identified by the account number XXXX, XXXX is being reported with discrepancies across XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax, as shown in the attached documentation. Due to these inconsistencies, I believe this account should be removed from my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and relevant case law. This account is also listed 3 times with the the same account number this can not be correct and each consumer agency knows listing this account this way is lower my score on purpose. This account should not be listed three times. 

The FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) mandates that furnishers of information provide only accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. In this case, the child support account is being reported differently across multiple agencies. The inconsistent reporting violates the accuracy requirement of the FCRA. Specifically, the account shows different balances, statuses, and payment histories, which create confusion and result in an inaccurate representation of my financial obligations. 

Moreover, under Richardson v. Fleet Bank of Massachusetts, the court ruled that inaccurate or incomplete credit reporting violates a consumers rights under the FCRA. Since this account is not being reported accurately and consistently, it is imperative that this inaccurate entry be removed to avoid further damage to my credit profile. 

I respectfully request that you : XXXX. Investigate the reported inaccuracies in the child support account. 
XXXX. Remove the inaccurate entry from my credit report. 
XXXX. Provide written confirmation once the deletion has been completed. 

Please consider this a formal dispute under the FCRA, and I expect a full investigation and correction to be completed within 30 days, as required by law. I have enclosed a copy of my credit report with the disputed information highlighted for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
o Whom It May Concern : This letter is being sent to you in response to you reporting the aforementioned account on my credit profile with the credit reporting agencies. 
The following accounts are : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  This is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed. 
Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you claim that I owe you. I am requesting proof that : I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt ; the date of the alleged medical service ; the name of the patient ; and proof that there is some contractual obligation which is binding me to pay this debt. 
Please attach copies of : Any agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt, or proof of acquisition by purchase or assignment, and authorization under subtitle D of the XXXX XXXX XXXX APPLICATION OF SECURITY PROVISIONS AND PENALTIES TO BUSINESS ASSOCIATES OF COVERED ENTITIES ; and SEC. 13407 ( 1 ) BREACH OF SECURITY. 
The term breach of security means, with respect to unsecured PHR identifiable health information of an individual in a personal health record, acquisition of such information without the authorization of the individual. 
Please note that enforcement of penalties against you is covered under the penalty rules of the XXXX  Final Rule effective XX/XX/XXXX interpreting and implementing various provisions of the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act of 2009 ( HITECH Act ) as issued XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  and the penalty rules of the FCRA and FACTA including FACT Act changes final rules effective XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Please also attach copies of any agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor, and, as this is a medical account, a copy of any HIPAA authorization. 
Please also be advised that this letter is not only a formal dispute, but a request that you cease and desist any and all collection activities, including reporting of, or verifying of this account on my credit reports. 
They have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions.

I require compliance with the terms and conditions of this letter within ten ( 10 ) calendar days, or a complete withdrawal, in writing, of any claim. 
In the event of noncompliance, I reserve the right to file charges and/or complaints with the XXXX on your HIPAA violations and appropriate County, State & Federal authorities, the CFPB, XXXX  and State Bar associations for violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and Federal and State statutes on illegal collection activities on any account that may be time-barred as well as violation of XXXX  medical privacy rules XXXX 
I also hereby reserve my right to take private civil action against you to recover damages.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have written dispute letters three different times, to each credit bureau, and each time they reply with a new credit report stating that the account with XXXX has been Verified as accurate and updated. 
Re : Formal Dispute Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602, Section 604, and 15 U.S.C. 1666b This dispute is made under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), specifically Sections 602 and 604, as well as 15 U.S.C. 1666b ( Fair Credit Billing Act - Crediting of Payments ). 
Basis for Dispute : 1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 : Section 602 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act establishes the need for credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate and fair credit reporting practices. The disputed information on my credit report is inaccurate and does not reflect the actual status of my account. This misinformation is damaging to my credit profile and violates the standards of accuracy required by law. 
2. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 : Section 604 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regulates the permissible purposes for which a consumer report can be accessed. If this dispute involves unauthorized credit inquiries, these inquiries were not made with my consent or for a permissible purpose under the FCRA. These inquiries should not have been included on my credit report. 
3. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1666b ( Fair Credit Billing Act - Crediting of Payments ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 1666b, payments must be credited to an account on the date of receipt. The payment listed on my account was not credited promptly, resulting in [ e.g., a late fee, increased interest, or a negative impact on my credit score ]. This delay is in violation of the Fair Credit Billing Act. 
4. PAANL ( Principle of Accuracy and Non-Discrimination in Lending ) : The Principle of Accuracy and Non-Discrimination in Lending emphasizes that all information reported on consumer credit reports must be both accurate and free from bias or discrimination. The inaccurate or mishandled information in question violates these principles, potentially leading to unfair lending practices against me.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have disputed this account a few times with each credit bureau and each time they all reply within a credit report stating that this account with XXXX XXXX has been verified as accurate and updated. 
Debt Validation Request under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( FDCPA ) Verification Request : Under my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The Amount of the Debt : A detailed accounting of the debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and any other charges that have been applied.

2. The Name of the Creditor to Whom the Debt is Currently Owed : Including the name and address of the original creditor if different from the current creditor.

3. Verification of the Debt : A copy of the judgment ( if applicable ) or other documents showing that I am indeed legally obligated to pay this debt.

4. Proof of Your Legal Right to Collect the Debt : Documentation that you are authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the creditor.

5. Complete Payment History : Showing how the amount claimed was calculated and all transactions related to the debt.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), and 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and complete. A charge-off should not be reported each month as a new charge-off ; instead, the status should reflect the original charge-off date and not be reported repeatedly as if it were a new event. 
The actions being taken each month affect my credit score, credit report, and creditworthiness.

Additionally, my information was also affected by the Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX data breach, which raises concerns about the security of my personal data.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have contacted the XXXX XXXX XXXX repeatedly over time to try and settled my alleged debt with them. My calls and proposals continuously go unanswered, until suddenly, Im being served paperwork for a lawsuit. I was served once ; and contacted them immediately to resolve this. They do not keep up with clients at all, they do not have autopay for payment plans, they do not send monthly bills or payment reminders, they do not send monthly statements, therefore keeping tracking of payments and due dates is impossible due to the lack of infrastructure on their website. The second time I found out they were suing me, they had gotten a judgement against me to levy my bank account- I was not notified of any delinquent payments on my plan, I was not notified of the new lawsuit, I was not notified of the bank levy, I was only made aware by a law firm offering their legal services to me with the public record from the local courthouse. I notified them immediately that they did not have the right to levy my account as it is shared with a third party, and has protected funds in it. They instead opted to pursue another payment plan. I have repeatedly proposed and called and sent letters about settling the debt- with no answer. They have not properly notified me of my debts in the amount or status of the debt and have also failed to notify me of pursuing legal action. They are unresponsive to most requests and this seems to be a common complaint amongst their XXXX reviews. 
The photo below shows XXXX occasions I was supposedly served on- XXXX of which ( XX/XX/year> ) which is incorrect. I was never served or notified of a bank levy.

Consumer complaint narrative: EQUIFAX CONTINUES TO VIOLATE MY RIGHTS BY REPORTING GROSS INCOME AND ORDINARY INCOME ON MY REPORT BREAKING THE LAW. THESE ACCOUNTS " CHARGED OFF '' THE IRS STATES CLEARLY THAT ANY GROSS INCOME OR ORDINARY INCOME CAN NOT BE REPORTED INTO A REPORT BY ANY CREDIT REPORTING AGENCY.A CHARGE OFF IS GROSS INCOME PER THE IRS. DELETE ALL ACCOUNTS MENTIONED IN THE COMPLAINT ASAP AND I'M REQUESTING {$1000.00} PER EACH VIOLATION. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX UPSTA/FINWSE XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax Continues XXXX Violate multiple laws from Congress 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ). Additionally CHARGED OFF is considered a certificate of indebtedness per the IRS and income can not be reported. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORTS BY LAW AND By Definition PER the IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. AGAIN THESE COMPANIES HAVE ALREADY WRITTEN OFF THESE ACCOUNTS AS A " CHARGED OFF '' IN THEIR MANDATORY TAX FILINGS VERIFYING THE ACCOUNT 'S TRUE STATUS. DELETE THESE ACCOUNTS IMMEDIATELY FROM YOUR RECORDS AND I'M ALSO REQUESTING {$1000.00} PER EACH VIOLATION OF THE LAWS VIOLATED AND THE FCRA PER ALL MY OTHER COMPLAINTS THAT YOU HAVE FAILED TO FULLY ACKNOWLEDGE AND ADDRESS THE LAWS BROKER BY YOUR SERVICES ALSO EQUIFAX YOU'RE VIOLATING AND BREAKING ADDITIONALLY THE FURTHER LAWS BY HAVING THESE ACCOUNTS ON YOUR RECORDS AS THE LAW STATES UNDER 15 U.S.C. 1681c THAT A CONSUMER CREDIT REPORT DOES NOT INCLUDE ANY ADVERSE ITEMS ASIDES " any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years '' THESE ACCOUNTS ARE AN ADVERSE ITEM AND ARE REPORTING WITHOUT MY PERMISSION AFTER REVOKING ALL PERMISSION TO THEM AND YOU EQUIFAX. ADDITIONALLY THE LAW CLEARLY STATES Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) states that the consumer report DOES NOT include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the person ( UPSTART, XXXX, XXXX, ) making the report. EQUIFAX WHAT YOU'RE DOING IS ILLEGALL AND I DEMAND THE DELETION OF THESE ACCOUNTS ASAP FURTHER MORE I HAVE REVOKED ANY PRIOR PERMISSION TO SHARE ANY PERSONAL INFORMATION WITH A 3RD PARTY COMPANY. FURTHER MORE ON THEIR TERMS and Conditions these Companies agreed not to share my information with NON affiliates. EQUIFAX, XXXX, and XXXX is not an affiliate of these Companies nor are they " bureaus ''. The only true credit bureau is the CFPB and they DO NOT furnish consumer reports as stated in federal law. AGAIN I have a right to privacy and Per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer I am now REVOKING any and all authorization I THE consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and nonverbal per 5 U.S. Code 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non written, verbal, and non verbal per 15 USC 6802.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the handling of my contract with your company. I have reason to believe that Conns Furniture has engaged in fraudulent activity by using my contract as collateral for cash advances without informing me. This action was done without my knowledge or consent, and I was not made aware that the liability of this transaction would ultimately be transferred to me. 

Under contract law, transparency is required, and as the consumer, I should have been informed that my contract was being used for monetary gain on your end. The failure to disclose this critical information constitutes fraudulent misrepresentation. You did not inform me that my liability would be transferred while you benefited from cash advances using my contract as collateral. 

I demand immediate action to address this fraudulent practice, including removing any negative reports associated with this account from my credit report and providing a complete breakdown of how my contract has been used. 

Please consider this a formal dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), as these practices violate my consumer rights. I request a prompt investigation and resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX EQUIFAX Account Type : Credit Card I am writing under my rights granted by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( XXXX U.S.C XXXX XXXX ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information that appears on my credit report regarding the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g., XXXX  XXXX XXXX ], which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) : XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$4200.00} Current balance owed : {$4100.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : XXXX reported balance : {$0.00} Current balance owed : {$4100.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' It also states that the account was closed due to inactivity. 

Equifax : XXXX reported balance : $ XXXX balance owed : $ XXXX status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' and notes the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' These discrepancies show significant inconsistencies between the credit bureaus, particularly in regard to the high balance amounts and account closure reasons. According to XXXX, the account was closed due to inactivity, while Equifax indicates it was reported as a loss by the creditor. Furthermore, XXXX provides different information about the high balance. This inconsistency violates the FCRA ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( b ) ), which mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. 

Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information about my credit obligations and payment history, which is currently not being accurately reflected due to these discrepancies between the credit bureaus. 


I am requesting that, in compliance with the FCRA and XXXX, you investigate this dispute and remove the inaccurate information, including the charge-off, from my credit report. The conflicting data between the bureaus demonstrates the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and inaccurate information for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was just looking over my credit report and found some inaccuracies that I am demanding you correct. 

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you are required by federal law to ensure that all details being reported on an account must be 100 % accurate and verifiable and have my full consent to report. Based 15 USC 6802 I was not given proper information on how to opt out per section 1 ( b ) and ( c ). Therefore, I have already contacted the companies to opt out of any current, prior or future reporting. I am now informing your Company that any unauthorized continued reporting will result in legal action. As the accounts which are listed in this letter are my personal information and you DO NOT HAVE MY PERMISSION to report any of it. Furthering reporting by your unaffiliated third party company will be a violation and cause a civil and criminal suit. Please remove the items listed in this letter effective immediately. 

The only verified proof that will be accepted in this process will be proof of the proper notifications through a verifiable source of my rights to opt-out of reporting and instructions on how to do so, with a record of receipt showing it was mailed, delivered and received. These are hereby my formal written instructions on what is acceptable as proof and actions to take. No other validation will be accepted. 

Since your company has taken upon itself to act as my entrusted fiduciary. I have provided you with the instructions to act on my behalf as to what serves my best interest. Failure to do so will result in a federal suit to the fullest extent including compensation based on the FRA section 29. 
Here are the inaccuracies I have identified : Account Name : Achieve Personal Loans Account Number : XXXX Reason : Do Not consent to this private personal information to be reported. I am opting out of this account being reported prior, present or future. To continue to report after receiving this is in violation of 15 USC 6802 and I do not consent. 
Also, please remove all non-account holding inquiries over 30 days old and add a Promotional Suppression to my credit file. 

The company that I requested the information from claimed that the information disputed had been verified, however I have received no such proof. I ask again that the above information be verified per the means requested.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau : EQUIFAX Account Type : Credit Card Dear Sir/Madam In accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am formally disputing inaccurate and unverifiable information related to my account with [ creditor name, e.g., XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ], which has been marked as " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have found the following significant discrepancies between the credit bureaus XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax : XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$2500.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$0.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' The account was closed due to inactivity.

Equifax : Highest reported balance : {$2300.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' with the balance reported as a " loss by the creditor. '' These discrepancies show serious inconsistencies, particularly regarding the reported balances and the reasons for the account closure. XXXX states that the account was closed due to inactivity, while Equifax indicates that the balance was reported as a loss. XXXX reports a higher balance than the other bureaus. These inconsistencies violate the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), which requires credit agencies to maintain maximum possible accuracy in their reports.

Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information about my credit obligations and payment history. The discrepancies noted affect the truthfulness and clarity of the information regarding my account. 

I request that, in compliance with FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and immediately remove the inaccurate information, including the " charge-off, '' from my credit report. The differences between the credit bureaus clearly show the inaccuracy of the reported information. Please send me the results of your investigation and a corrected report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit reports highlighting the mentioned discrepancies for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX EQUIFAX Account Type : Credit Card I am writing to you under my rights according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information on my credit report related to the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  reported as " Charged off, '' additionally noting that the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' Furthermore, according to the XXXX report, the account was closed due to inactivity, which is a significant discrepancy compared to the other bureaus that do not mention inactivity as the reason for closure. This inconsistency between the credit bureaus impacts my right to have my information reported accurately and fairly as stipulated by the FCRA under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit bureaus maintain maximum accuracy in the information reported.

Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information regarding credit obligations and payment history, which is not being reflected in this case due to inconsistencies between the different credit bureaus.

I request that, in accordance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and promptly remove the inaccurate information and the charge-off from my credit report, as the discrepancies and errors demonstrate the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and the inaccurate information. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently looked at my Equifax credit report and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. Account name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has reported that I was late XXXX and XXXX of XXXX  which is inaccurate because indeed paid those months. As according to the fair credit reporting act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX SUBJECT : DISPUTE for DELETION of Unauthorized/Inaccurate Credit Inquires. 

Dear XXXX  Dispute Department, I am writing to formally dispute the following unauthorized or inaccurate inquires listed on my credit report. I have reviewed my credit report and found these inquiries were made without my consent or are inaccurate. The details of the inquires in question are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, U.S. Code 1681 e ( b ) ACCURACY OF REPORT, & 15 U.S. CODE 1681 i ( 5 ) TREATMENT OF INACCURATE OR UNVERIFIABLE INFORMATION ( A ).

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). ONLY authorized inquires should appear on a consumers credit report. I have not applied for credit with the companies listed above, nor have I authorized these inquiries. Therefore, I am requesting that these inquires be DELETED FROM MY CREDIT REPORT. 

Enclosed with this letter are copies of my identification and a recent utility bill to verify my identity. I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and kindly request a written conformation once these inquires have been DELETED from my credit report. 

I look forward to your timely response within the 30 day period allowed by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Improper Handling of Reinvestigation Request Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Equifax regarding their handling of my " Request for Reinvestigation and Detailed Description of Verification Methods. '' On XXXX, I submitted a comprehensive request to Equifax to reinvestigate inaccuracies on my credit report and to provide a detailed description of the verification methods used. However, Equifax rejected my request, stating that proper identification was not provided. 
I strongly believe that this rejection is unwarranted and constitutes a procedural failure on the part of Equifax. Enclosed with my original request were the following documents : 1. A signed and dated dispute letter outlining the inaccuracies on my credit report.

2. Copies of my credit reports from XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax highlighting the disputed items. 
3. A copy of my government-issued identification ( driver 's license ).

4. A copy of my Social Security card.

5. A recent utility bill verifying my current address.

6. Any additional supporting documents substantiating my claims. 
I have thoroughly reviewed XXXX guidelines for submitting disputes and ensured that all required documentation was included. The claim that proper identification was not provided is incorrect and has resulted in an unnecessary delay in resolving my credit report inaccuracies. 
Violations of Law I believe that XXXX 's rejection of my request and the subsequent delay violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ) : This section requires that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy ) : This section mandates that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual. 
3. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) : This section states that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services

Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX  debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the Polaris letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : XXXX XXXX Transunion for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Transunion regarding their handling of my " Request for Reinvestigation and Detailed Description of Verification Methods. '' On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a comprehensive request to Transunion to reinvestigate inaccuracies on my credit report and to provide a detailed description of the verification methods used. However, XXXX rejected my request, stating that proper identification was not provided. 
I strongly believe that this rejection is unwarranted and constitutes a procedural failure on the part of XXXX. Enclosed with my original request were the following documents : XXXX. A signed and dated dispute letter outlining the inaccuracies on my credit report. 
XXXX. Copies of my credit reports from TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX highlighting the disputed items. 
XXXX. A copy of my government-issued identification ( driver 's license ). 
XXXX. A copy of my Social Security card. 
XXXX. A recent utility bill verifying my current address. 
XXXX. Any additional supporting documents substantiating my claims. 
I have thoroughly reviewed Transunions guidelines for submitting disputes and ensured that all required documentation was included. The claim that proper identification was not provided is incorrect and has resulted in an unnecessary delay in resolving my credit report inaccuracies. 
Violations of Law I believe that Transunion 's rejection of my request and the subsequent delay violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically : XXXX. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ) : This section requires that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information. 
XXXX. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy ) : This section mandates that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual. 
XXXX. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( XXXX ) : This section states that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 168b permissible purposes of consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights. On a list of inquiries : 15 U.S.C. 1681b - Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports : This section outlines that consumer reports can only be furnished under specific conditions. My rights to privacy and confidentiality have been violated as my report was accessed or shared without permissible purpose.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) - Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : This statute prohibits the furnishing of any information to a consumer reporting agency that is known to be inaccurate or has not been verified. [ Name of Furnisher/Creditor ] has furnished information that is either inaccurate or unverifiable.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Right to Privacy : The statute emphasizes the need for consumer reporting agencies to handle consumer information with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. This has not been upheld in my case.

15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) - Requirement for Written Consent : This section specifies that a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a consumer report without the consumer 's written instruction. I did not provide written consent for the inquiry or account listed.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) - Prohibition of Obsolete Information : This section prohibits the reporting of adverse information older than seven years ( except for records of convictions ). The report in question contains outdated or irrelevant information.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative: There was a VA streamline program that would allow me to skip XXXX months payments ( refinance ) but when I asked about it, I was told that it didnt make sense to do it because the interest rates hadnt dropped. Soon afterwards, the rates did drop but since I was already a month behind, I didnt qualify for the streamline program. What put me a month behind was that the department of defense began garnishing my wages for $ XXXX a month until an erroneous debt was reclaimed that totaled less than $ XXXX. Just before they began taking the money, I received a letter stating that I didnt owe it. When I took that letter to finance, they told me that theyd have to finish taking out all the money before I could apply for it to be refunded. After 6 months, I did apply for the refund and it was all refunded 3 months later. I explained this to Wells Fargo Bank and attempted to work something out but by that time, their offer was too much to pay. I kept them informed of the situation leading up to the reimbursement. Ive had traumatic nightmares about this for years. As a result of the court case, I was supposed to receive the check that never came.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX RE : Account # ( XXXX ) To Whom It May Concern : Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested.Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you say I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt. 
This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. At this time I will also inform you that if your offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, Trans Union ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by your company or the company you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act I am sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I will require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit- reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your offices fail to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. 

Please provide the following : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. 
Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor. 
Any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account. 
Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. 
Name and address of alleged creditor. 
Name on file of alleged debtor. 
Alleged account number. 
Address on file for alleged debtor. 
Amount of alleged debt. 
Date this alleged debt became payable. 
Date of original charge off or delinquency. 
Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. 
Complete accounting of alleged debt. 
Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have disputed this account a few times with each credit bureau and each time they all reply within a credit report stating that this account with XXXX XXXX has been verified as accurate and updated. 
Debt Validation Request under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( FDCPA ) Verification Request : Under my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, I am requesting that you provide the following information : 1. The Amount of the Debt : A detailed accounting of the debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and any other charges that have been applied.

2. The Name of the Creditor to Whom the Debt is Currently Owed : Including the name and address of the original creditor if different from the current creditor.

3. Verification of the Debt : A copy of the judgment ( if applicable ) or other documents showing that I am indeed legally obligated to pay this debt.

4. Proof of Your Legal Right to Collect the Debt : Documentation that you are authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the creditor.

5. Complete Payment History : Showing how the amount claimed was calculated and all transactions related to the debt. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ), and 623 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), information furnished to consumer reporting agencies must be accurate and complete. A charge-off should not be reported each month as a new charge-off ; instead, the status should reflect the original charge-off date and not be reported repeatedly as if it were a new event. 
The actions being taken each month affect my credit score, credit report, and creditworthiness.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau : Transunion Account Type : Credit Card Dear Sir/Madam In accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am formally disputing inaccurate and unverifiable information related to my account with [ creditor name, e.g., XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ], which has been marked as " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have found the following significant discrepancies between the credit bureaus TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX : TransUnion : Highest reported balance : {$2500.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$0.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' The account was closed due to inactivity. 

XXXX : Highest reported balance : {$2300.00} Current balance owed : {$2300.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' with the balance reported as a " loss by the creditor. '' These discrepancies show serious inconsistencies, particularly regarding the reported balances and the reasons for the account closure. XXXX states that the account was closed due to inactivity, while XXXX indicates that the balance was reported as a loss. TransUnion reports a higher balance than the other bureaus. These inconsistencies violate the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ), which requires credit agencies to maintain maximum possible accuracy in their reports.

Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information about my credit obligations and payment history. The discrepancies noted affect the truthfulness and clarity of the information regarding my account. 

I request that, in compliance with FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and immediately remove the inaccurate information, including the " charge-off, '' from my credit report. The differences between the credit bureaus clearly show the inaccuracy of the reported information. Please send me the results of your investigation and a corrected report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit reports highlighting the mentioned discrepancies for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payments Reported on Select Portfolio Servicing Account To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payments reported on my Select Portfolio Servicing ( SPS ) account, which are currently appearing on my credit report. The late payment information being reported is incorrect and not reflective of my actual payment history. 
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), I request that you immediately investigate this matter and correct the inaccuracies on my credit report. Specifically, I am citing the following laws in support of my dispute : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ) - Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) This section of the law grants me the right to dispute billing errors, including the inaccurate reporting of late payments. As a consumer, I have the right to dispute errors within 60 days of receiving the billing statement showing the error. In this case, the late payments being reported are not accurate, and I am exercising my right under this law to correct the mistake.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ) - Periodic Statements of Accounts Under this section, creditors are required to provide clear and accurate statements of account activity. The inaccuracies in the reporting of late payments on my XXXX XXXX XXXX account violate this requirement, as the information being provided to the credit bureaus is neither accurate nor consistent with my actual payment activity. 
3. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) - Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) This section of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information included in consumer reports. The inaccurate late payments being reported on my XXXX account violate this provision. As TransUnion has a duty to report only accurate and verifiable information, I am requesting that you immediately verify the accuracy of the information with XXXX XXXX Servicing and update or remove the late payment information accordingly. 
Details of the Account in Dispute : Creditor Name : Select Portfolio Servicing ( SPS ) Account XXXX Disputed Late Payments : XX/XX/XXXX - present Requested Actions : Immediate Investigation : Please conduct a thorough investigation into the inaccurate late payment information reported by Select Portfolio Servicing. 

Correction or Removal of Inaccurate Information : If these late payments can not be verified as accurate, I request that they be removed from my credit report immediately. 
Confirmation of Investigation : Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I request written confirmation of the results of your investigation and any changes made to my credit report within 30 days. 

Thank you for your attention to this important issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Debt amount : XXXX Creditor Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, AZ XXXX. 

Subject : Dispute of Debt and Cease Communication Request Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am writing to dispute the validity of the debt referenced in your communication dated XX/XX/XXXX communication from creditor, XXXX XXXX XXXX. This is not an acknowledgment of the debt but a formal dispute of its validity. 

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 USC 1692c, I request that you cease any and all communication with me regarding this debt, except as authorized by the FDCPA. According to 15 USC 1692c, you are prohibited from contacting me further if I provide written notification that I refuse to pay the debt or that I wish to cease further communication. 

For your reference, the relevant section of 15 USC 1692c states : " ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt, except ( 1 ) to advise the consumer that the debt collectors further efforts are being terminated ; ( 2 ) to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor may invoke specified remedies which are ordinarily invoked by such debt collector or creditor; or ( 3 ) where applicable, to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor intends to invoke a specified remedy. '' In addition, I am requesting that you validate this debt, including but not limited to : The name and address of the original creditor. 
The amount of the debt. 
A copy of any judgment, if applicable. 
Proof that I owe the debt in question. 
Please send the requested documentation to my address listed above within 30 days from the receipt of this letter. 

Furthermore, any failure to comply with the above request will be reported to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) for further action. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely,

TransUnion XXXX XXXX 2000 XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payments Reported on Select Portfolio Servicing Account To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payments reported on my Select Portfolio Servicing ( SPS ) account, which are currently appearing on my credit report. The late payment information being reported is incorrect and not reflective of my actual payment history. 

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), I request that you immediately investigate this matter and correct the inaccuracies on my credit report. Specifically, I am citing the following laws in support of my dispute : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ) - Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) This section of the law grants me the right to dispute billing errors, including the inaccurate reporting of late payments. As a consumer, I have the right to dispute errors within 60 days of receiving the billing statement showing the error. In this case, the late payments being reported are not accurate, and I am exercising my right under this law to correct the mistake.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ) - Periodic Statements of Accounts Under this section, creditors are required to provide clear and accurate statements of account activity. The inaccuracies in the reporting of late payments on my XXXX XXXX XXXX account violate this requirement, as the information being provided to the credit bureaus is neither accurate nor consistent with my actual payment activity.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) - Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) This section of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information included in consumer reports. The inaccurate late payments being reported on my XXXX account violate this provision. As TransUnion has a duty to report only accurate and verifiable information, I am requesting that you immediately verify the accuracy of the information with XXXX XXXX Servicing and update or remove the late payment information accordingly. 
Details of the Account in Dispute : Creditor Name : Select Portfolio Servicing ( SPS ) Account Number : [ Full Account Number or Last 4 Digits ] Disputed Late Payments : [ Dates of the Inaccurate Late Payments ] Requested Actions : Immediate Investigation : Please conduct a thorough investigation into the inaccurate late payment information reported by Select Portfolio Servicing.

Correction or Removal of Inaccurate Information : If these late payments can not be verified as accurate, I request that they be removed from my credit report immediately.

Confirmation of Investigation : Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, I request written confirmation of the results of your investigation and any changes made to my credit report within 30 days. 

Thank you for your attention to this important issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score. 
Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). 
Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter

Subject : Follow-Up on FCRA Violation and Demand for Correction I am writing to formally follow up on my previous correspondence dated XX/XX/year>, regarding inaccuracies in my credit report and to assert my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

In my earlier communication, I outlined several discrepancies that are damaging my credit score, including misspellings of my name, incorrect address information, inaccurate employer details, and erroneous risk factors. As a reminder, my correct name is XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my only address is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Pennsylvania XXXX. 

As per Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are mandated to conduct a reasonable investigation of any disputes within 30 days of receiving a consumer 's request. However, to date, I have not received a satisfactory response from XXXXXXXX, which constitutes a violation of my consumer rights under the FCRA. 

This delay in addressing my dispute and the inaccuracies reflected in my credit report have caused me significant harm, including [ specify any adverse consequences such as being denied credit, incurring higher interest rates, or being unable to secure housing or employment ]. 

In light of this violation, I am demanding monetary relief for the damages incurred as a result of XXXXXXXX XXXX failure to comply with the FCRA. I am entitled to seek actual damages, statutory damages, and reasonable attorney 's fees and costs. Therefore, I demand compensation in the amount of [ specify the amount you believe is fair and reasonable ] for the damages caused by XXXX XXXX inaction. 

I expect a prompt response to this demand letter within 30 days from the date of receipt. Failure to provide a satisfactory response or offer appropriate monetary relief may result in further legal action to protect my rights under the FCRA. 

Please be advised that if I do not receive a satisfactory response to all five of my demands by [ insert deadline, typically 30 days ], I will have no choice but to pursue legal action against XXXX. I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for the following claims : 1. **Defamation of Character** : Your failure to report accurate information has significantly impacted my reputation and credibility. 

2. **Negligent Non-Compliance** : Your actions demonstrate a lack of diligence in adhering to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related regulations.

3. **Civil Liability** : I will hold your company accountable for the damages incurred as a result of your non-compliance with the FCRA.

4. **Mental Anguish** : The distress caused by the inaccuracies in my credit report and your lack of response has resulted in significant emotional turmoil.

5. **Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act** : Specifically, I am citing willful non-compliance under 15 U.S.C. 1681 and related regulations.

Please consider this letter a final opportunity to resolve these matters amicably. I urge you to take this demand seriously and respond with a plan for resolution by the specified deadline. Failure to do so will result in the initiation of legal proceedings against your company.

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX [ Enclosures : Original letter dated XX/XX/year> ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : This letter is a formal Complaint under FEDERAL FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ), 15 USC Sec.

1681-1681y, imposes responsibilities on all persons who furnish information to consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ). These responsibilities are found in Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. Sec 1681s-2, that the Credit Reporting Agency could be reporting Unauthorized and Fraudulent Credit Inquiries by these Original Creditors on my credit report and is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 604 ( a ) ,604 ( b ), 604 ( c ), 609, and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( 8 ) and Fair Credit Billing Act, and Title 15 U.S.C. section 1681b ( a ), 1681b ( b ), 1681b ( c ), All data on My Credit Report must be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY, or By Law can not be on My Credit Report. PERIOD, per Sec 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a child support account on my consumer report. The account in question, identified by the account number XXXX, XXXX is being reported with discrepancies across TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX, as shown in the attached documentation. Due to these inconsistencies, I believe this account should be removed from my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and relevant case law. This account is also listed 3 times with the the same account number this can not be correct and each consumer agency knows listing this account this way is lower my score on purpose. This account should not be listed XXXX times. 

The FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) mandates that furnishers of information provide only accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. In this case, the child support account is being reported differently across multiple agencies. The inconsistent reporting violates the accuracy requirement of the FCRA. Specifically, the account shows different balances, statuses, and payment histories, which create confusion and result in an inaccurate representation of my financial obligations. 

Moreover, under XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the court ruled that inaccurate or incomplete credit reporting violates a consumers rights under the FCRA. Since this account is not being reported accurately and consistently, it is imperative that this inaccurate entry be removed to avoid further damage to my credit profile. 

I respectfully request that you : XXXX. Investigate the reported inaccuracies in the child support account. 
XXXX. Remove the inaccurate entry from my credit report. 
XXXX. Provide written confirmation once the deletion has been completed. 

Please consider this a formal dispute under the FCRA, and I expect a full investigation and correction to be completed within 30 days, as required by law. I have enclosed a copy of my credit report with the disputed information highlighted for your reference. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to a swift resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Fraudulent Bankruptcy Reporting on Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a bankruptcy on my credit report. I have never filed for bankruptcy in my entire life, and this entry is clearly a result of either mistaken identity or fraudulent activity, potentially stemming from the recent national data breach that compromised the personal information of millions of individuals. 

Details of the Disputed Bankruptcy : Filing Court : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Filing Date : XX/XX/XXXX Case Number : XXXX This inaccurate information is causing significant damage to my credit profile, and under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute and have any inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information removed from my credit file. Specifically, FCRA Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires credit reporting agencies to promptly investigate disputes and correct or delete inaccurate information.

Additionally, under FCRA Section 605 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ), the inclusion of this erroneous bankruptcy is an unjust representation of my creditworthiness, as bankruptcies are major derogatory marks that should only be reported when valid. I believe this error is likely connected to the national data breach, which has compromised sensitive personal data and may have led to unauthorized use of my identity. 

Requested Actions : Immediate Investigation : I request an immediate investigation into the inaccurate bankruptcy reporting. 

Removal of the Bankruptcy Entry : As this entry is entirely false, I demand its complete removal from my credit report. 

I appreciate your immediate attention to this urgent matter and look forward to a timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number : XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX XXXX Account Type : Credit Card I am writing to you under my rights according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information on my credit report related to the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.g.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ], which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ) : TransUnion : Highest reported balance : {$2700.00} Current balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : XXXX reported balance : $ XXXXCurrent balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off. '' XXXX : XXXX reported balance : {$2600.00} XXXX balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' additionally noting that the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' Furthermore, according to the XXXX report, the account was closed due to inactivity, which is a significant discrepancy compared to the other bureaus that do not mention inactivity as the reason for closure. This inconsistency between the credit bureaus impacts my right to have my information reported accurately and fairly as stipulated by the FCRA under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit bureaus maintain maximum accuracy in the information reported.

Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information regarding credit obligations and payment history, which is not being reflected in this case due to inconsistencies between the different credit bureaus.

I request that, in accordance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and promptly remove the inaccurate information and the charge-off from my credit report, as the discrepancies and errors demonstrate the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible.

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and the inaccurate information.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.
