Transunion - Consumer Reporting Agency 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I would like to forge forward with a righted disputation that I see you currently have on my consumer report, possibly causing violating infringements and injury to my credibility. Eradicate any and all of these following unproven genuine, FCRA compliant, and or applicable standards of reporting of which you are undoubtedly mandated in your reporting obligation ( s ) to obey without default or deficiency of any sort.

The FCRA 's permissible purpose provisions are thus central to the statute 's protection of consumer privacy.

In accord with 5 U.S. Code 552a - Records maintained on individuals ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be.

15 U.S. Code 1681- Congressional findings and statement of purpose ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers.

( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.

15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( d ) Consumer Report.

( 1 ) In general.The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; 12 CFR Part 1022 - Fair Credit Reporting ( Regulation V ) FCRA section 607 ( a ) requires that consumer reporting companies, among other things, must require that prospective users of consumer reports certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. 

Consumers suffer harm when consumer reporting agencies provide consumer reports to persons who are not authorized to receive the information or when recipients of consumer reports obtain or use such reports for purposes other than permissible purposes. These harms include the invasion of my ' privacy, as well as reputational, emotional, physical, and economic harms.

12 CFR Part 1022 - Fair Credit Reporting ( Regulation V ) permissible purpose provisions to the protection of consumer privacy, the Bureau is issuing this advisory opinion to affirm that consumer reporting agencies may not provide a consumer report pursuant to FCRA section 604 ( a ) under any circumstance not expressly permitted by this section.

A consumer reporting company may not provide a consumer report under FCRA section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) unless it has reason to believe that the user has a permissible purpose with respect to the consumer about whom the report is requested. A user 's request to a consumer reporting company for a report about a consumer does not give the consumer reporting company a reason to believe that the user has a permissible purpose to obtain a consumer report about other consumers. As explained in part XXXX, XXXX enacted the FCRA in part to address a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with... a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. 

FCRA section 619 imposes criminal liability on any person who knowingly and willfully obtains information on a consumer from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses. 

The Privacy Act of 1974, 5 U.S.C. 552a, protects individuals ' personal information from unwarranted invasions of privacy.

( g ) ( 1 ) Civil Remedies.Whenever any agency ( A ) makes a determination under subsection ( d ) ( XXXX ) of this section not to amend an individuals record in accordance with his request, or fails to make such review in conformity with that subsection ; the individual may bring a civil action against the agency, and the district courts of the United States shall have jurisdiction in the matters under the provisions of this subsection.

( 4 ) In any suit brought under the provisions of subsection ( g ) ( 1 ) ( C ) or ( D ) of this section in which the court determines that the agency acted in a manner which was intentional or willful, the United States shall be liable to the individual in an amount equal to the sum of ( A ) actual damages sustained by the individual as a result of the refusal or failure, but in no case shall a person entitled to recovery receive less than the sum of {$1000.00} The enforcement of the regulations prescribed there under shell be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

Dear CFPB Representative, I am writing to file a complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite my efforts to resolve these issues directly with the credit reporting agencies, the incorrect information persists, and I am seeking your assistance in rectifying these errors.

I have identified the following inaccuracies on my credit report : Incorrect Name ( s ) : Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX, Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Name ID # XXXX XXXX XXXX Incorrect Address ( es ) : Address ID # XXXX Incorrect Phone Number ( s ) : ( XXXX ) XXXX - XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Incorrect Employers : XXXX XXXX  Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 et seq. ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information they report is accurate and up-to-date. Specifically : FCRA Section 1681i : This section mandates that consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate or incomplete information, and the credit reporting agency must investigate and correct or delete the information if it is found to be inaccurate.

FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : This section requires that credit reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the information they report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Transunion for Improper Handling of Reinvestigation Request Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Transunion regarding their handling of my " Request for Reinvestigation and Detailed Description of Verification Methods. '' On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a comprehensive request to Transunion to reinvestigate inaccuracies on my credit report and to provide a detailed description of the verification methods used. However, XXXX rejected my request, stating that proper identification was not provided. 
I strongly believe that this rejection is unwarranted and constitutes a procedural failure on the part of XXXX. Enclosed with my original request were the following documents : XXXX. A signed and dated dispute letter outlining the inaccuracies on my credit report. 
XXXX. Copies of my credit reports from TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX highlighting the disputed items. 
XXXX. A copy of my government-issued identification ( driver 's license ). 
XXXX. A copy of my Social Security card. 
XXXX. A recent utility bill verifying my current address. 
XXXX. Any additional supporting documents substantiating my claims. 
I have thoroughly reviewed Transunions guidelines for submitting disputes and ensured that all required documentation was included. The claim that proper identification was not provided is incorrect and has resulted in an unnecessary delay in resolving my credit report inaccuracies. 
Violations of Law I believe that Transunion 's rejection of my request and the subsequent delay violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ) : This section requires that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy ) : This section mandates that credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) : This section states that a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX. Subject : Complaint Against XXXX and Transunion for Refusal to Update Personal Information Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX and Transunion for their refusal to update my personal information on my credit report. On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a personal information update letter to XXXX, requesting the correction of my address and other personal details. This letter was accompanied by the necessary documentation, including a copy of my driver 's license, Social Security card, and a utility bill to verify my address. The document was also notarized. 
However, on XX/XX/year>, I received a response from XXXX stating that my request could not be processed because I did not provide a government ID. This statement is incorrect and misleading, as I had included all required documents, including a government-issued ID, in my initial submission. 
Attached to this complaint, you will find a copy of my original personal information update letter and all supporting documents that were submitted to XXXX. 
I believe that XXXX 's refusal to update my information is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under sections 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ( Compliance procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy ). 
XXXX 's failure to acknowledge and properly review the provided documentation is a direct violation of my rights under the FCRA. According to the FCRA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate information on their credit reports and must be provided with a fair and reasonable investigation of their dispute. By ignoring the documentation I provided, TransUnion has failed to uphold their obligation to conduct a fair investigation, thereby violating my consumer rights. 
I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that Experian updates my personal information as requested. Additionally, I seek confirmation that my credit report will reflect the accurate and updated information without further delays. 
Furthermore, I demand a deletion of all personally identifiable information from my consumer credit report with the exception of :

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security XXXX : XXXX Consumer Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX Subject : Urgent Request for Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Information from Credit Report Dear TransUnion XXXX I am writing to request your immediate action to block and remove fraudulent information from my credit report. This information, resulting from identity theft, has been verified by an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit that I have submitted. It is critical that TransUnion complies with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and addresses this issue without delay. 

Importance of FTC Affidavit and Immediate Action : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : I have provided an FTC Identity Theft Affidavit ( FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX ) to confirm that the entries in question are the result of identity theft. This affidavit is essential for verifying the fraudulent nature of these accounts and necessitates their removal from my credit report. 

FCRA Compliance : Under the FCRA, TransUnion is required to block fraudulent information from my credit report within 4 business days of receiving an identity theft report. Please expedite this process to ensure compliance with the law and to protect my credit standing.

Legal Requirements and Urgency : FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Mandates the blocking of fraudulent information within 4 business days. Ensure that all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries are removed promptly.

FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Requires that disputed information must be deleted if it can not be verified within 30 days. Please investigate and resolve these disputes urgently.

FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ) : Ensures that unverifiable information is deleted and does not reappear on the credit report. It is crucial to prevent further impact on my credit score.

FCRA 616 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) and 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681o ) : Provides for civil liability for willful and negligent non-compliance, highlighting the importance of timely and accurate action. 

Fraudulent Entries to be Blocked : Personal Credit Card with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Opened On : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX Personal Credit Card with XXXX Bank Opened On : XX/XX/XXXX Account Number : XXXX These fraudulent accounts have also led to several unauthorized hard inquiries and collections entries on my credit report. 

Supporting Documentation : FTC Identity Theft Affidavit : FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX XXXX Credit Report : Showing the fraudulent entries, inquiries, and collections Demands for Relief : Immediate Block of Fraudulent Entries : Block all fraudulent accounts, collections, and inquiries from my credit report within XXXX business days. Given the urgency of this matter, I request that you expedite this process to uphold consumer rights and prevent further damage to my credit. 

Verification Details : If any of these accounts are verified, provide detailed verification information as required under FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) within 30 days, including the contact information for the data furnisher.

Deletion if Verification Fails : If you are unable to verify the information, delete it from my credit report within 30 days and ensure it does not reappear, as mandated by FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ).

Prohibition Against Reappearance : Ensure that these fraudulent entries are permanently removed and do not reappear on my credit report. 

Please send all written confirmation and documentation to my email address : XXXX. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that TransUnion will act swiftly to resolve these issues in compliance with federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information reported on my credit report concerning a charge-off. Below are the details of the account in question : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XX/XX/year> It has come to my attention that this charge-off is being reported repeatedly monthly, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should be reported only once, reflecting the date it was charged off. 
Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the accuracy of the information they provide ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). The continuous monthly reporting of this charge-off misrepresents my payment history and negatively impacts my credit score.

Furthermore, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the initial delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ).

Repeatedly reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reflect the statute of limitations and is therefore improper. 
I request an immediate investigation into this matter and the correction of my credit report by removing the repeated entries of the charge-off from my payment history. Please update my credit report accordingly and provide written confirmation of these corrections. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I called customer service at XXXX and they told me to provide my ID so I will be attaching that as well. XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX could not retrieve my credit information from Transunion and XXXX. 

I have been going through this tough time for months now with no response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : This letter is a formal Complaint under FEDERAL FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ), 15 USC Sec.

1681-1681y, imposes responsibilities on all persons who furnish information to consumer reporting agencies ( CRAs ). These responsibilities are found in Section 623 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. Sec 1681s-2, that the Credit Reporting Agency could be reporting Unauthorized and Fraudulent Credit Inquiries by these Original Creditors on my credit report and is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 604 ( a ) ,604 ( b ), 604 ( c ), 609, and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( 8 ) and Fair Credit Billing Act, and Title 15 U.S.C. section 1681b ( a ), 1681b ( b ), 1681b ( c ), All data on My Credit Report must be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY, or By Law can not be on My Credit Report. PERIOD, per Sec 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ).

I recently reviewed my credit report and found unauthorized inquiries.

I contacted the below creditors, and they have NO proof I initiated such inquiries, nor written authorization and have failed to provide any permissible purpose. Since, they do not have my authorization, written nor verbal, I ask that you DELETE these authorized inquiries from my credit report immediately as there is no evidence of any authorization, nor any permissible purpose.

Inquiries are not a matter of record when I never gave these companies access to My credit file!!

According to Section 604 of Fair Credit Reporting Act Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports 15 U.S. Code 1681b In general. Subject to subsection ( e ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other.

( F ) otherwise has a legitimate business need for the information i ) in connection with a business transaction that is initiated by the consumer.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, Paragraph ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting shall- ( i ) promptly delete. 

The following inquiries are unauthorized.

Consumer complaint narrative:
**Yes, credit report companies can frustrate interstate commerce. ** Here 's how : 1. **Inconsistent Standards : ** Different credit reporting agencies may have varying standards for reporting and scoring credit information. This inconsistency can make it difficult for businesses operating across state lines to accurately assess creditworthiness.

2. **Data Accuracy Issues : ** Errors in credit reports can negatively impact individuals and businesses, leading to difficulties in obtaining loans, financing, or even employment. These errors can be time-consuming to correct, especially when dealing with multiple credit reporting agencies.

3. **Limited Access to Credit : ** Individuals and businesses in certain regions, particularly rural areas, may have limited access to credit due to factors like lack of local lenders or reliance on credit reporting agencies that are less familiar with their specific circumstances. 
XXXX. **Excessive Fees : ** Some credit reporting agencies charge fees for accessing credit reports or correcting errors, which can be a financial burden for individuals and businesses, especially those operating on a tight budget. 

These factors can hinder the smooth flow of goods, services, and capital across state lines, ultimately impacting the overall health of the economy. To address these issues, various regulations and initiatives have been implemented, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which provides consumers with certain rights regarding their credit reports.

Consumer complaint narrative: My initial awareness of unauthorized inquiries on my credit report became known to me as I ran across a headline on my XXXX news feed where another data breach had occured. Taking that event into consideration, I went about checking on my credit to see if there was any errors that was unbeknowst to me during that time. Upon doing so, I had noticed there were several inquiries that I had no knowledge of nor had given each of those financial institutions any permission to pull my credit at any point in my life so far. With this information in hand, I sent out a letter by certified mail to Transunion on XX/XX/year> in which I stated that there were erroneous inquiries on my credit report that did not have permissable permission from me to exist on my credit report. Additionally, I requested that those listed inquiries be investigated and removed due to them being unauthorized by me. ( please see attached letter that was sent ). I patiently waited 30 days per FCRA rules for a response and never received one. In the month of XXXX, I checked my credit report then to see if during the updating of my credit report phase had occured, had there been any changes/removals of the unauthorized inquiries to which I discovered there nothing had been removed but instead, I discovered a new hard inquiry that was listed/titled as " XXXX ''. I give the Transunion even more time during the whole month of XXXX and nothing changed about what was negatively being reported against me. On XX/XX/year>, close to 75 days later, I sent Transunion a letter by certified mail of their failure to execute their responsibilities of adherence to consumer law and FCRA policy to which their governed and demanded the inquiries be removed. Nevertheless, I also informed Transunion that they were created a civil liability situation per violation that they were carrying out. Again no response had been given to me regarding this.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX of 2024, there was a charge of {$210.00} dollars from a location called XXXX XXXX XXXX. I then come to realize another two charges, both from the same location. These charges were from XXXX ( A location far from where I live ). I initially called on XX/XX/XXXX to dispute all the charges because they were not made by me as well as replace my credit card. I explicitly stated that I want to reverse these but they end up only replacing my credit card and leaving these charges undisputed. I had to wait around a week before calling again. This time they tell me that the charges were never disputed but that theyll go ahead and add that to the claim. I wait another week, with no updates and after more than the 5-10 days they told me I would receive an update, a letter finally arrives multiple weeks after disputing the charges. The letter then states that the XXXX transactions were adjusted and that I will receive credit for the issue. However, they never even disputed the charge of {$210.00} at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I had been patient and kind with all of the representatives during these calls so I was left wondering why I was not receiving quality care. Thus, for a fourth time I had to call to finally have it disputed. In the end, they rejected my dispute with the reasoning that I had it in my possession at the time of transaction. I am extremely dissatisfied and frankly, upset with the runarounds. I have never been to that location neither or would ever because one, i am not interested in their services, especially as a more masculine male. Two, Im not their target customer base. It has impacted my credit score and has made it much harder for me financially as I am a full-time student and work part-time to be able to support myself.

Consumer complaint narrative: I got my statement for this card Barclaycard and noticed my available credit was lower. I looked and the XXXX cards one is the XXXX XXXX XXXX and the other is the Barclaycard Rewards MC were both decreased. I started looking through the mail I had to see what was going on. I called and they said that letter was mailed out she first said XX/XX/XXXX and I could barely understand her then she said XX/XX/XXXX which it is not here yet. I said why was it lowered. She said she email me I said no tell me and she told me I have too many credit card balances. I do but I pay them on time and run a balance but have not opened any new ones and good credit score. I then ask if I Could speak to someone she said no that there is no one to talk to so I get mad end call. I decided to call back another customer service agent says she understands my frustration gives me to underwriting dept who says oh you have too many opening accounts sorry you can call back in 60 days oh and first woman told me 30 btw. I then call back 3rd time no where and they say no manager can talk to me. Well today guess what a manager calls me leaves me message. I do not answer because did not know she was calling because they said I could not talk to anyone, I am also sending messages on their website and they said that reason why they decreased it is because I was not using my credit so they lowered to go with what I was using. They are going to hurt my credit by doing this. The store card was {$2100.00} and they lowered to {$300.00}. I have now paid off both cards and told them would not use them anymore and they told me if 6 months goes by they will close it so they are basically threating me. Will ya please check into this awful cc company.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Request for Re-investigation and Removal of Incorrect Bankruptcy Listing on Credit Report I am writing to follow up on my previous complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of a bankruptcy on my credit report by [ TRANSUNION ). Despite being verified, the bankruptcy entry remains a clear and direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I urge a thorough re-investigation and immediate removal of this incorrect entry. 
US BANKRUPTCY COURT Account Number : XXXX XXXX. Persistent Inaccuracy Despite Verification : The bankruptcy entry on my credit report is inaccurate. Despite my previous complaint and the so-called verification process, this error persists. This not only causes substantial harm to my financial status but also undermines my rights under the FCRA. 

2. Re-Evaluation of Privacy Rights Under FCRA : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 4 ), I am entitled to privacy and accuracy in my credit reporting. Re-reporting and verifying flawed information without thorough investigation contravene this statutory protection.

3. Questionable Permissible Purpose : According to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies must have a verifiable permissible purpose to disclose my credit information. The maintenance and dissemination of inaccurate bankruptcy information do not meet this requirement and imply a serious oversight in due diligence.

4. Inadequate Re-investigation Process : The current verification does not align with the requirements of 15 U.S. Code S 1681 ( a ), which mandates a comprehensive and meaningful re-investigation of disputed information. The inadequate and superficial verification process has perpetuated this critical error on my credit report.

The persistence of this erroneous bankruptcy entry on my credit report despite prior verification is unacceptable and a clear violation of FCRA. I trust that the CFPB will prioritize this follow-up complaint, enforce compliance with FCRA regulations , and guarantee a swift and fair resolution. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

# Follow-up Complaint to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) # # Re : Bank of America - Delayed Payment Processing and Continued Credit Damage Date : XX/XX/year> Dear CFPB, I am writing to file an urgent follow-up complaint against Bank of America ( BOA XXXX regarding a recent incident of delayed payment processing, which has further damaged my credit score. This complaint is in addition to my previous grievances about BOA 's ongoing financial misconduct and obstruction. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX New Incident : 1. Payment Attempt : On XX/XX/XXXX, one day before the due date, I made a payment on my BOA credit card account via phone, as online access remains restricted. 
2. Delayed Processing : Despite making the payment before the due date, BOA did not process the payment until XX/XX/XXXX. The representative told me the payment was processed, which turned out not to be true, resulting in negative affect on my XXXXredit score.

3. Late Payment Status : As a result of this delay, my account was marked as having a late payment, further damaging my credit score. XXXX XXXX XXXX Specific Concerns : 1. Intentional Delay : Given the pattern of obstruction I've experienced, I believe this delay in processing may have been intentional, designed to force my account into late status. 
2. Lack of Transparency : At no point during the payment process was I informed that the payment would not be processed immediately or that it might result in a late payment status.

3. Continued Credit Damage : This late payment mark adds to the ongoing damage to my credit score, which I detailed in my previous complaint.

4. Compounding Issues : This incident compounds the problems I've been facing with BOA, including restricted account access and potential retaliatory actions. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX  Additional Context : - This incident occurred despite my diligent efforts to make the payment on time, navigating the obstacles BOA has placed in my way. 
- The continued pattern of issues suggests a systematic effort to hinder my ability to manage my account and maintain my credit standing. 

This incident further demonstrates the urgent need for intervention. The combined effect of BOA 's actions continues to jeopardize my financial stability and future prospects, including my ability to secure housing. 

I am prepared to provide any additional information or documentation necessary to support this complaint. I urgently seek your immediate intervention to address these compounding issues with Bank of America. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Re : Bank of America - Ongoing Financial Misconduct and Credit Damage Date : [ Current Date ] Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Bank of America ( BOA ) for their continued pattern of financial misconduct, which is severely impacting my credit score and jeopardizing my ability to secure housing. This complaint is a follow-up to previous grievances I have filed, as the situation has not improved and has, in fact, worsened. 
Background : Following my initial complaints about fraudulent transfers, BOA closed all my accounts, including a credit card. 
Despite the account closures, the credit card continues to accrue interest, negatively impacting my credit score. 
I have been systematically denied access to online banking services, preventing me from managing my accounts and making payments. 

Recent Developments : BOA has effectively weaponized their private wealth management team to restrict my ability to pay off my credit card debt. 
My only option for payment is through phone calls, which has proven unreliable and potentially manipulated. 
A recent attempt to make a payment before the 120-day past due mark was unsuccessful, resulting in additional penalties.

When calling to address this issue, I was informed that collections are responsible for processing these payments but are unavailable on Sundays, further delaying resolution.

Specific Concerns : Deliberate Obstruction : The continued technical issues preventing online access appear to be intentional, designed to hinder my ability to manage and pay off my debt.

Retaliatory Practices : The pattern of account closures and subsequent obstacles strongly suggest retaliatory action for my previous complaints.

Credit Score Damage : The ongoing interest accrual and reported late payments are causing significant and potentially long-lasting damage to my credit score.

Housing Jeopardy : As a direct result of these actions, my ability to secure an apartment is now at risk due to my compromised credit standing. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA, XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Dispute of Late Payment Reporting on XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of a late payment on my Kickoff account, which appears on my credit report. I am invoking my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Metro 2 Compliance to ensure the accurate reporting of my account information. XXXX. Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting : The reported late payment on my XXXX account is erroneous. I have always made my payments on time, and I dispute the validity of this reported delinquency. Under the Metro 2 standard, which you are obligated to follow, the reporting of account status and payments must be accurate, timely, and verifiable. XXXX. Challenge to Method of Verification : I challenge the method by which this late payment was verified. Under the FCRA and Metro 2 guidelines, you are required to provide a detailed and specific method of verification used by the furnisher ( XXXX ) to confirm the accuracy of the late payment. The standard " verified as accurate '' response is not sufficient. Please provide me with the full details of the investigation process, including who at XXXX was contacted, the documentation provided, and how this determination was made. XXXX. Timing of Payment : I also dispute the timing of the payment reported as late. According to Metro 2 reporting standards, the timing of any delinquency must align with the actual due date of the payment, and any deviation from this should be properly documented. I request that you investigate and ensure that the correct payment date is accurately reflected in your records. XXXX. Request for Reinvestigation : As the current reporting does not comply with Metro 2 guidelines, I request that XXXX reinvestigate this matter and update my credit report accordingly. Please provide written confirmation that this disputed information has been removed or corrected. If you fail to remove this inaccurate information, I request a description of the procedures used during the investigation, as mandated by law. Per 15 USC1681n ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA allows consumers to recover up to {$1000.00} 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports I am challenging any hard inquires or unauthorized accounts without a permissible purpose. 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments Also I noticed some incorrect personal information being reported on my credit which I am demanding to be correct immediately! Please be advised that failure to comply with the FCRA and Metro 2 standards will result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal remedies for noncompliance. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a response within the time frame prescribed by the FCRA ( 30 days ). You can contact me via the information listed above if further details are required. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Request for Re-investigation and Removal of Incorrect Bankruptcy Listing on Credit Report I am writing to follow up on my previous complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of a bankruptcy on my credit report by [ EQUIFAX ). Despite being verified, the bankruptcy entry remains a clear and direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I urge a thorough re-investigation and immediate removal of this incorrect entry. 
US BANKRUPTCY COURT Account Number : XXXX XXXX. Persistent Inaccuracy Despite Verification : The bankruptcy entry on my credit report is inaccurate. Despite my previous complaint and the so-called verification process, this error persists. This not only causes substantial harm to my financial status but also undermines my rights under the FCRA. 

2. Re-Evaluation of Privacy Rights Under FCRA : Under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( 4 ), I am entitled to privacy and accuracy in my credit reporting. Re-reporting and verifying flawed information without thorough investigation contravene this statutory protection.

3. Questionable Permissible Purpose : According to 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies must have a verifiable permissible purpose to disclose my credit information. The maintenance and dissemination of inaccurate bankruptcy information do not meet this requirement and imply a serious oversight in due diligence.

4. Inadequate Re-investigation Process : The current verification does not align with the requirements of 15 U.S. Code S 1681 ( a ), which mandates a comprehensive and meaningful re-investigation of disputed information. The inadequate and superficial verification process has perpetuated this critical error on my credit report.

The persistence of this erroneous bankruptcy entry on my credit report despite prior verification is unacceptable and a clear violation of FCRA. I trust that the CFPB will prioritize this follow-up complaint, enforce compliance with FCRA regulations , and guarantee a swift and fair resolution. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I entered into a signed agreement with XXXX XXXX, a representative of XXXX, XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. The system, she said would be delivered and installed by XXXX : however, delivery and install of the XXXX system did not happen until late May. The sales pitch was that I would have virtually no electrical bill due to solar systems production and that I would receive a tax rebate of {$7700.00} to facilitate the early pay-off of the system if applied to the XXXX XXXX installment plan. The system was financed through Sunlight Financial at a rate of .99 % if payments were XXXX which resulted in a monthly of approximately {$100.00} and some change. This payment would change and increased to {$140.00} and some change if the rebate in the amount of {$7700.00} was not applied or paid toward the principal by the due date on or before the XXXX month. Well, the stated rebate-promised/stated rebate never happened. See the video link below. 
https : XXXX? XXXX Now back to the install of solar system. Upon the completion of the system, I began to receive utility bills XXXX times more than I was paying without the system. I called the company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to tell of this acute increase in my billing statement. It wasnt XXXX XXXX that I spoke with, but a XXXX was now the spokesperson for the entity. She vowed to assist me the problem and find some kind of resolution. I repeatedly told her that it appeared as if the solar system itself was the cause of the sharp increase. My usage went from XXXX kilowatts to XXXX hr. per month immediately after the system was put in operation. She and others blamed the utility company and agreed to speak with them to make sure that the meter readings were correct and to make sure that the surplus or over-production of solar power was being credited towards the bill. We called them all-we called the servicers and the delivers of the electricity to determine if all the settings and meters were properly in place. All of them assured us that everything concerning the meter setup was in place and correct. Months of this would go on-back and forth with providers and the delivery company. By this time, I am on my third provider due to not being able to satisfy payment of the humongous bills -- XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. XXXX promises to have technician out to home to affirm a correct and proper install of the system and a promise to pay the high bills from the utility companies by the owner XXXX & an associate named XXXX XXXX XXXX father was part owner of the entity with XXXX. In the meantime, Im trying to mitigate as much as I possibly can. I scaled back my usage of all power that my family could stand. I am XXXX to 7 months into the system when finally someone come to check the system. I can not recall the name of the person but all he said was that the meter is running backwards and that faut lies with the delivery of the XXXX. So, I move to deal with XXXX who says in return that the issue is the system itself the installation thereof. 
I call XXXX & send out blast texts to all XXXX associates and representative on a regular to see if anyone could or would rescue me from what Ive encountered. I had to do this every chance XXXX got-sometimes very early and sometime very late because the answering of my call had become null and void. Finally I get a call from a XXXX or a XXXX who says my dealing is not with him but call XXXX. I ask who XXXX and he is tells me XXXX XXXX is the owner of the company. I called him and he said that someone would be out to check out the system. Again months go by and still no one shows up. I again start to call and or send out blast text to get some attention. I get a call from XXXX XXXX who tells me I can not be bugging his team so early. He said for me to deal with him only and not be sending out text messages to them guys again -- he begins to isolate me. My dealing with him proved futile as well. I was told by his reps/associates that my high billings would be taken care of until they could get to the bottom of the issue. He told me to send him my billing statements that amounted about {$1500.00} for and he sent a check for like {$600.00}. Again, months would pass with no response from the company. I continued to mitigate the expense of powering my home. I also became suspicious of the XXXX XXXX XXXX entity and started to investigate and inquire answers online. I made claims and reports to BBB. I had roofers to install extra wind turbines which amounted to {$1200.00} in the roof which I never needed before. XXXX installed, light bulbs changed, new heat pump XXXX unit all of which I never needed prior to the installed solar system. I even called the manufacturer of the installed inverter to see what could be done to alleviate the high energy cost of powering my home and to tell of an out of business rumor of the entity. On XXXX different occasions I spoke with a XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX who suggested I move on and locate another entity to service the system because the system appeared to be grossly under producing from the interview on the phone. In following their suggestion no one but no one would consent to touch the work of another company or XXXX due to possibly liabilities. Also to get someone to work on or check out the system could possibly cancel out the warranty that supposingly came with the equipment. They gave a lot of reasons for not assisting in the efforts and said that it would be at least $ XXXX for the efforts not including travel to my site. XXXX reason they gave really caught my attention and that was the fact that many of these XXXX did not obtain proper permits to install the systems and suggested that I write or contact the agency for licensed electricians. To add salt to the injury, I went to the XXXX of XXXX to see if I could obtain information on the licensed electrician who performed the install only to found out that no such permit to perform any electrical work on my home was obtained. There I spoke with a XXXX XXXX who told me that no permit existed for such a job! Now I am faced with legality issues and transgressions of city ordinances. I thought to seek legal avenues, but no lawyer would even consider the issue for me. They all suggested that I stop all payment, but this would further jeopardize a perfect credit reporting that is already tarnish by the utility companies reporting not pay outstanding monthly bills. 
XXXX stated above, I am left to take actions of reporting, researching, and investigating in my own hands since no resolution was arrived at. This is what I have so far : XXXX mounting complaints against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX BBB ( all are similar to XXXX XXXX, communication, & etc ; XXXX out of business and/but operating in the same industry under a new name and identity -- Sunset XXXX & XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the courts of XXXX XXXX, OK against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX https XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX... ) I spoke with the XXXX XXXX attorney, XXXX XXXX, to ask if I could join XXXX XXXX a witness in the case. He thanked me for the call and offer but stated that he was not sure if there would be anything profited but that he would keep my contact information should anything positive come out of the suit. I am the one who told him and the BBB that the entity was using another name to maintain his devious practices in the industry. XXXX. Sunlight Financial LLC has its share of complaints and perils-internal & through the BBB. By way of email correspondence, I received approximately 6 months worth of installments notifications. I knew this because I had to register my account online to make the payments. When I noticed that no billing correspondences were no longer coming through the email system, I went to the customer portal to check what was happening. Some how or another I was direct or directed to call a Launch Servicing ... I also discovered an email from them dated XX/XX/XXXX stating... Dear XXXX XXXX, There is an important document available for you from Launch Servicing, LLC for account number ending in XXXX. Please log in to your online account and select XXXX Account, then Account Documents and Correspondence to view this important account communication. 

Please do not respond to this message. To respond, send a message from your online account or call us at ( XXXX ) XXXX. 

You are receiving this email because you signed up for electronic communication through XXXX XXXX, XXXX. If you would like to stop receiving email notifications and resume receiving paper copies of your account documents, you XXXX change your delivery preferences once you are in your online account. 

Thank you, The Launch Servicing, XXXX Customer Service XXXX '' At this point, I am asking questions because I had never heard or had an account with any Launch Servicing, so I called the number. Sunlight XXXX never disclosed any such information or a transfer of the account to me about any intent to have a XXXX XXXX handle the installment payments. Neither did I consent to such a move or transaction. I had no choice in the matter but had to continue to pay to keep my credit report in good standings. Now, as a result of the unbeknown transfer, on my credit report it shows I have XXXX separate accounts for the original installment XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for XXXX XXXX transaction. The impact is and has an erroneous affect on my credit worthiness as it relates to income to debt ratio! Also, Launch Servicing reps are not any assistance to my cause at all. I reported to them case and argument, first on XX/XX/XXXX with no results until XX/XX/XXXX stating Message about servicing XXXX, The email that was sent on XXXX " Hello XXXX XXXX, Please see attached XXXX letter XXXX issued in XXXX. We understand you XXXX be experiencing some issues with the performance of your system. However, Sunlight XXXX is not responsible for maintenance of the solar system. If damages have occurred or an item needs to be addressed, we recommend reaching out to your systems manufacturer, or a solar provider in your area to get the item serviced. '' XXXX Customer Service '' Prior to that response, the reps said that should request a postponement of payment form until a solution could be found and arrived at and if the issue isn't solved continue to request the postponement. I did that and it was granted. But here is the kicker, I called be to see what was the hold up on arriving a solution to my case and the rep said that it had been closed so she had to open another case for the same complaint. Also my advised " file again for a postponement was denied because they said to that I needed to make the request closer to the due date? Wow! I not sure how much closer I should have requested before payment and draft taken place. I am cursed if I do and damned if I don't, huh? This is my plight with this company XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, & Launch Servicing! All the while my payments have been timely and my part of any agreement made has been upheld to the best of my ability and with integrity. The consumer deserves better!

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Friday, XX/XX/XXXX Sir / Maam : I would like to file a complaint of harassment and failure to prove documentation and/or letter ( XXXX ) of validation, against the following C/C company : Wyndham Reward Earner Card W/ Barclays Bank Delaware XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX 

Back on XX/XX/XXXX, ( I was moving from XXXX XXXX XXXX ) I paid off all my bills, cut up all my cards and closed all my C/C. The only C/C that did NOT close my account was : Wyndham Reward Earner Card. My other C/C have me listed as : Paid, Closed / Never Late Account closed at credit grantors request. 

According to my credit report, Wyndham Reward Earner Card, accepted my payment of Paid In FULL on XX/XX/XXXX, and no charges were recorded from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX and then my Closed Account was being charged ( with small charges ( Under {$50.00} ) ) until XX/XX/XXXX and after that, NO MORE CHARGES. Now Barclays Bank, says they charged off $ XXXX and listed me as {$410.00} past due. 

*There is no proof or documentation of this {$100.00} charge off. 

During this time frame of XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, I was not informed that my account was still active and that someone else was using this credit Card, that I had cancelled. 

It wasnt until I received a letter from : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  On XX/XX/XXXX, informing me that Wyndham Reward Earner Card XXXX Barclays Bank Delaware had hired them to collect a debt of {$410.00}, and this is when the Harassment started. XXXX XXXX XXXX would call me on my cell phone and call my wife on her cell phone. It was not until I contacted them to STOP, then they did. I was told that they were hired by, Wyndham Reward / Barclays Bank Delaware, for charges made with my C/C after I had paid the C/C off. I ask them ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) for documentation or Validation of Said Debt. As of today ( XXXX XXXX ) no documentation has been provided, nor have I had any contact with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

While my wife and I were enjoying the XX/XX/XXXX weekend ( XXXX ), my wife received a harassing phone call from the following company**, informing her that I owned Barclays Bank of Delaware , {$410.00} and they were calling to collect. I informed the lady on the phone, that this was my wifes cell number and not to call me or her on this number. The lady informed me that they have the right call me on my cell number and my wifes cell number. I told them to stop, and the lady replied that they would, only after they XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) receive the request in writing. The lady insisted that I make a payment over the phone, to stop these calls and I said no, and hung up. 

A letter was sent, with the date of XXXX XXXX, from : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX them to STOP harassing me by phone and to STOP calling my wifes phone. They informed me of the same information that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, had told me, again, I asked for Validation of Said Debt. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with a statement dated XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and this statement only showed : v XXXX XXXX v Interest Charged o What the statement DID NOT SHOW, was the purchases ( that Wyndham Reward Card / Barclays Bank Delaware ) claimed that I made after I had paid the debt off and when and/or were, the charges were made. 

Once I read the statement, I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and told them, that this statement is NOT a letter of Validation of Said Debt and to this date ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I have not heard back from this company or received any other documentation or letter of validation. 

And the harassment continues, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received another letter from another debt collector : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX DE XXXX I have informed this Debt Collector of the same information that I had informed the other XXXX Debt XXXX of. 

Here are some of the points that are strange to me : XXXX. That Wyndham Reward Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware never contact me? 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Reward Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware, wait a year and a half ( XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ) and then send debt collector ( XXXX ) after me? 

XXXX. Why is there is no proof or documentation of this {$100.00} charge off? 

XXXX. Why wouldnt Wyndham Rewards / Barclays Bank Delaware provide me with any type of documentation or Validation of Said Debt? 

XXXX. Once the Debt XXXX contact me and I request they STOP calling and ask for them to provide me, documentation or Validation of Said Debt, the debt collector stops and Wyndham Rewards / Barclays bank Delaware, hires a different debt collector to harass me? 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware have me down for {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and that never changed? Is because that was the date I paid my C/C Paid in Full and cancelled it! 

XXXX. I was told that there was activity on my Closed Account, right after I Paid the debt off in full ( XX/XX/XXXX ), however, according to my credit report, there was NO active, from XX/XX/XXXX, until XX/XX/XXXX. 

XXXX. Was Wyndham Rewards Earner Card hacked? 

XXXX. Was Barclays Bank Delaware hacked? 

XXXX. Why didnt Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware XXXX do as all my other C/C did and mark me as follows? 

a. XXXX, XXXX / Never XXXX b. Account closed at credit grantors request. 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware, keep my account open? 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware, allow fraudulent charges to be charged to my INACTIVE and CLOSED account, for XXXX  months? 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware, allow fraudulent charges to keep being charged for XXXX months and then STOP? 

XXXX. Why did Wyndham Rewards Earner Card / Barclays Bank Delaware, have me down for Scheduled Payments from XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, then STOP? and then have it revert back to XXXX?

I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of the charge-off status reported by Capital One Financial Services ( `` Capital One '' ) on my credit report. It has come to my attention that Capital One has erroneously reported charge-offs on XXXXXX/XX/year> for the accounts listed below, which I believe are incorrect and unjustified. 
CAPITAL ONE XXXX {$1200.00} CAPITAL ONE XXXX {$980.00} CAPITAL XXXX XXXX {$5500.00} According to my records and the terms and conditions of my credit card agreement with Capital One, the charge-off date should accurately reflect the actual date when the account became delinquent and charge-off occurred. However, the information being reported on my credit report indicates a charge-off status beyond the correct date, which I believe is both misleading and inaccurate. 
I kindly request that Capital One promptly investigate and correct this reporting error on my credit report. The inaccurate reporting of these charge-offs have a significant negative impact on my creditworthiness, making it essential to rectify this matter as soon as possible.

I understand that, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Capital One is obligated to conduct a reasonable investigation into the disputed information and provide a timely response. I kindly request that you provide me with written notification of the results of your investigation within 30 days of receiving this letter.

I contacted XXXX to transfer my XXXX services to the new address and was assured that my final bill from the old address would be transferred to my new account. However, this did not happen. A ticket was submitted ( Ticket Number : XXXX ) to correct the error, but it was not properly addressed. 

In XXXX, when XXXX XXXX  was handling this debt, I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, and the collection was removed from my credit report. That complaint was assigned case number XXXX and was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX. However, the same debt has now been picked up by IC System and incorrectly reported once again on my XXXX report. 

Given that this is the exact same debt, I request that IC Systems collection be removed from my credit report as it was previously found to be inaccurate. I am submitting this complaint to seek your assistance in resolving this matter once more.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of inaccurate information on my credit report Account Number XXXX XXXX Credit Bureau XXXX EQUIFAX Account Type : Credit Card I am writing to you under my rights according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C . 1681 ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1601 ) to dispute inaccurate and unverifiable information on my credit report related to the account I hold with [ creditor name, e.gXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which has been marked as a " charge-off. '' After reviewing my credit report, I have identified the following discrepancies between the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX reported XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX' XXXX : Highest reported balance XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Equifax : Highest reported balance : {$2600.00} Current balance owed : {$2600.00} Payment status : Closed, reported as " Charged off, '' additionally noting that the balance was " reported as a loss by the creditor. '' Furthermore, according to the XXXX report, the account was closed due to inactivity, which is a significant discrepancy compared to the other bureaus that do not mention inactivity as the reason for closure. This inconsistency between the credit bureaus impacts my right to have my information reported accurately and fairly as stipulated by the FCRA under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates that credit bureaus maintain maximum accuracy in the information reported.

Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 ), I am entitled to clear and accurate information regarding credit obligations and payment history, which is not being reflected in this case due to inconsistencies between the different credit bureaus. 

I request that, in accordance with the FCRA and TILA, you investigate this dispute and promptly remove the inaccurate information and the charge-off from my credit report, as the discrepancies and errors demonstrate the inaccuracy of the information being reported. Please provide me with the results of your investigation and a corrected credit report as soon as possible. 

I have attached copies of my credit report highlighting the discrepancies and the inaccurate information. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your quick response.Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Details : 1. Description of the Issue : On XX/XX/year>, Ally Financial submitted a letter to me, XXXX XXXX, stating that my auto loan was paid off. During this period, the Texas Title for the vehicle was released by Ally Financial and sent to me via mail, further confirming that the loan was settled. 

However, on XX/XX/year>, I discovered that Ally Financial had reported my account as past due and delinquent on my credit report. I immediately contacted Ally Financial to resolve this discrepancy. During our discussions, Ally Financial admitted that they had mistakenly sent the letter on XX/XX/year>, incorrectly stating that the loan was paid off, and also released the vehicle title to me in error. Despite this admission, Ally Financial failed to inform me of any remaining balance prior to damaging my credit report. 

XXXX. Steps Taken to Resolve the Issue : I attempted to negotiate with Ally Financial and sought a resolution, making it clear that : Ally Financial had reported the account as paid off in their letter. 
Ally Financial released the title to the auto, reinforcing the statement that the loan was settled. 
Ally Financial never contacted me by any means to address their mistake or to notify me of any outstanding balance before tarnishing my credit report. 
I was more than willing to pay any remaining balance if one existed, as I was under the impression, based on Ally Financial 's communication, that the loan was fully paid off. On XX/XX/year>, I paid the remaining balance immediately upon being informed. Despite this, Ally Financial has refused to remove the negative reports from my credit report that were due to their admitted errors. 

XXXX. How This Issue Has Affected Me : The inaccurate reporting by Ally Financial has negatively impacted my credit score, causing undue stress and financial hardship. This mistake has affected my ability to obtain credit on reasonable terms, which is unfair given that the negative report resulted solely from Ally Financial 's admitted errors. 

XXXX. What I Am Requesting : I request that Ally Financial correct their records and immediately update all relevant credit reporting agencies to remove the negative entries associated with this account, given that these entries were made due to their mistake. I also ask for written confirmation that these corrections have been made. 

Supporting Documents : A copy of the letter from Ally Financial dated XX/XX/year>, confirming the loan was paid off. 
Records of communication with Ally Financial regarding the discrepancies and my prompt payment of the balance. 

XXXX. Desired Resolution : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that Ally Financial corrects their error by updating my credit report to accurately reflect the resolution of this account as of XX/XX/year>, and remove all negative entries that were incorrectly reported. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The repossession by EXETER FINANCE LLC. inaccurately reported on my credit file following a significant data breach, where over 4 billion Social Security numbers and personal information were exposed to hackers. Due to this breach, the integrity of my personal data has been compromised, creating a strong possibility of inaccuracies in the information reported. Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum accuracy, yet the breach casts doubt on the validity of the repossession. 

I have taken several actions : Filed a formal dispute with the credit bureau. 
Notified the creditor associated with the repossession. 
Submitted an identity theft report to the FTC. 
Despite these actions, the repossession remains on my credit report, causing significant damage to my credit score. The continued presence of this inaccurate information, particularly after a data breach, violates my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), which mandates the removal of information in cases of identity theft or compromised data.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Complaint Subject : Complaint Against PHH Mortgage, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  for Denial of Loan Modification Request Consumer : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Phone Number : XXXX Email : XXXX Complaint Details : I am writing to formally file a complaint against PHH Mortgage, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  for the denial of my loan modification request. I have been experiencing severe financial hardship due to multiple hospitalizations stemming from ongoing health conditions. Despite providing all the necessary documentation and explaining my situation in detail, my request for a loan modification has been unfairly denied. 

Hardship Details : Medical Hardship : My financial difficulties are a direct result of numerous hospitalizations related to serious health conditions. These health challenges have significantly impacted my ability to maintain regular employment and, consequently, to meet my mortgage obligations. 

Income Support : Despite my current hardships, I have a clear plan to resolve my financial difficulties. My two daughters have committed to assisting me financially. Their income documents, which demonstrate their ability to contribute to the mortgage payments, have been submitted along with the modification request.

Unfair Denial : Despite providing all required documentation and outlining my situation, PHH Mortgage, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  have denied my request without offering a clear or fair explanation. This denial has placed me in a precarious financial situation, with the looming threat of losing my home. 

Resolution Sought : I am requesting the CFPB 's intervention to ensure that my loan modification request is reconsidered fairly. Specifically, I am seeking : Reevaluation of Loan Modification Request : A thorough and fair reconsideration of my loan modification request, taking into account the provided documentation and the financial assistance from my daughters.

Clear Communication : A detailed explanation of the reasons behind the initial denial and a transparent process for reevaluating my application.

Immediate Relief : While my modification request is being reevaluated, I request that any foreclosure or related actions be paused to prevent further financial and emotional distress.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt assistance in resolving this issue.

Attachments : Income documents from both daughters.

Medical records ( if applicable ).

Correspondence related to the loan modification request. 
Signature : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year>
