Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem making or receiving payments
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFBP team, I have been struggling for over 3 months to resolve a missing deposit to my Capital One checking account. 

My employer, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has been depositing my check by mail to Capital One every month for a year. 

The check comes from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. It comes in the amount of {$2500.00}. 

The check is sent to : Capital One Attn : Payment Processing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX My XX/XX/XXXX paycheck was mailed to Capital One at the end of XXXX. It was supposed to show in my checking account before the XXXX  of XXXX, but it never did. 

I asked my employer to look into it. He checked with his banker, XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX, and the funds were removed from my employers account. It shows Capital One processed the deposit on XX/XX/XXXX. 

We waited a few days to see if it would appear. Then I called Capital One to ask what the delay was. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Call # XXXX [ XXXX ] : I explained to the Capital One phone rep that my employer has been sending checks to deposit in my account for almost a year, and mine had not shown up in the account yet. 

The rep told me initially that the branch my employer had been sending the checks to closed down. He said in that case, the check would be returned by mail. 

I explained to him that clearly the check was not returned by mail because the funds were already removed from my employers account and are not showing in mine. 

He then told me to verify the address that my employer had been sending the check to ( after having already told me the branch had closed ) and call back to file a missing deposit claim. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] : I spoke to another rep and told him I had the address. It is the same address printed on the checks. He said I needed a 15-digit trace number to file a claim.

I contacted my employer, and he contacted XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX again for the tracing number. 

XXXX XXXX verified that the check had been paid and that it had been processed by Capital One. They send me a copy of the check and the trace number ( attached ). 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] : I called Capital One back and spoke to another rep who said she would file a claim. I told her I had copies of the check. Couldnt I just email them? It seemed that was not an option. 

I told her my employers name and trace number as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX She told me that she filed a claim, and I would hear back within 45 days. 
This was very concerning as waiting a month and a half for my pay would be difficult, but I had no choice. 

XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Capital One saying my claim # XXXX was denied ( attached ). 

The email says : We finished researching your disputes. Based on the information we have, your claim has been denied due to the following : Our records dont show an incoming deposit from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$2500.00}. We recommend you reach out to the sender to verify they have the correct account and routing info. Once confirmed, please request a 15-digit trace number from the senders bank. This proves the payment has successfully been sent and allows us to better research the deposit in question. 

They did not give any real reason for denying the claim or how the money disappeared. Also, the name of the company is wrong. The rep did not record it correctly. It also asks for the trace number, which I had already given. 
During this time, I was in XXXX dealing with a family crisis and was unable to respond right away. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] : I called the phone number given in the email, explaining to a rep named XXXX that my claim had been denied, but the information in the claim was wrong and that may be the reason the problem isnt resolved. I also reiterated that I had copies of the check and my employers bank statements to prove Capital One deposited/cashed the check that did not appear in my account. 

She told me that she corrected my information and instructed me to send my documents to XXXX referencing my claim number. I would hear something in 15 business days. 

XXXX XXXX I emailed XXXX as instructed, attaching the front and back of the check and all the information thus far. 

I never got a confirmation the email was received or any reply whatsoever. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Call # XXXX [ XXXX ] : I called Capital One again, asking for an update on the status of my claim. The rep verified my info and said she would resubmit it. I would hear from someone in 15 business days. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX MAIL Since I was traveling in XXXX and had not heard anything back from my inquiries, my employer, XXXX XXXX, XXXX and Owner of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, offered to send hard copies of the documents to Capital One by mail. We followed the instructions here XXXX XXXX XXXX. He also included a letter from himself on the company letterhead. We have yet to receive any reply. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] : I had not had any replies from Capital One to my emails or any phone calls or the mailed in dispute, so I called again to ask about the status of my claim. 

The rep said that there was nothing that could be done. 
She said I must call the branch that the check was sent to. 
I asked her to give me the contact information for that location. 
She said she could not. I would have to look it up myself. 

After getting off the phone with her, I looked up the phone number for the Capital One address the payment was being sent to ( the same one printed on the check ). It is the payment processing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  which I could not find any phone number for except the usual customer service XXXX number that I had been calling with no success. 

Ive attached screenshots of my Capital One checking account showing all the mailed in deposits since XX/XX/XXXX. Ive also included the check and copies of my emails. 
It has been over 3 months that I have been missing my XXXX paycheck. I have called 6 times and sent 4 emails. I tried to get help on XXXX and XXXX. 

My employer sent all the documents and the dispute from via XXXX mail. I have not received any response from these communications. 

The representatives Ive spoken with over the phone are friendly, but do not seem confident in what needs to be done in this situation and have not been helpful in resolving my problem or giving me adequate reasons for my claim being denied. Many were not XXXX XXXXXXXX speakers, and I think that is why there was so much error over the phone. 

I have been a Capital One customer since XXXX. I have several savings accounts in addition to my checking, and also a credit card. I am never late with payments and I never overdraft. All identity verification steps have been completed throughout the claims process, despite my temporary location in Panama.I don't understand how the bank can treat a customer this way. 

Clearly, someone at Capital One made a mistake or committed fraud, and I am still missing a months worth of pay in the amount of {$2500.00}. 

In conclusion, this case involves a consistent history of successful deposits suddenly interrupted, with clear evidence from XXXX XXXX confirming the funds ' withdrawal. 

Despite providing a trace number, Capital One has failed to effectively utilize this information. Their communication has been inconsistent and often unresponsive, with representatives providing conflicting information. The financial impact of missing a month 's pay has been significant, and has disrupted my financial plans as well as my daily living. 

I'm requesting a thorough investigation using the provided trace number, a detailed explanation of the funds ' whereabouts, and compensation for the time and resources expended. 

This situation potentially violates banking regulations regarding timely dispute resolution and proper deposit handling. I've provided a clear timeline of events and am requesting escalation to a higher authority within Capital One, given the complexity and duration of this issue. As a loyal customer since XXXX with multiple accounts, I expect Capital One to treat this matter with the seriousness it deserves and to provide a prompt and satisfactory resolution. 

I have further documentation if needed. 

Note : Since this issue, I've asked my employer to wire me my pay. In XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX accidentally sent me both a check and a wire. The mailed in check did clear, so it proves that the branch they were sending it to was not closed and it was processed as usual. When XXXX XXXX XXXX discovered they paid me twice, the check was cancelled and the funds returned.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem accessing account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/year> I opened a checking account with Huntington Bank online! Approximately two weeks later I was locked out of my online access! I called and the representative unlocked my access! The same day I was locked out of my access again! I contacted the bank customer service number and was told that I needed to come in with my Social Security card and identification to verify my identity. 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX I contacted the bank again and communicated my difficulty in Physically being able to present myself into the branch Due to being in a location, currently not serviced by one of the branches! I informed the representative that I am a XXXX person and traveling is very Difficult for me, I understand the rules of the USA patriot act requires them obtain this information! They had already opened my account, allowed me to fund the account allowed me to make transactions on the account, And now they have barred my access to allow me to verify the safety of my funds And recent transactions! 

I asked the representative how many other banks allow the opening of bank accounts in the United States without ever seeing a customer inside of a branch and he couldnt answer So I presented a reasonable alternative that should suffice the patriot act. I asked if he could send me an affidavit requiring the information the bank needed from me, allowing me to have a notary, verify my identifying documents, in my presence. And forward that document to a representative in the bank that could lift my being frozen out of my account. 


The representative at Huntington Bank said that they required anyone opening an account with them to Come inside the branch. 


He had no answer as to why they do not allow legal representatives such as a notary to verify for them He also had no answers to how they made their services available to Americans with XXXX I have also been put out by canceling the direct deposit from My government benefits that were scheduled to be paid there this coming Monday XXXX  By redirecting them to Another financial institution that I have been using that has higher fees, causing me to have to wait an additional week for my funds to come in the Mail during the temporary validation. That the government benefits require while validating my account.

Product: Checking or savings account

Consumer complaint narrative: I opened a checking account with Chase Bank on XX/XX/year>, at or around XXXX XXXX. One or two days later, I deposited a money order for {$1000.00} and also deposited cash equalling {$1000.00}. Two days later, I deposited another {$1000.00}. Later that day, I realized I couldn't log into my account anymore. I called the phone number that I was told to call on the website. The representative authenticated me and then said to me that the bank decided to close my account. I asked for the reason and if there was anything I could do to help resolve the problem. I was told they couldn't give me any details about the situation and that they had a right to close the account for any reason. I told them I understood but felt I needed to know if it was for suspicious activity, compliance issues, or other matters so that I could help in any way. They again stated that they chose not to give out any details. I told them it would be more transparent to give me something, or it would make me feel discriminated against as a consumer. I don't know why they would close my account and inconvenience me by waiting 20 days to receive my money and lock me out, so I can't verify my funds without any reason.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Can't close your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I became the guardian for my Dad after a lengthy legal battle until he passed in 2021. US Bank allowed someone to take money out of his account, who I believed actually worked for them in XXXX, XXXX  ( per her stating she worked there ), they ignored my submission of facts, and ignored my attempts to address this. My Dad had several mental and physical disorders. It was a clear issue of elder abuse. They said I missed the submission date, but they did not send the information to my address as requested, instead to the address that the person was at, making it difficult for me to address. They would not help me then and I still could not get help from the local branch in XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX as it was too costly to go to XXXX. 

In conjunction with all this, when I received guardianship of my Dad after going through a lengthy legal process, I set up this account with USBank. My Dad 's previous accounts where money was being taken from him was there, so I figured it was just easy to transfer until I could figure something out He passed away in the XXXX due to XXXX  XXXX  due to this situation, and now I have been battling with US Bank over the accounts. I am the sole heir as deemed by the XXXX  court system as my Dad didn't have much. They have routinely taken {$5.00} out of the account and now it is not even {$100.00}. I physically took in proof of death certificate ( made me bring in an original certificate twice ) and the court order to the local bank in XXXX XXXX, which they took copies of twice, and they refuse to let me close the account, even though there was a court order I provided. 

So the first issue is that they will not let me close these accounts and let the now less than {$100.00} come to me. They keep taking it. They state it is a federal legal thing and they can't close it for me. 

Second issue, they sold my mortgage which was transferred to US Bank when US Bank purchase XXXX XXXX. A few days ago, I received a notice that they just closed my personal checking account, which had nothing to do with my Dad 's account, and took the few dollars that were in it. Nothing now shows up on my online account and I can not access any statements. I received no prior notice they were doing this and no mailed correspondence, just an email after the fact with the last 4 digits of my account. 

I realize this is not XXXX XXXX XXXX, but it is the principal of this entire issue of how it was handled. I was just trying to clean up and close this matter for my Dad. The stress I endured for two years trying to save my Dad from this person, to have him die in the XXXX where she dumped him during XXXX  has been unbelievable and US Bank just wouldn't help me when I provided them the documents twice. 


And now, they took my checking account, closed it, which I was required to have by the original XXXX XXXX  to do my mortgage with them. 

I feel that they should have immediately helped me not only with the woman taking his money, but allowed me to take out the remaining money, which was about {$200.00}? that was my " inheritance ''. They have removed all the statements, so I can't define exactly what is missing and I gave up. The last time I went in, the account people were sitting there, but refused to help me without a prior appointment, even after they asked what they could help me with? What is the point of asking me if you aren't going to help me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. **Incomplete Data : ** - **Status** : There is no status provided for the account ; this field is blank.

- **Company Sold** : The field seems incomplete. It could be missing details such as the name of the company that purchased the debt, if it was sold to another entity.

- **Balance** : While the balance shows " {$670.00}, '' it's unclear whether this was the original balance, the balance after settlement, or the remaining balance at the time of reporting. 
- **Terms** : The terms are left empty. This usually includes information like the payment terms, such as " 12 months '' or " revolving. '' 2. **Inaccurate or Unclear Information : ** - **Paid Off** : The statement " Account paid in full for less than full balance '' suggests that the debt was settled, but the report does not explicitly clarify that the balance is now {$0.00}. If it was settled, the balance should reflect {$0.00}.

- **Last Payment Date** : The last payment is marked as " XX/XX/year>, '' but the " Balance Updated '' date is " XX/XX/year>, '' which could suggest the balance wasnt updated immediately after payment. 
- **Responsibility** : The term " 1 Month Individual Responsibility '' seems confusing. Typically, responsibility would state whether the account is " Individual '' or " Joint, '' and " 1 Month '' may not be relevant here.

- **Debt Buyer** : If the account was sold, the name of the company that bought the debt is missing.

3. **Consumer Statement** : - The phrase " ITEM IN DISPUTE BY CONSUMER '' indicates that this account is disputed, but there is no further information regarding what is being disputed or the resolution status. It may be helpful to clarify whether this is still under review or if the dispute was resolved.

Ensuring that these details are complete and accurate on a credit report is essential for clear and accurate reporting. If any of this data is inaccurate, it might warrant correction through the appropriate reporting channels.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I, XXXX XXXX, am filing this complaint against Spring Oak Capital regarding a debt that appears on my credit report. I dispute the legitimacy and accuracy of this debt, and I believe Spring Oak Capital is in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I request that this debt be removed from my credit report immediately for the following reasons : 1. Violation of FDCPA ( 15 U.S. Code 1692g ) Failure to Provide Validation of Debt : Spring Oak Capital has failed to provide me with proper validation of the alleged debt. Under FDCPA, I have the right to request and receive validation, including detailed information about the origin, validity, and amount of the debt. Despite my request, Spring Oak Capital has not provided this information, and they continue to

report this debt on my credit report. 2. Violation of FCRA ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) Inaccurate Reporting : Spring Oak Capital is reporting inaccurate information on my credit report in violation of the FCRA. Since the debt has not been validated and I dispute its legitimacy, this inaccurate reporting is harmful and should be corrected immediately. The FCRA mandates that furnishers of information, such as debt collectors, ensure that all information provided to credit reporting agencies is accurate and complete. Failing to verify the debt before reporting it is a clear violation. 
3. Right to Dispute under the FCRA : I have submitted formal disputes to the credit reporting agencies regarding this debt, yet Spring Oak Capital continues to furnish the disputed information without properly investigating the dispute, as required under the FCRA. This failure to conduct a reasonable investigation violates my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had been recommended by XXXX to go to XXXX XXXX to get my " computer '' ( XXXX ) fixed. XXXX had given them detailed information about the issue. This was supposed to be related to my check engine light having turned on, with overheating being the primary issue. In total, it took an entire month for me to get my car back with the check engine light turning on a couple hours after picking it up. They had my mother pay {$500.00} for the part, only to tell her that they did not need it ; this is part of what had taken so much time. During the weekly phone calls with XXXX XXXX XXXX, or my mother, would make to check the status, we found that they hadn't started work. Initially it was a struggle to just get them to order the part I needed. I immediately called them after the light turned on to let them know, and they asked me to bring the car back. I refused, and asked for a refund as I didn't want to spend any more time or money on this business. They did not agree to the refund and continued to suggest I bring the car back. 

This is despite knowing that I had just XXXX  and needed to leave the state in a couple weeks. XXXX another indefinite amount of time for my car was not possible. I had filed a dispute with Discover that was initially found in my favor on XX/XX/XXXX, and the amount was credited. However, this was recently reversed because XXXX XXXX provided documentation that shows I signed for the purchase. This doesn't change the fact that the service I paid for was essentially not provided ( details in documentation ). 

The " computer '' despite being replaced was found to not be working by another repair shop and throwing the same errors that it had when I brought it to XXXX XXXX. I no longer think Discover is going to be a reliable means of communicating this information and would just like to be given a refund. I had to junk the car not soon after, because of further related issues. Important dates are in the documentation. 

Initially, after I had submitted documentation, the case had been put in my favor and I had been credited the refund. However, Discover reversed this after XXXX XXXX had provided their own information. They had sent me a copy of this information, and it did not disprove or override any of my documentation. 

The representative that answered the phone on both XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ( same person ) in the department dealing with disputes, had not given me any concrete reason for the case being reversed in their favor. The woman initially claimed it was because I signed for the purchase, which they had known the entire time. During the second call, her answer had changed to say it was because I had never contacted them about the issue. This had not been proven. XXXX had only provided the phone records between my mother and XXXX battery, as they had asked her to order a part. This part was not the correct part and was another instance of this company mishandling my car and being dismissive of my time. 

XXXX battery had not provided any actual evidence that they had done the service correctly, only that they asked me to bring the car back to them. Discover was not able to answer for this in any meaningful way, and the representative on the phone refused to continue the dispute as I had asked. Discover had emailed me saying that I could continue the dispute if requested, but this representative still refused. I can not remember her name, but she seems to be XXXX of only a few people in this department that answers the phones. 

I was only able to request a second review over the online chat option. This also does not have an explanation from Discover. I am currently waiting for the phone records from my own phone company so that I can send them to Discover ( showing I did contact XXXX immediately after picking up the car ), but as they are handling the case now it XXXX not make any difference.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I believe that the terms and conditions of the loan were not properly disclosed to me, as required by the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. Specifically, I have identified several violations and omissions that invalidate the loan agreement under this federal law : Lack of Full Disclosure of Installment Loan Agreement I did not receive a complete copy of the installment loan agreement at the time of signing. TILA requires that creditors provide borrowers with clear and detailed information regarding the loan terms, including the amount financed, the payment schedule, and the total cost of the loan. I did not receive adequate documentation of these key terms, which constitutes a violation of TILA 's disclosure requirements.

Failure to Provide Notice of Security Interest There was no clear disclosure or explanation that a security interest would be placed on the vehicle as part of the loan agreement. Under TILA, creditors are required to inform borrowers if a security interest is being taken on collateral, in this case, my vehicle, in exchange for the loan. Without this disclosure, the creditor has failed to comply with the legal requirement to fully inform me of my rights and obligations under the loan. 

Undisclosed Lien on Vehicle I was not informed of any lien placed on my vehicle at the time the loan was extended. The Truth in Lending Act mandates that creditors disclose any liens or encumbrances that will be attached to the collateral in the transaction. The failure to disclose the lien renders the agreement incomplete and noncompliant with TILA regulations.

Lack of Disclosure of Finance Charges The finance charge for this loan was not properly disclosed at the time of the agreement. Under TILA, the finance charge, including the total cost of interest and any other fees associated with the loan, must be clearly communicated to the borrower before the loan agreement is signed. The omission of this essential information violates my rights as a consumer under federal law.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative: I was booking a XXXX XXXX flight. During checkout, there's a prompt pitching the American Express XXXX XXXX credit card where it offered {$200.00} Statement Credit after making a XXXX purchase within 6 months. It also states " Know if you're approved with no impact to your credit score. If you're approved and accept this XXXX, your credit score may be impacted. '' It also states that I'll get an instant credit card number to use instantly on the current XXXX purchase. I applied, and was notified that I had been approved. It then ask me if I wanted to accept and receive the instant card number to use immediate. As I was already making a XXXX purchase, I accepted so I can use the card to satisfy the {$200.00} Statement Credit offer. However, after clicking accept, I got a prompt that there's a technical issue and that an instant account number can't be generated but fear not, they'll email it to me. Once I received the email ( almost instant ), I clicked the link to get my number. However, it led me to a screen stating " We're sorry, our systems are not responding right now. We apologize. We are unable to provide your Card Number at this time. Your physical Card will arrive by Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX. '' They definitely have the account number created as the email should the last XXXX digits of the card number ( see attached screenshot ). I called American Express immediately and was told they can not provide over the phone and that I'll have to wait for the card. I realized then I had been bait and switched. I then asked then to null and void the application as if it never happened since I did not get my instant account number as they stated I would. They did not do so. I was fraudulently induced into applying for the credit card either by XXXX XXXX ( it was on their checkout screen ) or American Express ( they process the application and represented that I would get the instant number to use ). Most likely both XXXX and American Express conspired to fraudulently induce me into applying for the credit card and then conveniently have a server issue where an account number can't be generated so that 1 ) American Express would not have to make good on the {$200.00} credit card statement or 2 ) force me to make another XXXX purchase within 6 months in order to receive the credit statement.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Refusal to Investigate Illegal Late Payments in Consumer Report Company : Equifax Issue : Incorrect Information on my credit report - Equifax refuses to investigate Description of the issue : I am writing to file a formal complaint against Equifax for refusing to investigate and correct inaccurate information on my consumer credit report. Specifically, there are illegal late payments listed that I have disputed multiple times. I followed the appropriate dispute process by providing documentation and a detailed explanation to support my claim that these late payments are inaccurate and should not appear on my credit report. 

Despite my repeated efforts, Equifax has refused to conduct a proper investigation or correct the errors, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This incorrect information is negatively impacting my credit score, and I am seeking resolution to this matter. 

Actions taken : I initially submitted a dispute on XX/XX/year>, providing all relevant documentation to support my claim that the reported late payments are inaccurate. I sent a letter to Equifax that was notarized and certified. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received either a letter from Equifax that the documentation which was my social security card and my drivers license are illegal and they sent a refusal to investigate the matter. 

Equifax has failed to meet its legal obligation to investigate the dispute, as outlined in the FCRA. 

**Desired resolution : ** I am requesting that the CFPB intervene to ensure that Equifax complies with its obligation to investigate the dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. I also request that Equifax provide a formal explanation of the steps taken to resolve this issue. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Jefferson Capital Systems XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of Collection Account and Request for Procedural Investigation To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to dispute the collection account listed under my name on my credit report and to request an immediate procedural investigation. This account has been reported in violation of federal laws that protect consumers, specifically 12 CFR 1006.34 and 15 USC 1681-s2. I have not received the required validation information, and I have not been provided an opportunity to dispute the debt before it was placed on my credit report. 

Details of the Disputed Account : Account Name/Number : Jefferson Capital SystemsXXXX Date of First Appearance on Credit Report : XX/XX/year> Violations by Your Agency : Failure to Provide Validation Information : According to 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), you are required to provide specific validation information regarding the debt before furnishing this account to any consumer reporting agency. To date, I have not received this information. 
Denial of Right to Dispute : Under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), I have the right to dispute the validity of this debt within 30 days of receiving the validation information. Since you failed to provide this, my rights have been violated. 

Use of False, Misleading, or Deceptive Means : Your agencys actions in reporting this debt without the required disclosures and validation constitute false, misleading, and deceptive practices under federal law, specifical

ly 15 USC 1681-s2 and 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ). Unauthorized Furnishing to Consumer Reporting Agenci
es : You have no authority to report this account to any consumer reporting agency without providing all legally required disclosures. Your actions are in clear violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) and 15 USC 1681-s2 ( 7 ) ( A ). 

Requested Actions : Immediate Removal of the Collection Account : I demand the immediate removal of this collection account from all consumer reporting agencies until you can provide the legally required validation and dispute information. 

Cease All Collection Activities : Cease all collection activities, including reporting to credit bureaus, until my rights under federal law have been fully respected. 
Provide All Required Documentation : Provide all required validation information and disclosures under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), and allow me the opportunity to dispute this account as mandated by law. 

Correct Reporting Procedures : Ensure that your reporting procedures comply with 12 CFR 1006.34 and 15 USC 1681-s2 to avoid future violations. 
Failure to address this matter promptly and in accordance with federal regulations will leave me no choice but to file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and consider further legal action to protect my rights. 

I expect a written response to this dispute and confirmation of your compliance within 30 days. Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

As per my right to accounting and to clarify this relationship please provide me with the following comprehensive documentation : The Notice of Assignment The Deed of Assignment The original executed agreement A full statement of account as per XXXX guidelines Confirmation upon your chose The default notice Certificated security instrument issued by the United States to show proof of possession over the principal debtor for subrogation rights. 

Please send the requested documentation to the address listed above. I would like to express my willingness to cooperate and work towards a resolution. If there are any discrepancies or concerns, I believe that clear and transparent communication will help us reach a fair resolution. 
Removal or Settlement : If [ JEFFERSON CAPITAL ] can not provide the requested documentation ; I request the immediate removal of the account. Alternatively, if the debt is legitimate, please provide instructions for settling the account in accordance with your fiduciary duties. 
If you can not prove or rebut anything stated within this legal document, you fully agree with all demands being made. If no removal or settlement, I will make the following claims against you in federal court according to the Fee Schedule of the Trust : 1. Fraud and False Statements 2. Conspiracy 3. Failure to Respond to this notice 4. Failure to Respond as Outlined in this Notice of Claim 5. Failure to uphold duties as trustee due to unjust enrichment of the beneficiary of the Trust 6. Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Deposits and withdrawals
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX my mother and I entered the Chase Branch to just cash a check and get a couple of certified checks. The check is a life insurance benefit check that I receive from the insurance company due to my dads death. I was the beneficiary. The plan was to cash the check since it was drawn on Chase, but they were unable to just cash it because the amount. I was splitting it with my mom and little brother. To help my mom get caught up on bills, and with my brother because I know my dad didnt intentionally leave my brother out of an inheritance. He always wanted to make sure that we were okay. Nobody knows the time or day and we definitely didnt expect to be without my dad this soon in life but he did something to make sure that we were okay in the event that something happened to him and now those funds are unjustly being held. They couldnt cash the check due to the amount. At the assistant managers direction, she told me to sign the check over to my mom and for us to deposit it into my moms Chase account, which we did. This is the banks manager, we didnt think twice about it, because the manager is trying to find the best solution and knows how things operate. We were told about a standard hold which we were okay with. My moms account was flagged for fraud due to the check being signed over. Fraud is far from the case, no ill will or bad intentions. My mom was told about the verification process so we got a phone in my name to try to comply and get the situation resolved. I just recently turned XXXX, I have no credit or anything. I was supposed to get my first car with that money and invest in my future. The manager called the department or back office on our behalf stating that we we were directed by her to deposit the check. She sent an escalation stating the same thing and explaining the situation. My mom have been making a lot of calls as well. We lost my dad on XXXX XXXX  of all days, time does not heal or make it easier, we are still grieving and distraught over losing him and now we are in a battle for the insurance inheritance check and we did absolutely nothing wrong. The check cleared fairly quickly, Im assuming because it is the same bank. My mom has sent over documents, took documents in the branch, branch managers have called on our behalf. This isnt right on so many levels. It is causing emotional and financial distress. They cant verify my phone number or me in their system but we have provided proof. I am fresh into XXXX  so any type of verification other than in person with valid identification probably wont work right now. When they first flagged my moms account the insurance company offered to stop payment but the check had already cleared. We just need someone to really help get this resolved

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was given a call from what popped out as Wells Fargo 's customer support number and completely sounded and acted like it. The number I answered was the first one that ends in XXXX. They stated that they were looking for me by name and that they had noticed fraudulent activity for my debit card. I looked at my app and there was fraudulent activity. They then told me the last 4 digits of my card number and the expiration date. They then told me they were going to get me a new card and asked if the address they had on file was correct, which it was. They told me my new card would be shipped in the next few days. They then also " transferred '' me to an automated pin code changer over the phone, so I could change my pin, which is how they ended up getting the pin code. Over the next day or two, I logged into my app and noticed that {$6200.00} was taken out. I immediately called the number on the Wells Fargo website and tried to sort out with them. I told them what had happened, and they told me they would submit a claim for me. 
Ever since then, I have submitted two claims to Wells Fargo ( both have been denied ), one over the phone and the other in-person at a branch. On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted a detailed bank statement where I circled everything I did not authorize and the police report ( reported on XX/XX/XXXX ) about the incident to Wells Fargo.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you without properly notifying you of lawsuit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have contacted the XXXX XXXX XXXX repeatedly over time to try and settled my alleged debt with them. My calls and proposals continuously go unanswered, until suddenly, Im being served paperwork for a lawsuit. I was served once ; and contacted them immediately to resolve this. They do not keep up with clients at all, they do not have autopay for payment plans, they do not send monthly bills or payment reminders, they do not send monthly statements, therefore keeping tracking of payments and due dates is impossible due to the lack of infrastructure on their website. The second time I found out they were suing me, they had gotten a judgement against me to levy my bank account- I was not notified of any delinquent payments on my plan, I was not notified of the new lawsuit, I was not notified of the bank levy, I was only made aware by a law firm offering their legal services to me with the public record from the local courthouse. I notified them immediately that they did not have the right to levy my account as it is shared with a third party, and has protected funds in it. They instead opted to pursue another payment plan. I have repeatedly proposed and called and sent letters about settling the debt- with no answer. They have not properly notified me of my debts in the amount or status of the debt and have also failed to notify me of pursuing legal action. They are unresponsive to most requests and this seems to be a common complaint amongst their XXXX reviews. 
The photo below shows two occasions I was supposedly served on- one of which ( XXXX ) which is incorrect. I was never served or notified of a bank levy.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I sent an {$800.00} via XXXX, which is tied to my Chase debit card, to a person who falsely presented himself to be an employee of a company that installs accordion shutters. About a month later, I determined this was a scam and the service was not rendered. This person blocked my number and stopped responding. I filed a police report and contacted Chase to dispute the charge. They opened a case and in less than 24 hours I received a letter stating there would be no credits to my account as the transaction was authorized. I called their toll free number to find out how they came to this conclusion, as well as file an appeal since I have proof and a police report showing I was scammed. The representative asked me to upload a photo of the report, stating the case would be reopened but that there is no guarantee that it will be approved. Per the Chase mobile app, the case remains closed and it appears I have no recourse.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I logged into my account to make a payment of {$1300.00}. I completed all necessary steps to initiate the payment and received a message indicating that the transaction was " completed. '' However, I did not receive a confirmation number for the payment. 

On XX/XX/year>, I logged in again to make the XX/XX/year> payment and noticed that my account reflected a past due status. I attempted to contact Mr. Cooper, which required multiple attempts due to their phone system and extended wait times. During this call, I was informed that Mr. Cooper had attempted to contact me to notify me that my payment was late. However, because Mr. Cooper 's outbound caller ID is disabled, I was unaware of these calls. For security reasons, I do not answer calls from unknown numbers. 

Upon becoming aware of the outstanding balance, I immediately paid the overdue amount of {$1300.00}, plus a late fee. On XX/XX/year>, I logged in again and made an additional payment of {$1300.00} to cover the XXXX bill on time. 

Mr. Cooper 's website appears to have had a processing issue, as I received a " completed '' message but no confirmation number. Despite this, I fulfilled my payment obligations promptly once I became aware of the issue and even paid the late fee. Mr. Cooper is now incorrectly reporting that I was 60 days past due. Additionally, Mr. Cooper 's practice of disabling outbound caller ID when contacting customers creates a risk of credit issues for customers who do not answer calls from unknown numbers, or exposes them to potential scams if they do. 

Despite multiple requests, Mr. Cooper has not corrected or made changes to any of the above.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was served with a civil action from RAS LaVrar , LLC in regard to a debt I owe XXXX. I responded in a prompt and timely manner on XX/XX/year>. I attempted to send a letter to them on XX/XX/year> as well. That letter was returned to me as saying the address was not valid, yet it was listed on all of the legal paperwork as their office in the state of Georgia, where I reside. I kept calling the courthouse because I received nothing in regard to the hearing. I finally was able to get in touch with RAS LaVrar to which they told me I missed my court hearing which was scheduled for XXXX XXXX, and if I was not informed, it was the fault of the courts. I went down to the courthouse and the clerk informed me that they didn't file anything, there was no court hearing set and they had no additional information to give me. I called back RAS LeVrar while I was at the clerk 's office and the representative woman on the phone was very evasive, and wouldn't give me any information as to the supposed court hearing. After multiple attempts, she confirmed that I missed this supposed court hearing. The court clerk, upon hearing that confirmed that there was no court date ever established, and no documents were ever subsequently filed. I asked if they wanted to speak with the clerk as I was at the courthouse and they said they were unable to do so. They say all of these calls are recorded so there will be a record of each of these interactions. I will be reporting their office to the Georgia XXXX XXXX as well as the Georgia Attorney Generals Consumer Protection Division.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Collection Agencys : LVNV Funding LLC Charging Amount : {$750.00} Dear Sir/ Madam : Im writing in regards to the above-referenced debt to inform you that I am disputing this debt. Please verify the debt as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

I am disputing this debt because I do not owe it.

Because I am disputing this debt you should not report it to the credit reporting agencies. If you have already reported it please contact the credit reporting agencies, inform them that the debt is disputed, and ask them to delete it from my credit report. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate, or failing to report information correctly, violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Finally please note that I do not wish to received further telephone calls or letters concerning this debt that I do not owe to your client. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act requires you to request. See 15 U.S.C 169 ( C ).

Thank you for your attention to this matter

Product: Mortgage
Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the application process
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is my second request for a loan modification with Citizens, and the entire process has been unbearable. I can't even walk into a branch to speak to someone directly. Every time I call the number they provide ( XXXX ), I get routed overseas, which adds to my frustration. Explaining my situation to someone in another country who cant truly help, and then being unable to get transferred to someone who can, is wearing me down. I can't take this back-and-forth with Citizens Bank any longer . Then not being able to visit a local branch for any help. Its just awful. Try being in my shoesalone, with no one to help, and trying to navigate this nightmare of a process. Every step feels like a brick wall. No one at Citizens Bank is there when I need them. I cant even walk into a branch and talk to someone face-to-face. Instead, I call their number ( XXXX ) and get routed overseas to someone who cant help, who doesnt even understand the situation, and Im stuck explaining my struggles over and over again, getting nowhere. 

Letters continue to come in, first saying they need more information, then saying my modification is under review. This has been dragging on for nine months, and it's showing up on my credit score. Its unbelievable to me that Im being held to a score in a system that feels broken while Im just trying to stay afloat. My situation is serious, and I need Citizens Bank to either lower my interest rate or, at this point, even consider erasing the loan. The stress has become overwhelming. 

Citizens Bank rejected my modification because I missed their tight deadlineI wasnt even home when the package arrived. I returned it late, but giving just six days, including a holiday and weekend, is simply unreasonable. I had no idea the package was coming, and I was out of town. 

Ive been trying to work with the bank since XXXX, and all Im asking for is some understanding. I want to stay in my home, but now XXXX being forced to start this grueling process all over again. I need Citizens Bank to step in, lower my interest rate, or seriously consider erasing the loan. I can't handle much more of this. 

I spoke to this rep once XX/XX/XXXX and unlocked my credit as requested and haven't heard back. I am doing all the steps and getting no where. 
Relationship Manager Name : XXXX XXXX Phone Number : XXXX This entire situation has been beyond stressful. I uploaded all the required information back in XXXX, thinking I was finally getting somewhere. But instead of progress, I keep receiving more letters saying that the information is missing or not on file. Its mind-boggling because everything has already been uploaded onlineexactly as instructed. 

Yet, when I call, the representative cant even find the documents. Im stuck in this maddening loop of uploading everything over and over again, with no clear answers and no one taking responsibility for the mess. It feels like Im fighting a losing battle, and all the stress is piling on, day after day. I dont know how much more of this I can take..

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, Hello, First, thank you very much for reviewing our complaint. It means a lot to us. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, our house got foreclosed by Mr Cooper ( former known as Nationstar bank ) and we believe that this is a wrongful foreclosure.

1. They miss-led us After we received the notice of Trust Sale date, we contacted the bank to see if they can hold the trust sale date. They advised on the phone that if we can send a signed Purchase Agreement and the buyer 's Proof of Fund then they will hold the trust sale date to give us time to close the Escrow. 

Our house value now is around {$1.00} XXXX and the amount we owe is {>= $1,000,000}. The house value is well above the amount we owe, so we would have no problem paying off what we owe to the bank if we have time to sell the house. 

Because bank told us that they can postpone the sale date, we primarily focused on finding the buyer. 

We finally found the buyer who offered {$1.00} XXXX and all Cash transaction and submitted the documents to the bank. We even opened an escrow on this property and it was going to close on XX/XX/XXXX. 

At the last moment, one day before the foreclosure date, the bank declined our request to postpone the sale date. We called many, many times to postpone the sale date and they replied " The loan is too old and we can not postpone the sale date. '' The loan was old from the beginning and they could have told us that from the beginning then we could have focused on the other options. But they were giving us false hope to keep us from looking elsewhere. 

They proceeded with foreclosure on XX/XX/XXXX and now the Mr Cooper owns the property. 

We strongly believe that this bank did this on purpose to keep us from seeking another alternative and they can foreclose on the house. Making us believe that foreclosure can be postponed and don't look for another alternatives, and decline at the last minute so we don't have any other option. One representative even told us that he worked there for 21 years and he has NEVER seen a foreclose date postponed. We strongly believe that this is how this Mr Cooper operates to rob the houses from the distress home owner and make even bigger profit. We sincerely ask your help to look into their business practices to see if they really postpone the sale date. Or they try to lure customers into believing that the trust sale date can be postponed and keep them from finding another alternatives. 


2. This dis Dual Tracking. 

Me and my wife were trying so hard to keep this house so we sent Mr Cooper Loan Modification Package multiple times so they can modify the loan. On the date they recorded a trust sale date, XX/XX/XXXX, the modification package that we sent on XX/XX/XXXX was still under review. This modification package was declined on XX/XX/XXXX which is 14 days after they recorded Trust Sale. We even sent the Modification package on XX/XX/XXXX. Can they proceed with Trust Sale Date when the Loan Modification Package is under review? Isnt this in violation of dual tracking? ( RESPA 12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ( g ) ( 2014 ). This prohibited practice proceeding with a foreclosure sale while processing a complete loan modification application submitted at least 37 days before the scheduled sale is known as dual tracking. ) 3. Hardship My wife was diagnosed with XXXX XXXX years ago and we had to travel back and forth to XXXX to get treatment. She went through XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, etc. When they notified us of foreclosure sale date, which was 1 month prior to the foreclosure date, we explained many times and sent proof that we are experiencing extreme hardship, they would not accept it as the reason to postpone the sale date. They told us that only way to hold the foreclosure is to send them the Purchase Agreement and the buyer 's Proof of fund.

Unfortunately, we do not have the record of the phone conversations with them. They would record our conversation but if we record it, then they would not speak to us. But please find enclosed documents that prove that we had purchase agreement before the sale date and we have opened an escrow. We sincerely ask your help and look into this matter. Please help us get our house back so we can sell the house and pay the bank what we owe. 

Please Help!

Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/year> I went to auto-zone with my wife to purchase parts for an automobile. In the parking lot was a XXXX truck with a bunch of signs about XXXX XXXX steaks for {$40.00}. She wanted to see what the deal was. This company XXXX XXXX was having a meat sale in the XXXX parking lot and the salesman spoke to my wife and told her all the ribeyes were sold out and he said he had a better deal and talked her into buying a box of meat valued at {$1300.00} for {$200.00}. The company took my credit card and used a device to scan my credit card and said I would receive a text message receipt from XXXX. 15 minutes after leaving I received a text message receipt for {$470.00} and my wife wanted to go back immediately and return the meat for a refund. The salesman said if I read the bottom of the text message receipt it shows ALL SALES ARE FINAL he said he would need to speak to his manager whos not in XXXX Florida but is located in XXXX, Alabama. I gave him the box of meat back and demanded a refund for being charged {$270.00} more than the {$200.00} he said it would be. He said he would do something that would be getting him into trouble with his boss and keep the box of meat and refund me the {$470.00}. He said the refund would take 5-7 days and I would receive a receipt of the refund. I never received the refund and I contacted the company over 20 times and they never answered the phone and never returned any of my phone calls. 5 business days after not receiving a refund, I contacted Citi Credit on XX/XX/year> and opened a dispute and Citi refunded my money and opened an investigation and the company responded to them saying I didnt follow protocol for the refund. Said I needed to mail the meat back to Alabama and I couldnt return it to the salesman in the parking lot in XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL. The merchants bank refused the refund so Citi Bank Credit reversed the chargeback and charged me because the other bank wouldnt refund them. They said they understand and read over XXXX negative XXXX reviews I submitted to them with similar stories to mine. Bait and switch, overcharged prices from what was told, refused refunds and said all sales are final. The owner of the company responded to my credit company stating they do accept returns but I didnt follow there exact protocol. Many customers left reviews on XXXX stating they shipped meat boxes back to them in Alabama within a few days of the purchase and they company refused to refund them. My issue is Citi Bank for not refunding me because they stated the other bank was refusing to refund them and my other issue is with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative:
Chex Systems XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX MN XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Dear Sir/Madam I am writing to formally request that a security freeze be placed on my credit file, effective immediately, pursuant to Section 605A of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 ).

1. Restriction on Disclosure of Information ( Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) Pursuant to Section 604 of the FCRA, I demand that no disclosure of my personal information, including consumer reports, be made to any person, organization, or entity that is not legally authorized to receive such information or that does not have my explicit consent.

2. Right to Privacy ( Section 609 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) In accordance with Section 609 of the FCRA, I request written confirmation that my personal information, including any medical or insurance information, will not be disclosed to third parties without my prior consent, except as strictly required by law. This confirmation should detail the measures taken to protect my information in accordance with legal requirements.

3. Prohibition of Unauthorized Disclosure under Consumer Privacy Protection Laws Additionally, in line with federal and state privacy laws, I demand that no information contained in my file be disclosed to insurance companies or any other third parties without my explicit, written approval, unless required by law. Any unauthorized disclosure will be considered a violation of my privacy rights and will result in appropriate legal action.

I attempted to make this request through your agency 's online portal, but unfortunately was unable to complete the process. For this reason, I am submitting this request in writing to ensure that the credit freeze is implemented in a timely manner. 

Below is the information necessary to process this request : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, South Carolina XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX SS XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt is not yours
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this letter to formally dispute the validity of the debt being reported by your agency and to request immediate validation of the debt, as well as correction of inaccurate credit reporting to the credit bureaus. 

Account Information : LVNV Funding LLC Account Number : XXXX Date of Last Activity : XX/XX/2024 Amount in Dispute : {$2600.00} I have recently obtained a copy of my credit report, which revealed the presence of an account allegedly being collected by your agency. Upon careful review and analysis of the information provided, I have reason to believe that there are inaccuracies in the reporting of this debt. 

As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to receive validation of this debt. I kindly request that your agency provide me with the following information : 1. Verification of the debt amount claimed, including a detailed breakdown of any interest, fees, or charges applied.

2. Copies of all documents proving that I am indeed responsible for this debt, such as the signed agreement or contract with the original creditor.

3. Verification that your agency is legally authorized to collect this debt on behalf of the original creditor. 
I expect your agency to conduct a thorough investigation into the disputed debt and promptly provide me with the requested validation within 30 days of receiving this letter. If your agency fails to validate the debt or correct the inaccurate reporting within the specified timeframe, I will have no choice but to exercise my rights under the FDCPA and FCRA and pursue all available legal remedies to protect my interests. 
Please communicate with me in writing only and provide all correspondence related to this matter via certified mail with a return receipt requested. This will ensure a documented record of our communication.

Its a check from the United States XXXX XXXX Treasury!!! And you already deposited at XXXX point into my account, now you want to take it back and freeze all my finances. This is absurd, and their fraud department reads you the same thing over and over from a script and you get no answers about anything. Im looking into legal action if possible.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has willfully violated 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERALSubject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury, or a subpoena issued in accordance with section 5318 of title 31 or section 3486 of title 18.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

( 3 ) To a person which it has reason to believe ( A ) intends to use the information in connection with a credit transaction involving the consumer on whom the information is to be furnished and involving the extension of credit to, or review or collection of an account of, the consumerr They are to be hold accountable for damages in my APR which was at XXXX percent for XXXX months of An open end credit transaction with civil liability 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) IN GENERALAny person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; ( 2 ) such amount of punitive damages as the court may allow ; and ( 3 ) in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section, the costs of the action together with reasonable attorneys fees as determined by the court. 
( b ) CIVIL LIABILITY FOR KNOWING NONCOMPLIANCE Any person who obtains a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose shall be liable to the consumer reporting agency for actual damages sustained by the consumer reporting agency or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater. 
( c ) ATTORNEYS FEES Upon a finding by the court that an unsuccessful pleading, motion, or other paper filed in connection with an action under this section was filed in bad faith or for purposes of harassment, the court shall award to the prevailing party attorneys fees reasonable in relation to the work expended in responding to the pleading, motion, or other paper. 
( d ) CLARIFICATION OF WILLFUL NONCOMPLIANCE For the purposes of this section, any person who printed an expiration date on any receipt provided to a consumer cardholder at a point of sale or transaction between XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, but otherwise complied with the requirements of section 1681c ( g ) of this title for such receipt shall not be in willful noncompliance with section 1681c ( g ) of this title by reason of printing such expiration date on the receipt.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently reviewed my credit profile and noticed inaccuracies and false accusations and fraudulent accounts. I am formally requesting that these be investigated properly with immediacy. This is my second time asking these credit agencies XXXX to remove these collections : MG CREDIT XXXX, Original Creditor Name XXXX XXXX XXXX, MG CREDIT XXXX, Original Creditor Name XXXX XXXX XXXX Both of these charge offs have already been paid off in full by me as well as when the original creditor sold my information and filed tax without seding me a copy of the 1099 which is required by law.

This agency is in violation of 15 USC 1692g. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was not notified. As the original creditor, only I can validate this debt. I do not validate this debt. The reporting of these account ( s ) is/are violations of 15 USC 1681 , and the Fair Credit Reporting Act [ 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ] : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS. They were to notify me of this in writing 5 days prior, I was never notified as the original creditor, only I can validate this paid debt. Therefore, the following accounts must be deleted from my reports immediately. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) the following accounts, they have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions. I am not liable for this collection they have not provided me with the original contract as I have requested several times. 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( i ) states transactions and experiences between the consumer and the person making the report are not included in the " consumer report ''. By Law, the IRS defines a charge off accounts as cancelled debt that you have to pay taxes on meaning the charge off accounts are now earned income for me the consumer. Collections & Charge offs accounts over {$600.00} reporting to my consumer report is tax fraud. By Law companies are supposed to send me the consumer a copy of the 1099 from the accounts that has been charged off written as loss. The collection is now income by IRS law states that income can not be reported as debt. Please remove this account from my report this is against the law and is considered tax fraud. The account information listed directly above is inaccurate, and I dispute the validity of each. As per the FCRA you must delete all entries to my credit file that can not be proven to be accurate. Likewise, you must provide me with your Method of Verification. You are a partial owner of the XXXX system, which has proven to be unreliable for the intended purpose of my dispute and does not constitute the legally required independent investigation that you must conduct. For clarity, the sections of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of 1970 which are referenced within this letter are : Section 604, Section 609, Section 611, and Section 623. I will assume that by the very nature of your business, I do not need to provide definitions of what is covered under each of these sections individually. The Information as Shown Below Must Be Investigated Immediately. Failure to Provide Adequate Details, Method Of Verification, Accuracy Of All Dates, Amounts, and other pertinent information will result in the immediate filing of formal complaints with the CFPB and the FTC. I reserve my right to sue you civilly in the court system, which will result in my seeking the maximum allowable penalty for each item. Should I require assistance, it will be sought through an attorney, dependent on your response to this letter. Thank you very much for your cooperation. My ID has been attached as well for verification purposes.

The following accounts are : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX account # XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX Original creditor : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX This is not a refusal to pay, but a notice that your claim is disputed. 
Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt you claim that I owe you. I am requesting proof that : I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt ; the date of the alleged medical service ; the name of the patient ; and proof that there is some contractual obligation which is binding me to pay this debt. 
Please attach copies of : Any agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt, or proof of acquisition by purchase or assignment, and authorization under subtitle D of the ARRA, SEC. 13401. APPLICATION OF SECURITY PROVISIONS AND PENALTIES TO BUSINESS ASSOCIATES OF COVERED ENTITIES ; and SEC. 13407 ( 1 ) BREACH OF SECURITY.

The term breach of security means, with respect to unsecured PHR identifiable health information of an individual in a personal health record, acquisition of such information without the authorization of the individual.

Please note that enforcement of penalties against you is covered under the penalty rules of the Omnibus Final Rule effective XX/XX/XXXX interpreting and implementing various provisions of the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) as issued XX/XX/XXXX and the penalty rules of the FCRA and FACTA including FACT Act changes final rules effective XX/XX/XXXX. 
Please also attach copies of any agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor, and, as this is a medical account, a copy of any HIPAA authorization. 
Please also be advised that this letter is not only a formal dispute, but a request that you cease and desist any and all collection activities, including reporting of, or verifying of this account on my credit reports. 
They have violated my rights 15USC 1681-602A states I have the right to privacy ,15USC 1681-604A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written consent and instructions.

I require compliance with the terms and conditions of this letter within ten ( 10 ) calendar days, or a complete withdrawal, in writing, of any claim. 
In the event of noncompliance, I reserve the right to file charges and/or complaints with the OCR on your HIPAA violations and appropriate County, State & Federal authorities, the CFPB, XXXX and State Bar associations for violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and Federal and State statutes on illegal collection activities on any account that may be time-barred as well as violation of FLORIDA medical privacy rules .

I also hereby reserve my right to take private civil action against you to recover damages.

Product: Debt or credit management
Consumer complaint narrative:
I began using Tally in XX/XX/XXXX to manage my credit card debt. Initially, they provided a lower interest rate ( 18 % ) than my existing rate, and from XXXX to XXXX, they delivered on their promises. However, in XXXX, Tally raised the interest rate to 22 %, which undermined their original offer of debt relief. Once linked, Tally would sometimes " buy out '' debt without explicit notice. While the option to turn this off may have been buried in the app settings, there should be more explicit permission given to transfer over $ XXXX worth of debt overnight. 

Recently, I was informed that Tally was going bankrupt, and my account was sold to a third-party collection agency. This company has locked in the higher interest rate and is now planning to report the debt to credit agencies, which will negatively affect my credit score. Additionally, they are charging new fees ( $ XXXX {$10.00} ) for every payment! 

Tally initially promised a way out of debt by not reporting to credit agencies and offering a lower interest rate. This abrupt change in terms feels like a bait-and-switch tactic that will significantly harm my financial standing. I had worked diligently to pay down my debt between XXXX and XXXX and would have cleared it entirely if I had known Tally would sell my account to a private debt collector with such unfavorable terms. Furthermore, the consumer reports for the new company seem to indicate poor administrative strategies, commonly resulting in incorrect numbers being reported or payments not being counted correctly and promptly. 

This experience has been a breach of trust, and I seek immediate resolution, including the possibility of canceling the debt. Many Tally users are in a similar situation. 

I look forward to your response. 

Thank you,

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, my credit card was charged by XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$980.00}. Subsequently, I noticed a billing error in the amount of {$240.00} and have made several attempts to contact the merchant and resolve this billing error. Unfortunately the merchant never responded to my multiple communications. 

On XX/XX/2024, I initiated a credit card billing dispute with Barclays. The dispute case ID is XXXX. 

On XX/XX/2024, Barclays sent me a copy of merchant response to my billing dispute. The merchant response itemized billing items, including the item that was billed in error. I provided additional supporting documentation to Barclays to explain the billing error. 

On XX/XX/2024 and XX/XX/2024, I received additional communications from Barclays notifying the case is closed without resolving the billing error. No further documentary evidence was provided by Barclays to explain its decision. 

In accordance to the section 1666 ( a ) ( B ) ( ii ) of the Fair Credit Billing Act, the creditor shall send a written explanation or clarification to the obligor, after having conducted an investigation, setting forth to the extent applicable the reasons why the creditor believes the account of the obligor was correctly shown in the statement and, upon request of the obligor, provide copies of documentary evidence of the obligor 's indebtedness. In the case of a billing error where the obligor alleges that the creditor 's billing statement reflects goods not delivered to the obligor or his designee in accordance with the agreement made at the time of the transaction, a creditor may not construe such amount to be correctly shown unless he determines that such goods were actually delivered, mailed, or otherwise sent to the obligor and provides the obligor with a statement of such determination.

By closing this billing dispute without providing documentary evidence to support its decision, Barclays has violated the Fair Credit Billing Act.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear TransUnion, I, XXXX XXXX XXXX is am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of an account listed on my TransUnion credit report as of XX/XX/XXXX. The account in question, reported by XXXX XXXX District Attorney 's Office with the reference number XXXX, is erroneous and has been reported without proper validation or legal authority.

Details of Disputed Account : Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX District Attorney ( Child Support Enforcement ) Account Type : Open Account Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$46000.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX Status : 120 days past due as of XXXX XXXX Monthly Payment : {$0.00} Past Due Amount : {$0.00} Reasons for Dispute : Lack of Due Process and Judicial Order : The child support debt reported in this account lacks a valid judicial signature and does not meet the due process requirements as set forth by 28 USC 1691. No evidence of a proper court order authorizing the enforcement of this debt has been provided. Without valid legal authorization, this debt should not be included on my credit report.

Violation of Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : This alleged debt has not been validated under the provisions of 15 USC 1692g. I have not been provided with the necessary documentation, including a judicially signed order, proving the legitimacy of this debt. Without validation, the inclusion of this account on my report violates the FDCPA.

Failure to Verify Information as Required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), credit reporting agencies must verify that all information reported is accurate and substantiated. This account can not be legally verified due to the lack of proper court documentation and validation, making its inclusion unlawful.

Request for Action : I am requesting that TransUnion immediately take the following actions : Remove the Erroneous Account : Delete the XXXX XXXX XXXX account ( Ref : XXXX ) from my credit report due to the lack of validation and improper legal documentation.

Notify All Parties : Notify all parties who have accessed my credit report in the last six months of this correction, as required by the FCRA.

Provide Written Confirmation : Once this account is removed, provide me with written confirmation of the deletion.

Please consider this letter a formal dispute under 15 USC 1681i ( a ). If this matter is not resolved within 30 days, I reserve the right to pursue all legal remedies, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing civil action under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
