Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : XXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX for Violations of XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and Other Consumer Protection Laws Dear Sir/Madam, I am submitting a formal complaint against TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX for multiple violations of federal laws, including 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ), 15 USC 1691 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act ), 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ), 12 CFR 1002 ( Regulation B ), and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 ). These violations have caused significant harm to my financial status, disenfranchised me from fair credit opportunities, and infringed on my right to privacy.

Violations of 15 USC 1666b ( Credit Billing Act ) The credit reporting agencies have failed to provide timely corrections or deletions of disputed information, including negative and outdated entries, closed accounts, and inaccurate addresses. Despite my attempts to resolve these matters, they continue to report incorrect information without following proper procedures under this statute. 

Violations of 15 USC 1691 and 12 CFR 1002 ( Equal Credit Opportunity Act and Regulation B ) TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX have unlawfully shared my personal and financial information with banks, loan companies, and other institutions without my explicit written consent. These actions violate my rights under the ECOA and Regulation B, further restricting my access to credit and loans.

Violations of 15 USC 1692c ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ) These agencies have continued to share inaccurate information with third parties after I explicitly requested they cease such activity. This violates 15 USC 1692c, which governs the conduct of information sharing without the consumers consent, leading to ongoing financial hardship and privacy breaches.

Violations of 15 USC 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ) TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX have failed to comply with key provisions of the FCRA : 1681b They lacked permissible purposes to access or distribute my credit report and provided negative information without my authorization.

1681e They did not follow reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy of the information reported, resulting in negative entries that I have previously disputed.

1681c The agencies failed to remove outdated and inaccurate information, including closed accounts and former addresses.

1681n & 1681o These agencies willfully and negligently failed to comply with the FCRA, resulting in ongoing financial harm to me.

Violations of 15 USC 6801 ( Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ) The agencies violated the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act by failing to protect my nonpublic personal information, sharing it with third parties without my explicit consent, and not providing me with the necessary protections outlined under 6801.

Violations of 15 USC 45 ( FTC Act ) Their actions constitute unfair and deceptive practices under the FTC Act ( 15 USC 45 ). The continued unauthorized dissemination of my negative and inaccurate information to third parties violates this statute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is kind of a long complicated story. 

On XX/XX/year> I went to see a veterinarian looking for the best one to treat my bird, XXXX, whom I had for XXXX  years. This was a third opinion and this vet knew that. He used unfair business practices and deception to make me choose him. One of them being, telling me he was the only board certified XXXX XXXX this side of XXXX XXXX. He disparaged my current vet. I stopped my search for the most qualified vet then because he told me there were no others. Not true. He, ade me do expensive tests to determine if she would be ok for XXXX. That visit was {$330.00}. 

He called me a couple of days later telling me that she was ok for XXXX. I scheduled XXXX for the XXXX of XXXX. She never woke up after XXXX. XXXX months later, when I finally was given her medical records, her test results showed she was not ok for XXXX. He lied to me to get the sale, {$1500.00}. 30 days later only because I told them to, they credited me around {$250.00}. The total amounts in question are {$330.00} and {$1200.00}. 

A lot happens in between. 

I then started contacting Care Credit through Synchrony bank. Disputing the charges base on being lied to and his failure to provide the expected care from the expert he claimed to be and the only reason I let him care for the most important thing in my life. 

Synchrony bank refused to work with me and closed my account and turned me over to collections. My credit score went from a XXXX to a XXXX. 

I contacted synchrony corporate office and explained the problem. I sent them a thick envelope full of proof and they sided with the doctor based on one paragraph of lies. This vet uses these deceptive practices on other clients as well. I sent them all the proof they would need and even offered my phone records to prove that the doctors office was lying. 

Synchrony has denied my claim and my credit score has suffered because I refuse to pay for someone to receive me and be wreck less with my precious bird. The credit card company will not even consider consumer protection roles I thought they needed to follow to protect consumers from fraud. I have more documents if you need them. I've tried working with them to resolve this issue but they are unwilling to protect me from these unfair business practices and deception.

Consumer complaint narrative:
JP Morgan Chase Bank NA submitted a 1099-C to the IRS in XXXX but they never attempted to collect the debt from me or notify me from when it was charged off in XXXX. This account was charged off in XXXX when I was divorcing my ex husband and we were using XXXX XXXX to handle and settle and make payments on our accounts. According to Florida Law the statue of limitations were up in 5 years which was XXXX. This was illegal activity from JP Morgan and not only that, there was never any attempt to collect the debt from me. They never attempted to collect, and all this time later is a violation of Florida collection laws. There was NO ACTIVITY TO COLLECT in 7 years. 

The IRS form XXXX statute of limitations sets the timeframe during which the IRS can assess additional taxes or the taxpayer can amend returns related to canceled debt income. Here are some key points : Typically, this statute extends for XXXX years from the due date of the tax return with reported canceled debt income1.

You should receive Form 1099-C by XXXX XXXX the year after the debt was canceled or forgiven2. 
Generally, there is no statute of limitations on a 1099-C, but the creditor does have to send you the form promptly so that you can include it on your tax returns3. 
Statutes of limitations vary by state and by type of debt, but creditors are not required to file a 1099-C at that time since they can continue to try to collect on debt indefinitely4.

My consumer rights are protected as The UCC states ( a ) A person is not liable on an instrument unless ( i ) the person signed the instrument, or ( ii ) the person is represented by an agent or representative who signed the instrument and the signature is binding on the represented person under Section 3-402. The UCC requires that any contract for the sale of goods that is worth {$500.00} or more must be in writing and signed by the person the contract is being enforced against. Under UCC Section 3-401 ( a ) If the party does not sign, the party can not be held liable. XXXX claims the information is not on my credit report yet XXXX is the only company continually reporting the info for which I am disputing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
See below ; the events occurred in XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX : I put a check in the mail for approx. $ XXXX USD that was for the IRS. Later in the month, I saw that the check cleared via the Chase app. There was no picture of the check, so I assumed the check cleared to the IRS. 

XX/XX/XXXX : As I was preparing my XXXX taxes, I noticed the check was a mobile deposit to an unknown person into a Chase account. I went to a Chase branch the next day to explain the issue, and I was told by the staff this was fraud and I would get my money back. Two weeks later, I went to Chase again and they escalated this to the fraud department. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Chase said it had been too long from the time the check was cashed to when I reported it. The branch manager agreed this was wrong, and she wrote a letter to the Fraud department but it was denied. The branch manager told me to file a police report and send through to the Fraud department.

Product: Mortgage

Consumer complaint narrative:
Truist Bank- WORST CASE OF DISCRIMINATION, UNFAIR LENDING PRACTICES TO INCLUDE DECEPTIVE AND MISLEADING LOAN PROCESSES. 
We applied for a new construction loan on XX/XX/XXXX, received a pre-approval letter on XX/XX/XXXX and spent the next month in a half sending an excessive amount of information ranging from a letter of explanation referencing how our XXXX person business will operate if we live XXXX hrs from our worksite and other documents totaling approximately XXXX pages of additional paperwork. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, we were denied the loan. Scenario : My husband and I make $ XXXX, have monthly debt of $ XXXX, own XXXX homes with no mortgages, own XXXX land properties with no liens, met Truist credit report requirements XXXX have a DTI of XXXX % and a XXXX ( k ) portfolio of {$260000.00}. WHY were we denied? Ill tell you why. Truist decided to use prejudicial reasoning to not take the risk and in doing so, attempted to dash our dreams of building our home. I have several emails that were misleading, deceptive and an attempt to deter us from proceeding with the loan. However, because we were eager to build our forever home, we cooperated and provided Truist with whatever they needed while expressing how we felt the information they were asking for was excessive and an attempt to discourage us from moving forward with the loan process. Truist decided to provide XXXX of the most blatant untruths and farce reasons for their denial. Its disheartening. 

XXXX denial reason-Because our business is XXXX hrs from where the home is being built Truist decided that hiring a new employee will have a negative impact on our business, therefore they could not use our joint income of $ XXXX. Are you serious? Businesses are operated from all over the Country and this was their excuse? My husband and I are the only XXXX employees of our company and I provided a letter of explanation prior to the denial advising that we would simply hire a driver to drive our dump truck. Its the easiest business to operate when youre XXXX XXXX  and XXXX and all you need is a driver. However, Truist used this as a denial reason. This reasoning was thrown against the wall to see if it would stick and they should be embarrassed. 

XXXX denial reason- We co-signed for our daughter to purchase a vehicle XX/XX/XXXX. Her car payment is $ XXXX. We sent bank statements showing how the money is transferred from my daughters account into our joint account each month and the payment is automatically drafted by the lender. We provided this information so that the {$270.00} was not included as part of our debt. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an e mail from our loan officer, XXXX XXXX, advising that the car payment was NOT counted as part of our debt yet Truist claimed it was our debt and used it as a reason for the denial. How misleading and deceptive is that? If they decided to count the {$270.00} as debt, we still could afford the loan with the amount of income we receive monthly as well as over {>= $1,000,000} in assets. This denial reason is without merit and again, Truist should be embarrassed XXXX denial reason- Truist advised that you are not allowed to show a late payment on your mortgage within 24 months and that we had a 30 day late payment on our HELOC. A HELOC is not a mortgage, its a loan so they misspoke. However, I checked all of my credit reports and we do not have XXXX late payment since we acquired our HELOC in XXXX so where did this magically appeared denial reason come from? Truist has no proof of this. How can you be a XXXX XXXX dollar company and deny potential customers based on untruths? 

WHY did Truist do this to us and why did we submit information for a month in a half just to receive the above denial reasons? Why were we dragged like rag dolls then disposed of? WHY? 

Ill tell you why. The denial was derived out of prejudice towards a too good to be true situation and the injustices that XXXX and XXXX people have and continue to endure daily. We worked extremely hard during this process and without delay, just to be denied for the above reasons that are not only blatant untruths but prejudicial. 

How do you deny someone who met EVER requirement? HOW? 

We are a successful XXXXXXXX XXXX  couple that was taken through the wringer and hung to dry. There are so many unfair lending practices that occurred during this process and its all in writing..from XXXX XXXX withdrawing our application citing my Husband didnt sign disclosures within 15 days when she never gave us a timeframe. Furthermore, it was because of her that he could not sign the documents ( documents would not load to our online portal ) .We were in constant communication about these disclosures yet without warning, she sent an e mail XX/XX/XXXX withdrawing our application and recommended that we reach out to our builder for assistance in finding a new lenderand this was after i sent an e mail asking for a status update. My mouth was agape. I had to reach out to her XXXX, XXXX XXXX, who had to reinstate our application due to XXXX wrongfully terminating our loan. If we were not fighters and had given up, our loan process would have ended that day. 

There are so many other time stamped issues that occurred during this process that was deceptive, misleading, lacked transparency such as lowering our loan amount ( by {$90000.00} ) without a reason. I had to ask for an explanation and told that our XXXX wasnt high enough. However, we had already gotten approved based on our XXXX falling within their guidelines. WHAT? This was all happening to us after sending hundreds of pages of documents. The discriminatory nature of how this process transpired is not only prejudicial but a true testament of how unfair lending practices are allowed to occur right in front of our faces. 

Many people do not know how to express this type of treatment. However, Im not one of those people. This process has caused me a lot of anxiety and stress. I am recovering from XXXX so stressful situations trigger XXXXXXXX XXXX  and other ailments that I can not afford to deal with yet Truist has put me in a bad physical and mental space. Im taking a maintenance XXXX XXXX  daily as well as have follow up appointments with my Oncologist monthly for lab work to ensure my XXXX has not return as there is no cure for my type of XXXX ( Multiple XXXX  ). 

I must continue to fight for what is right and Im pleading to your organization to assist me in righting the wrong that has been caused by Truist Bank. 

Thank you for your time

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Attempted to collect wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative: I was living at ; XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; # XXXX, fir almost 6 years, About a year, and a half ago, I was experiencing the tenant above me constantly playing very loud music. At that time my lease was about to expire ; and the leasing office sent me a noticed to renew, I was not going to renew this lease ; However, I was sent a text by management, that if they lowered my lease amount, would I reconsider staying ; I replied back that I would, I also told them about the Loud music. I really did not know that it was the guy above for sure, but I was told that they would address it. A few months later, I noticed that the noise was starting only when the tenant upstairs came home from work, I called the leasing office, to inform them, that it was in fact the tenant above. Before they called me back, they call the guy upstairs to ask him if it was him, He told them no. They chose to believe him instead of me. A few mounts past, I was working ; However, I got laid off a my job, so I began to do some work at home. One evening, when the guy above me came home, the music began, I don't know was it was, I was watching television, I just decided to turn off my power for the television, and the music stopped ; I was shocked. So from then on, I started doing this everyday. I went to my cable company to let them know what was going on, and they suggested that I change boxes, So I did< several time. This did not work. I requested a that they send someone out to check if this guy was hacking into my cable, I was told that he was not ; I became more frighten ; All the while I was sending weekly information to the office of what was going on, they did nothing to try to investigate this issue ; I am XXXX XXXX XXXX, and live alone, I began to get stressed. I could not figure out what he was doing. Our unit were designed with the same layout. One night I came home ; I decided to test my electricity, so I tuned off my circuit breakers, I could hear upstairs in his unit that everything upstairs has also stopped. His unit had wood floors, and he was a heavy set guy, so I could also hear him walking around in his unit, and what part of the unit that he was in. When the breakers went off, I could hear him moving around in the one area, it sounded as if he was working on something. I was so scared that I called the police, and made and complaint, I was also sending management information about what was going on ; and instead of them trying to check out anything, they chose to try to find anything, and everything to complain about me. I started turning my breaker off before going to work, and coming home in the dark. Still management did nothing. the last thing that made me decide to leave was, one night I came home, I was so tired, I took my shower, fix something to eat, and went to bed, however, I noticed that my A.C. was not running, I always leave my air running ; this is Texas, and it is always hot here. I tried to turn the temperature down so that the A.C. would kick on, it did not ; so I changed the batteries, still nothing happen, I went to sleep, thinking that it would start back on it's own : About XXXX XXXX, I woke up after hearing the guy upstairs pacing the floor, when I noticed that I was sweating, I got up, went to look at the A.C ; it was at 85 degrees. I turned it on, and off. Nothing happened ; I call the emergency number for the office told them that, The guy upstairs had be tampering with my electricity, caused the A.C. to stop working. NO one called me back ; mean while I could hear him moving very fast in the exact same area, as if he was doing something, The A.C began to work. I made up my mind to move for my own safety. I was not safe living there at all.I was there for almost 6 years, nerve was late on my rent, never miss a payment.I did not want to move. I needed to be safe.

Product: Credit card

Consumer complaint narrative: I received my monthly statement and noticed interest fees when Ive made my payment in full. I called in and looked back at prior statement to see that Id also been charged interest on previous months I paid my balance in full. When I spoke to the representative about this, I was told that Capital One reserves the right to charge interest based off previous monthly balances regardless of the status of payment. This didnt make sense to me so I asked them to clarify as from my understanding, if payment is made for the full balance interest should not be charged. The representative reiterated that they base interest on the average balance of previous month statements. I asked if I paid my balance in full and made no charges, would I still be charged interest regardless of no purchases being made. I reiterated again that it does not make sense that Capital One has the ability to charge interest of charges already paid. The representative reiterated that the interest is not charged on the actual charges themselves but prior average statement balances regardless of the payments that are made. They implied that Capital Ones policy is to look back over a two month period and charge interest based on the average of those statement balances regardless of any prior payments that are made.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Problem with fees
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Chase Freedom Card provided no clear information about charging foreign transaction fees. I already have a Chase Sapphire Reserve card, which, along with most advertised credit cards today, does not charge foreign transaction fees. 

When I went away on vacation last month, Chase quietly racked up Foreign Transaction Fees on my account, without notifying me. Foreign Transaction Fees are not clearly stated on the website, in any advertising for the card. I get emails and letters constantly from Chase, and text messages, they could have and should have told me my charges overseas were incurring foreign transaction fees. 

ESPECIALLY since I have another chase card! They should have immediately messaged me to tell me that my transactions were incurring fees and that I should consider using my other card. 

These charges occurred between XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year> totaling {$110.00} When I called Chase after getting home, twice, they were obstinate and refused to overturn the charges or refund me. This is RIDICULOUS. I am charged hundreds of dollars per year for all three of my Chase credit cards. It is ridiculous and unfair to charge foreign transaction fees in addition, stealing money from consumers, when these should be CLEARLY STATED on the website, marketing materials and inside of my chase portal. I should also have received notice and warning about incurring these fees instead of them sneakily ending up on my statement. 

How can you call a credit card a FREEDOM UNLIMITED and then charge foreign transaction fees that most other cards no longer charge?!?! That is insane... it is false marketing. 

I am demanding a refund of {$110.00}, this is plain wrong.

I am writing to formally file a complaint against National Credit Systems ( NCS ) regarding an alleged debt that has been reported on my credit file. I am disputing this debt and requesting that NCS provide proper documentation and legal proof of assignment as required under federal law, specifically the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and 15 U.S. Code 1692g.

Request for Validation and Assignment Documents : In accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1692g, I am requesting that National Credit Systems provide the following : 1. A copy of the assignment agreement between the original creditor and NCS that grants them the authority to collect this debt.

2. Proof that NCS has a legitimate right to collect this alleged debt.

3. A complete account history that includes a breakdown of the amount owed, including how the balance was calculated.

Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1642 ( a ), any attempt to collect a debt without proper documentation is a violation of the FDCPA. NCS has yet to provide this proof, despite my previous attempts to resolve this matter. 

Grounds for Removal : Since NCS has not yet provided the required documents proving legal ownership or assignment of this alleged debt, I am requesting that this collection be removed from my credit report under the following case law : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : In this case, the court found that debt collectors must provide documentation that proves they have the right to collect a debt. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : This case established that failure to verify a disputed debt with sufficient documentation results in a violation of the FDCPA. 

If National Credit Systems can not provide the necessary documents, I believe they are in violation of federal law, and I am requesting that they immediately cease collection efforts and remove the negative reporting from my credit file.

I am writing to formally express my profound dissatisfaction with the handling of my dispute claims, particularly concerning the XXXX transaction, {$1200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX by the Found dispute team, specifically XXXX. The lack of thorough investigation, dismissive responses, and refusal to provide transparency have led to an unjust denial of my claim and a complete erosion of my trust in Found 's ability to protect its customers. 

The dispute team 's insistence that an internal funds transfer indicates an intent to make an unrelated transaction is illogical and demonstrates a lack of understanding of basic financial practices. Despite providing clear evidence and explanations to the contrary, my concerns were repeatedly dismissed. The team 's refusal to provide any evidence or reasoning behind their decision further highlights their lack of transparency and accountability.

I am appalled by the lack of professionalism and customer service exhibited by the Found dispute team. Their failure to adequately investigate my claim and their dismissive attitude towards my concerns have left me feeling helpless and violated.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a message that I was part of the automatic full relief group in the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX case, and that I would be reimbursed by XX/XX/XXXX, along with these loans removed from my credit report. 

I had the loans originally with Salle Mae, which then went to Navient as part of their restructuring ; and ultimately a couple of years ago I refinanced them with XXXX due to the interest rate accrual with Navient seeming wrong. As far as Navient or Student Aid looked at it, these were paid off, as they were now sitting with XXXX via a loan. As such, I have been expecting a refund from the portion paid to Sallie Mae / Navient which was mentioned would be reimbursed under the conditions of the case. I also expected these to have been removed from my credit report. 

To date, these have not been removed, and I have yet to receive any refund, or an update to my case. I sent a few messages to StudentAid.gov, who mentioned that the situation sat with Navient and to follow up with them. I reached out to them, who originally told me I needed to go back to StudentAid.gov to handle my case. So, it just went around in circles. I then received an update from Navient, indicating that my loans did not qualify for reimbursement. I inquired a few times why this was the case. The loans were Federally backed loans originally with Salle Mae ; I had no choice that it was converted to Navient. Further, even with Navient ; all but one of my loans indicated they were federally backed, including the interest that indicated " The interest rate on your federal student loans is set by federal law '' further showing that these were federally backed loans. They all had the same interest rate, a much lower rate then my higher private loan with Navient. 

I still have not been able to get any updates, or refund. I would appreciate any help which you may be able to provide, to ensure this reimbursement and update on credit report is expedited.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This company is reporting information that is inaccurate. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 611 [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] A reinvestigation of disputed information : " ..the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is INACCURATE and record the CURRENT status of the disputed information, OR delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. '' In paragraph ( 5 ) it states ; " If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall '' - ( I ) Promptly DELETE that information..

I also request a description of the procedure as stated in paragraph ( 6 ) ( B ) ( III ) which states " a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency ... ''

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello, On XX/XX/year> I sent a transfer for {$700.00} which was advertised as no fee. I approved a withdrawal of that same amount. To my surprise Western Union ( WU ) charged {$710.00}. Which means they just helped themselves to {$13.00} from my bank account without my authorization. I filed a complaint a week later. At the end of XXXX they sent me a letter saying that they will refund in a form of either receiver going to get the money or I have to go and receive the refund at WU location and I MUST reply via mail to chose which one. It is so ridiculous because they should just either sent a check since they're mailing me letters anyway or just issue a refund via ACH. They're clearly making this extra difficult so that people give up. I chose to receive the funds myself. XX/XX/XXXX I received a letter with information on how to receive the refund and new tracking number. On XX/XX/XXXX I went to WU 2 locations and both told me they can not find anything about this. I called the WU customer service and they claimed that the refund is half of what I'm owed, even though their letter says how much they owe me, and then they said that supposedly someone picked it up in Texas or somewhere, and I've never been there. They told me they're creating a case and I will hear back within XXXX. I didn't. I called again on XX/XX/XXXX and they told me that it's still being reviewed and I will hear back in XXXX. I called back today, on XX/XX/XXXX and still no information. 
I'm asking CFPB to intervene because it has been over 2 full months since I've been charged without authorization. CFPB should also look into the following : - WU needs to stop charging accounts a larger amount without being authorized to do so ; - WU must issue refunds in the same way they charged their customer or at the very least mail a check to the address that they already clearly have.

- WU needs to establish a clear resolution process with a certain deadline.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with fraud alerts or security freezes
Consumer complaint narrative: Thank you for submitting your complaint on XX/XX/year> through the CFPB Complaint Portal. We reviewed and considered the information you have supplied through the CFPB portal. Your CFPB complaint regarding your reinvestigation does not appear to have been sent directly by you or to be authorized by you. As a precautionary measure, we have not taken any action on the request. According to the federal Fair Credit Reporting Act, " if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a national consumer credit reporting company is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the company directly of such dispute, the company shall reinvestigate free of charge. '' Therefore, you can dispute any inaccurate information directly with Clarity for free. If you believe that information in your Clarity credit report is inaccurate or incomplete, please call us at the phone number that displays on your Clarity credit report. You also may write to us at the address on your Clarity credit report. Be sure to include the following information : Your full name including middle initial ( and generation such as XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) Social Security number Complete addresses for the past two years Date of birth One copy of a government issued identification card, such as a drivers license, state ID card, etc. One copy of a utility bill, bank or insurance statement, etc. Make sure that each copy is legible and displays your name and current mailing address and the date of issue ( statement dates must be recent ). We are unable to accept credit card statements, voided checks, lease agreements, magazine subscriptions, or postal service forwarding orders as proof of your address and identity. To protect your personal information, Clarity requires your authorization for any request on your behalf and we do not return correspondence sent to us. Send copies of any documents you wish to provide to us and always retain your original documents. Include the account name and number for any item on your report that you wish to dispute and state the specific reason why you feel the information is inaccurate. The dispute process may take up to 30 days. Once we complete the processing of your dispute, we will promptly notify you of the outcome. In addition, there is nothing a credit repair company can do for you, including removing inaccurate credit information that you cant do for yourself for free. We believe it is important to supply you with information about specific credit repair laws. The Credit Repair Organization Act, a federal law, prohibits credit repair companies from taking consumers money until they have fully completed the services they promised. It also requires such firms to provide consumers with a written contract stating all the services to be provided and the terms and conditions of payment. Under this law, consumers also have three days to withdraw from the contract. Please contact your local Attorney Generals office for further information regarding your specific state laws. For additional assistance, you may call the toll free telephone number provided on your Clarity credit report obtained directly from Clarity, or write to Clarity at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX. Thank you for submitting your complaint through the CFPB Complaint Portal. It is our policy to respond to consumer complaints swiftly and to take each complaint seriously. We appreciate you letting us know about your experiences with Clarity.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Other problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received an email from Chase Visa, alerting me that my new credit card statement was ready. The email was sent out to me by Chase on XX/XX/XXXX shortly before XXXX XXXX, but my statement was supposedly made available to me on XX/XX/XXXX, I download my statements and examine them to make sure that they are accurate and complete - and I have found errors in statements in the past, despite what Chase would have you believe. 

I tried to do just that, download my statement, and I wasn't able to get onto the bank 's website because the bespoke, 2-factor authentication system they have built for themselves did not work properly. So, I called the only number made available to me by the website, which is not the number I am told to call about my credit card. 

I pay Chase money every year, which supposedly qualifies me for additional benefits ( none of which I seem to ever actually qualify for, and most of which have been taken away over time ). I have one of Chase 's Sapphire Preferred cards. 

I ended up spending over 15 minutes on the phone, talking to two women who work for, Chase, who were completely unable to tell me what had happened. The woman who is supposedly the " tech '' support person working for the company, who was obviously an XXXXXXXX XXXX, was horrendous to work with. She was dismissive and rude, and refused to enter a trouble ticket, despite my telling her that I want to know what happened in the system validation process that caused me to not be able to get to my account quickly, and to have to interact with her in the first place. 

As I noted above, I pay Chase for the use of this card, and Chase also takes the highest fees allowed by VISA to process transactions I make using the card. I think Chase owes me some explanation other than " it's a system, and glitches happen. '' We live in an era of ever mounting ways to be stolen from online, and I want to know what Chase has operating behind the scenes when I log onto their website to complete my banking with the company. I am fed up with banks and shopping sites losing my personally identifiable information, and their employees acting as if it's just not a problem. 

IT IS A HUGE PROBLEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

I want my government to start to hold banks like Chase to account for these kinds of issues. I want to know what happened today when I tried to get into my account online- an account I use for Chase 's benefit, not mine in reality - and I want a better explanation than " it's a system, sometimes glitches happen. '' Glitches only happen when some system doesn't perform properly, and I should know what the problem was today, at least sufficient for me to understand what system failed to share what information that was needed. 

I want good security on my bank accounts, but I do not want that security to impair my ability to get into those accounts when I want to get into them ; and when such impairment occurs, I expect Chase 's people with whom I have to interact to understand that their airy-fairy explanations do not meet appropriate standards for this customer.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Company closed your account
Consumer complaint narrative: I opened this account in XXXX  and they charged my credit card {$150.00} annual fee. I called and spoke with someone in the XXXX because they use a call center there. I spoke with the rep advised them that I was thinking about closing my account because they charged me a {$150.00} annual fee and I have other cards that dont charge me any annual fee. So he says that is associated with your account so I will go ahead and close your account. I then was like can I speak to a manager. He then hesitated and then he hung up on me. So called back spoke to XXXX and I told her what happen and she said your account is already closed and asked me if I wanted her to reopen my account. After asking for a manager but I advised her that I never gave him authorization to close my account. I asked for her to give me his name of the person I spoke with for my records. She said she cant see the previous person names that a customer spoke with. Then she said only and initial. She went to get a supervisor and I was on hold for a while and she came back and said no supervisor is available. She then said can I call back. I said shouldn't they call me back when one is available. So that way they dont keep just saying that there is no supervisor. I also asked if there was a domestic supervisor I can speak with she said I called but they didn't answer. Then I told her to make sure my account is open because I never gave authorization to close my account. She reopened the account. She did towards the end give me the rep initials that closed my account without permission XXXX. Not sure what that means.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Collection Agencys : Plaza Services Charging Amount : {$2900.00} Dear Sir/ Madam : Im writing in regards to the above-referenced debt to inform you that I am disputing this debt. Please verify the debt as required by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 
I am disputing this debt because I do not owe it. 
Because I am disputing this debt you should not report it to the credit reporting agencies. If you have already reported it please contact the credit reporting agencies, inform them that the debt is disputed, and ask them to delete it from my credit report. Reporting information that you know to be inaccurate, or failing to report information correctly, violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act. 
Finally please note that I do not wish to received further telephone calls or letters concerning this debt that I do not owe to your client. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act requires you to request. See 15 U.S.C 169 ( C ). 

Thank you for your attention to this matter

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem making or receiving payments
Consumer complaint narrative: I have already filed 2 complaints ( this is third ) regarding this ongoing issue with Citibank and they are keeping my funds and ignoring all my attempts to get it back. As of today they have not resolved this and are ignoring all my communications to them. I need the loan disbursed to me asap. I have been making monthly payments to SBA so I don't default on the loan and ruin my credit. Citibank is refusing to do return my funds to me even after I have provided everything they have asked from me. Here was the original compaint and the issue I'm having : On XX/XX/year> I had my SBA EIDL loan for {$23000.00} deposited into my Citibank checking account. Citibank immediately froze my account and I was told by their fraud department that they will have to investigate the funds. After about 2 months they closed all my accounts and said they will return the money to SBA. It has been over a year now and SBA has not received the funds back. My loan is still active and I'm due to start making payments on it. I've called Citibank dozens of times and spent hours at a time trying to get someone to help me figure out why they haven't returned the money and to provide something in writing that shows why and where my loan funds went. They refuse to do so and most of the time the representatives just hang up on me after spending almost XXXX hours at a time on the phone. Their call center is outsourced and it is very hard to understand and communicate with their agents and they are very unhelpful. They keep telling me they will need to talk to someone in the " back office '' and they transfer me there but either they hang up or I would just be on hold for hours without anyone answering my call. I went into the branch and they also have to call the same number and go through the same process customers do so going into a branch was no help at all. Please help me get my loan returned back to SBA. I don't want to be stuck paying a loan for 30 years that Citibank stole from me.
